loans.name: Casa Hamaqueras Group

texts.es:
El grupo la “Casa de las Hamaqueras” está integrado por  tres mujeres trabajadoras las cuales se dedican a la fabricación de hamacas o su material desde muy pequeñas. Las familias de estas han laborado en ello desde  hace siglos. Este producto artesanal es de gran trayectoria y demanda en Nicaragua por su gran variedad de estilos y colores por ser versátiles, livianas, transportables, cómodas, económicas, duraderas y vistosas.

La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora  Evangelina  L. Gonzales quien elabora y vende manila artesanal la cual es utilizada especialmente para la elaboración de hamacas. El negocio en sus inicios era pequeño y no contaban con suficiente  productos ya que no disponía de capital para invertir. Este en la actualidad ha ido aumentando y con el préstamo lo surtirá con más colores e hilos. 

Las otras integrantes son Amalia V. y Ana S. quienes realizan hamacas desde hace años según comentaron el inicio de su negocio fue difícil ya que no contaban con recursos necesarios hoy en día este ha mejorado significativamente.
texts.en:
The group "Casa de las Hamaqueras" is composed of three hard working women who have been making hammocks and hammock material since they were very little. Their families have worked in this industry for centuries. This artisan product has an important history and is in high demand in Nicaragua because of the variety of styles and colors making hammocks versatile, light, transportable, comfortable, economic, durable and pleasant to look at. The coordinator of this group is señora Evangelina L. Gonzales who makes and sells the thick yarn which is used for making hammocks. At first, when the business was small, without available capital to invest, they didn't have enough products. Now, it has grown, and with the loan they are requesting they'll be able to offer more colors and thread. The other members are Amalia V. and Ana S. who have been making hammocks for years. They say that at the beginning, running a business was hard since they didn't have the necessary resources, but today it has significantly improved.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Colored thread

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Mrs. Yang P., 28, is a seamstress in a garment factory, while her husband, Mr. Thorng Sithoeun, shown at the right of the photo, is a construction foreman. This couple has a young child who lives at home and who attends school. The family has faced difficulties in travelling to work or anywhere around their community for years. They always pay a lot of money to a taxi driver for their transportation needs. They have been encouraged by their neighbor to seek a loan from Kiva’s project partner, HKL, in the amount of $800, to be used to buy a used motorcycle, so they can use it to provide transportation.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Mutungo Kitiko, Kampala Group

texts.en:
In the photo, N. Rosemary is the first person on the right. With twenty-one years of well-grounded experience in the teaching profession, 43-year-old Rosemary is not a content woman. At issue is the low remuneration that teachers get, she not being an exception. She has struggled to give her children a worthwhile education.

This married mother of 5, is however, not holding a negative outlook on life. In her home area of Mutungo-Kitiiko, Rosemary has quite a reputation for her teaching skills and is liked around every school she teaches in. She, however, has not achieved her dream of being head teacher in the different institutions she has moved in.

Rosemary is hopeful that this loan will help her in educating her children and also in helping her upgrade in her studies.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees and other school financial requirements

loans.name: Shokria Ator Gull Group

texts.en:
Shokria is the group leader of Shokria Ator Gull group. And she lives in district 11th of Kabul Afghanistan. She lives together with her husband and two of her children who are students. And she wants to take a loan for her husband’s business. Her husband has a metal shop. He is a hard working man and tries to have a comfortable life and educated children. Through the loan her husband wants to expand his business and to buy some essential tools which can make his work easier, so shokria wants to take a loan for him.
He is confident that will do his repayments on time and will join for the other cycle loan soon.

loans.use: he wants to expand and progress his business

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak E. is 36 years old man who lives in Choes village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Sophea, are farmers.  They own 1.50-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living.  Aside from farmer, Sophea is also a tailor to earn more income to support her family. 

Sopheak decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support his farm crops and a sewing machine to support his wife's business. 

This couple has two children; one attends the local school and the youngest is three years old.  His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and sewing machine.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan is from the village of Arevshat in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is married and the proud father of two daughters and a son. He graduated from high school and also has training as a machine operator. Vachagan has been active in the agriculture production sector for 10 years. Vachagan raises cattle, grows vegetables and in his spare time repairs agricultural machinery. 

Vachagan is pleased with the credit services of AREGAK UCO and welcomes his participation in Kiva. He is looking for a loan to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers and tools for his machinery repair work. The loan will also help him more easily manage his cash flow during the growing season. With this loan Vachagan expects his income to increase by 40%. His family also supports relatives in the city with agriculture products grown on his farm.

Vachagan hopes to someday purchase new agricultural machinery to improve his business. He considers himself a hard working, sincere person. He has chosen farming because it is the most beneficial and feasible occupation in his village. He really enjoys being a farmer and likes his village especially since he is surrounded by his extended family.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, fertilizers and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Aufaatasi

texts.en:
Aufaatasi J. is 58 and married with 5 children. She sells taro, which she plants and harvests. Aufaatasi has 2 years of experience in this business.  Aufaatasi needs a loan of WST$2000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Aufaatasi joined SPBD. This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Aufaatasi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Kimba Children. Group

texts.en:
Alice K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'K. Children'. Alice is 42 years old, married, and has five children who range from 10 to 25 years old. She is a college student. She cares for two siblings.

For 8 years, she has been selling rice, oil and sardines in Thinkers' Village Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6, 000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice, oil and sardines.

She describes herself a polite person. Her goal is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, oil and sardines

loans.name: Sandalhan

texts.en:
Sandalhan U. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia in a ger- a traditional nomadic housing tent. Two of her children are students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Sandalhan works as a cleaner in Tirlik- the biggest market of the province. Her husband manages his clothing retailing business at the same market. Their net income reaches 320,000 per month. The two sell a variety of different clothing items. They began their business in 2006 with the loan of 500,000 MNT. This product expansion has proven to be a very profitable decision in that they were enabled to pay their children's tuition fees. 

Sandalhan is a modest and hardworking woman. For the future, she says, "My husband and I are working for our children and having them become good people in the future. We hope to see one day their care after graduating the universities". Sandalhan is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing items from Tashkent- a border city of China, for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda G., 42, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. A high school graduate, and able to raise her two children as a single mother.  One child is still studying in public high school and the other one is already working. 

Imelda operates a variety store (in the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP’s worth of cooking oil, or an egg). She earns a living by buying supplies wholesale and selling them at retail. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She hopes that her kids will have a comfortable and well-off future. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Edma

texts.en:
Edma Y. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 55 years old. Edma is widowed and has nine adult children. To make a living, Edma owns & operates a business selling snacks & other delicacies like baked rice cake or bibingka in the local community. Edma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Edma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Edma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de San Sebastian en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia;  La socia tiene  47 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica a confeccionar diferentes trajes para damas, caballeros y niños La socia trabaja desde hace 7 años haciendo corte y confección en su casa propia. La socia necesita comprar telas, hilos y botones.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para elaborar trajes de vestir. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “MUJERES UNIDAS”. This bank is located in the district of San Sebastian in the province and department of Cuzco.

The member is Sonia and she is 47 years old. She is a single mother of 2 children. She makes different clothing for men, women and children. She has worked for 7 years cutting and sewing clothes in her house. She needs to buy fabric, thread and buttons. She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to make clothing.  

The member is thankful for and values the loan in this way and is committed to making the payments according tho the established schedule.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to make clothing.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Sofía; ella es casada y tiene 2 Hijos; La socia trabaja preparando tortas y pasteles, ella los hace en forma independiente y luego los venD. en las diferentes tiendas o cafeterías, también prepara para diferentes eventos como matrimonios, bautizos y otros compromisos, ella le gustaría estudiar repostería y así poder aprender más tipos D. tortas y pasteles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar las tortas y también para comprar algunos materiales para la construcción D. su casa.


Los otros socios  se dedican a la ganadería, carpintería, pastelería y repostería, restaurant, venta D. chicha.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SAN ANTONIO” communal bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The borrower's name is Sofía; she is married and has two children. She works preparing cakes and pastries, which she does independently, and then she sells them in various stores and cafeterias. She also prepares her products for various events, such as weddings, baptisms and others. She would like to take classes in pastry making, so that she can learn to make additional types of cakes and pastries. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to prepare cakes, and also to buy some construction materials for her house. 

The other members work in ranching, carpentry, pastry- and dessert making, restaurant operation and the sale of chicha [a traditional beverage]. 

The borrower would like to thank those who are making her dream possible in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Buying supplies to make cakes, and also buying some construction materials for her home

loans.name: Odom

texts.en:
Mr. Odom K. (pictured here), 41, and his wife, Mrs. Set Un, 38, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for almost 20 years and have four children, one son and three daughters. One of their children works in a garment factory and the other three are in school.   
 
Odom is a security guard. He does not have his own transportation, so he spends a lot of money on traveling costs. Facing this, he decided to apply for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es:
Jaime, de 25 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, es profesor  y vive solo en su propia casa, es empleado del centro escolar del cantón Tierra Blanca y además es auxiliar contable de la adesco (junta directiva) de esta misma comunidad perteneciente a Jiquilisco.
Él es muy aplicado al trabajo pero además le ayuda a sus padres en lo que él pueda,  actualmente quiere ayudarlos a comprar ganado para el cuido y comercio es por tal motivo que está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar la inversión además que  también tiene otros gastos personales que desea cubrirlos con el mismo aporte del préstamo, Con este préstamo él estará ayudando a su padre para que se mantenga entretenido y no tenga mucho tiempo ocioso, ya que su único oficio seria atender a los animales, darles su alimentación y al llegar el momento poder comercializarlos y obtener ganancias para cubrir sus gastos.
El propósito de Jaime es ayudar a sus padres a obtener ingresos y trabajo para que puedan tener una vida cómoda, así también multiplicar el número de reces y seguir en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jaime, 25, lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután department.  He’s a teacher and lives alone in his own house.  He’s an employee of a school in Tierra Blanca and also is an Assistant Accountant at Adesco (governing board) of the same community in Jiquilisco.

He is very dedicated to his job but also helps his parents in every way possible.  He currently wants to help them buy cattle to raise for sale and this is why he’s asking for the loan in order to make this investment.  He also has some personal expenses that he wants to pay off with the loan.

With this loan he will be helping his father to stay busy and not have too much free time on his hands because his only job would be to care for the animals, feed them, and when the time comes to sell them be able to do so thus earning profits to cover his costs.

Jaime’s goal is to help his parents have a source of income and work so that they will have comfortable lives as well as increase the number of steers and continue in his work.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old, married, and has seven adult children. To make a living,she operates a specialized retail store. She has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns approximately 8000 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Jovita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.
Jovita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie S. is a married woman who lives in  Barangay Tandayag, Amlan, Negros Oriental.  She earns her living by operating a grocery store business.  Her husband Eddie, who is 48 years old, works as a transport mechanic to earn a living.  They have two children who are 17 and 20 years old.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 21 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosemarie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 22nd loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 which she intends to use to buy stocks of peanuts and dry goods for her grocery store so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children. Rosemarie S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through this program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.es: Ronaldo, de 29 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Deys de 26 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los años le han enseñado a Ronaldo, que tiene que trabajar muy duro si quiere que sus cultivos sean los mejores de su poblado y es así que con mucho esfuerzo a logrado que sus sembríos de café, achiote, piña y stevia, sean muy solicitados en los mercados de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil fumigar sus sembríos, ya que los químicos que usa son muy peligrosos. Con el tiempo, desea sembrar todas sus tierras, ya que así podrá mejorar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará plantas de café, ya que actualmente es lo que mejor se esta vendiendo.
texts.en: Ronaldo, 29, is a very friendly and hardworking man.  He lives in his own home with his wife, Deys, who is 26, and their 3 beloved children, for whom they want to provide a better quality of life.  Ronaldo has learned over time that he has to work very hard if he wants his crops to be the best in the town, and so with a lot of effort he has succeeded in producing coffee, achiote, pineapple and stevia crops that are highly sought after in the markets in the city of Pichanaki.  What he likes most about his work is harvesting his products.  He has been doing this work for 8 years, and what he considers most difficult is fumigating his crops since the chemicals he uses are very dangerous.  Over time, he hopes to cultivate all of his lands, since in this way he will be able to improve his production.  This is the second loan he has taken from MFP, and he has always been very punctual with his payments; he expects to do the same with this loan.  In his communal bank he is very supportive with the rest of his fellow group members.  With the 1,000 Peruvian soles he requests he will buy coffee plants, since coffee is what is now selling the best.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in her restaurant business.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en:
Nicasio C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 48 years old. Nicasio is married and has 3 children aged 21, 18 and 14. To make a living, Nicasio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Nicasio currently earns approximately 3000 PHP every month from farming. He hopes for his harvest to increase.

Nicasio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicasio has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nicasio is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma C. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 40 years old. Alma is married and has three children ages 16, 14, and 10. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Alma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional bags of maize for sale

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Johnna S. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Johnna is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Johnna owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating "tricycle" transport services. Johnna has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Johnna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Johnna is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the first loan taken out by Johnna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Justo Juez Group

texts.es: El Banco D. emprendimiento Justo Juez se encuentra en la zona norte son socias conocidas del lugar es un grupo bastante consolidado la mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la producción D. pan y venta D. cosméticos la presidenta la Sra. Carmen se dedica a la repostería ella realiza pan, galletas, tortas, y todo tipo D. masitas,  ella y sus dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar es una persona muy trabajadora uno D. sus deseos es el D. ver a sus hijos profesionales y convertirse en personas D. bien, viven en casa propia y así D. esta manera brinda mayor comodidad a su familia, con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración D. galletas y pan, y todas las socias  sacaron el crédito para aumentar su capital D. trabajo se fueron muy satisfechos y agradecidos con la institución.
texts.en:
The Justo Juez (Fair Judge) Communal Bank is in the northern zone.  The members are from the same area and know each other.  The group is very well-established.  Most of the members make bread and sell cosmetics.

The president, Carmen, makes baked goods.  She makes bread, cookies, cakes, and all types of pastries.  She has two school age children, and she is a very hard-working person.  One of her wishes is to see her children become successful professionals.  They live in their own house, and that provides her family with greater comfort.

She will use the money from the loan to buy supplies and ingredients to make cookies and bread.

All of the members took out the loan to increase their work capital.  They were very satisfied and grateful to the institution.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make cookies and bread

loans.name: Luisa's Group

texts.en:
Luisa A. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Luisa is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Luisa is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Luisa owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Luisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en:
Mutua M. has been in the construction and building business in Kikomba, Tala town. He earns an income of KES.10,000 per month. He is married to Rose, who is a business lady, and they have three children.

He has a good credit history with KADET LTD, and he is applying for his second loan.   He plans to buy bricks, cement and building materials to serve his customers well.

In the future, he plans to grow his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and building materials

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: Hoa Thi Nguyen is a 52 year-old-woman who lives with her two children in Yen phong district. She joined SEDA's credit program in 2009. When she received her first loan of  5,152,000 VND, she invested in opening a small restaurant  that serves breakfast. Her business has developed since then and has created stable income for her to manage her family expenses. She has been a good re-payer since the time she joined SEDA's credit program. To expand her business activity further, she wants to  borrow a loan of 9,184,000 VND.

loans.use: To expand more her business activity

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro, age 54, earns a living by offering transportation services, specifically motorela or habal-habal services, to local community members. Alejandro has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. He also purchases and sells fruits along with his wife. They have six grown children and live in the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. 
 
In 2009, Alejandro joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. He wished to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro has successfully repaid his most recent previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was employed as working capital. 

Alejandro is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for his business as well as to help pay for his utilities. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Alejandro from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 
 
About HSPFI:
 
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.
 
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for his business as well as to help pay for his utilities

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Altangerel is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in an outer district of the city. Her oldest daughter attends public school, while her youngest daughter attends kindergarten. Altangerel supports her family by operating two clothing stalls at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She opened her business in 2005 and gets help from her husband. She started by selling from someone else's stall but now owns a business that is worth 6,000,000 MNT. She is applying for a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to buy more clothes from China. She wants to have a good supply on hand for the very busy shopping season that's coming up soon. Her goal is to expand her business so she has enough money to improve her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fausto Bayardo

texts.en:
Fausto is 44 years old and lives in Tulcán, Ecuador with his wife and their 
two children, aged 22 and 14 years. He is cheerful, hardworking, humble, patient, and sociable. 
Fausto is a carpenter and he is seeking his first loan 
to purchase wood for his business. His art was taught to him by his father 
and he has perfected his craft over the years through his business. Thanks 
to his business, he is able to provide for his family. He works alongside his 
wife and a hired assistant. 
His business is established and is going well. He has a steady clientele that he serves.  He hopes that this loan will help him expand his woodworking techniques and improve his work. His goal is to 
grow professionally and expand his business by employing more people. 
By hiring more workers, he hopes to help his community.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married and is 49 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in her community. Estrella has had this business for seven years and she earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) monthly. 

Estrella is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional retail items such as soft drinks, instant noodles and canned goods to increase the capacity for sales from her business. In the future, Estrella hopes that her retail business will grow more in order to acquire more customers; thus, gain more income. She also dreams of saving more funds from the income that she will generate to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as soft drinks, instant noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Libertadoras 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LIBERTADORAS 1" porque para el grupo el llamarse asi lo relacionan con la igualdad de generos y obtener sus propios ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias. Esta ubicado en en el Estado de Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Florentina tiene 24 años, estudio hasta la primaria, es comerciante y tiene 3 hijos (una mujer y dos varones). Ella tiene una tortilleria desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, por lo cual piensa invertir en materia prima (maiz) y en algunas refacciones para su maquina de tortillas. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al prestamo piensa hacer crecer su negocio y de esta forma comenzar a tener mas ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a toda su familia. Debido a la gran demanda que tiene en su tortilleria quiere más adelante ampliar su local y mejorar su servicio.
texts.en:
This group is called Libertadoras 1 because the name reflects the equality of mankind. It also shows that the women are free to obtain income of their own so they can provide a better standard of living for their families. The 9-member group is located in Mexico state.

24-year old Sra. Florentina has primary-level education and is a businesswoman. She has a daughter and two sons. She has run a tortilla-making business for about two years, and she would now like to obtain more capital to buy basic ingredients such as corn and some spare parts for her tortilla machine.

Florentina is excited about the loan because it means she can expand her business and start to earn more money so she and her family can have a better quality of life. Because of the high demand for her tortillas, in the future she wants to enlarge her stall and improve service.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients such as corn and some spare parts for her tortilla machine.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is 30 years old and lives in Airport community. She did not attend school. She is  married and has three children between 8 months  and 10 years old and they all live at home. Her husband is a driver, and for the past eight years she been selling slippers and clothes. She started this business by selling  cookies. She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers and clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children and  send them to school.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 46 years old and married.  With two children in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Alicia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, etc.

In the future Alicia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Jose Vitervo

texts.es:
José Vitervo tiene 46 años de edad, es soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 
La V.R.C SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo Recinto San Jacinto Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales.

José se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales. Compra el productor en el local de Agro Insumos María y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea y otro tipo de abonos y líquidos para evitar la plaga en los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y compra de comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar un terreno para poder sembrar un poco más para obtener mayores utilidades para el bienestar de la familia.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre tranquilo, honrado y muy responsable, puntual en los pagos, le gusta salir a pasear  y le gustan las fiestas en especial el Carnaval.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Chillanes Canton, of the province of Bolivar in Ecuador. The. V.R.C.  SAN JACINTO is located in the San Jose del Tambo district of the San Jacinto parish belonging to the Chillanes Canton.  The members in this region are dedicated to agriculture, mainly the cultivation of corn, cacao, bananas, oranges, and the breeding of animals. 

Jose is dedicated to the growing of corn, cacao, bananas, oranges and breeding animals. He buys his products in Agro Insumos Maria and sells them every weekend at the San Jose del Tambo market.  He is asking for a loan to buy manure, seeds, supplies, urea and other types of fertilizer, and pest control treatment and to buy food for the animals he breeds in order to sell them later at a better price.

This loan will help him meet his financial needs and will improve the quality of his product and his farming activities. He faces challenges such as the fall of prices of the products that he sells, and middle-men.  His dream is to buy land so he can plant a little more in order to provide more income for the well-being of the family.

He is known to be a calm man, honorable and very responsible, punctual in his payments, and he likes going for walks and he especially likes the parties during Carnival.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, supplies, urea and other types of fertilizer, and pest control treatment and to buy food for the animals he breeds

loans.name: Carla Elizabeth

texts.es:
Carla, administra un comedor, vive con su esposo y su hija de un año de edad, ella aprendió el negocio por su madre, quien inicio con el comedor pero que se lo heredo para que le diera continuidad.
Actualmente necesita un mostrador de comida, que lo adquirirá por medio de un préstamo, esta será una gran inversión para el negocio, ya que contara con una herramienta más y muy valiosa donde podra exhibir los alimentos que prepara para la venta.
La aspiración de Carla es que su negocio sea más rentable, con mayor afluencia de clientes.
texts.en:
Carla manages a diner. She lives with her husband and one-year-old daughter. Carla learned this business from her mother, who started the diner but later passed it on to her so that the business could continue.

At the moment, she needs a food buffet that she will acquire through the use of this loan. This will be a great investment for her business because she will have another piece of valuable equipment that will allow her to display the food that she prepares for sale.

Carla’s aspiration is to have a more profitable business and increased customer traffic.

loans.use: to purchase a food buffet.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a farmer for over 10 years. In 2004, he decided to proceed with his business operation alone in his own farm. And today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase farming equipment. Hasan is very optimistic and estimates that with the coming harvesting, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment.

loans.name: Vidole Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VIDOLE est formé de quatre personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Bernadette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Bernadette est âgée de 63 ans et est mariée à un certain Joël. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit avec eux. Bernadette n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture, une activité qu'elle exerce passionnément depuis cinq ans. A côté de cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins tout en assurant les charges de son enfant, Bernadette vend des friperies dans son quartier. Bernadette s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter son stock de produit et donc son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Bernadette et les autres membres du groupe VIDOLE sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The Vidole group is made up of four persons who live in the same neighborhood. The leader of this group is Bernadette whose hand is raised on the photo.

Bernadette is 63 years old and is married to Joel. The couple has one child who attends school and lives with them. She did not attend school but learned sewing, an activity she has been practicing with passion for the last five years. In addition to this activity that allows her to provide for her needs while covering her child's expenses, she sells used clothing in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies from Benin. 

In order to increase her stock and thus her turnover and income, Bernadette and the other Vidole group members are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will be used to strengthen their activity in order to better meet their customers' demand.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing and various notions.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a rice-farming business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Letecia has been in this business for 28 years now. She also earns additional income from growing bananas. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Paulina; la socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es conviviente; la socia ahora se dedica al negocio de venta de vinos,ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes instituciones o al publico en general,ella vende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de vinos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar vinos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Paulina is 35 years old and lives with her partner.  Her current business is selling wine.  She makes her sales independently, taking her products to different institutions or selling to the general public.  She sells from 9.00am to 5.00pm and, through this business, she provides for her children.  Paulina would like to expand and improve her wine sales business.  She is requesting this loan to buy wine wholesale.

Paulina is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy wine wholesale

loans.name: Dugarmaa

texts.en: Dugarmaa is disabled and a loving mother of two. She lives in the Bulgan province of Mongolia with her husband and two kids. She got into an accident 2 years ago. Since then she always looks for a business opportunity that she is able to do. Now she sews at home and plants flowers for a living. Her brother sells flowers in the market. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says "Even though I am disabled, I have two beautiful kids to support so I can't give up." She is requesting 300,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to buy sewing materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza, está formado por 16 integrantes quienes invierten en diferentes actividades de producción la ayuda que les brinda la fundación, se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y les gustaría poder ir creciendo por medio de la ayuda de la fundación.
La Sra Lucina, tiene 33 años, es comerciante, tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida. Tiene 2 hijos uno tiene 13 años y la otra 10 años ambos están estudiando aun en la escuela. Ella nos comenta que sus hijos son su razón de ser y que ellos siempre la motivan a seguir luchando. Cuenta que tiene muchas ventas y pedidos por lo que solicita el crédito para poder cumplir con los pedidos.
La Sra Lucina pide el crédito para la compra de maíz, fideos, azúcar, harina, y demás productos, los cuales le servirán para abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, called Nueva Esperanza, is made up of 16 members who invest the support they get from the foundation into their various lines of work. They are in their second lending cycle with the program Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras and they want to keep growing with the help of the foundation. 

Lucina, 33, is a merchant with a small but well-stocked store. She has two children, ages 13 and 10, who are in school. She tells us that her children are her reason for being and that they motivate her to keep fighting. She has many sales orders, which is why she asks for a loan to be able to complete those orders.

Lucina asks for a loan to buy corn, pasta, sugar, flour and other products to stock her store and meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy corn, pasta, sugar, flour and other products.

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en:
Esperence is 59 years old and has six children age 28 to 32. 

She is a widow and she sells foodstuffs in a store that she has run for six years. 

She would like a loan to buy more beans to sell. Esperence will use any profits to create savings for her future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca, 25, is married with 4 children.  Two attend school.  She has been a farmer for 8 years and produces maize, milk and beans for the local market.

Jesca has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to venture into the poultry business.  She says the poultry business has good markets almost all year, unlike other farming businesses.  She adds poultry business is not influenced by insufficient rainfalls, like other farming businesses.

She however notes the lack of rainfall and high costs of inputs as major challenges to farmers.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose has been in the United States for ten years now. He decided to move from his home in Brazil to find better job opportunities. Back in Brazil, he spent most of his life doing house repairs and construction, something he does very well. Three years ago, he started his own construction company, operating the business formally for the last year. The company provides general repairs for residential and commercial buildings, painting, installation of granite countertops, and other services. Since he has two sons back in Brazil who still rely on him for financial support, it is important to Jose that his business is thriving. His vision for the future is to gain more contracts in the community and generate employment opportunities through the business.
Jose will be using this loan to purchase construction materials for future projects, while building his credit at the same time.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for future projects.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in the southern part of Mongolia. Her husband is employed. Her elder daughter studies in the first grade of school and her other two daughters are kindergarten students. 

Erdenechimeg has been running a food cart service since 2008. She usually comes to the train station to sell food to the passengers. But, to keep the food fresh, she needs to have a big refrigerator for the supplies for her business. She is an intelligent woman who says that "I would like to buy a big refrigerator for the supplies so that they can stay fresh and my sales and income will increase."  The total amount she is requesting is 500,000 MNT to purchase a refrigerator and television for her home.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and television for her home.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: Eliseo es un hombre trabajador de 37 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Ichupampa, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él trabaja como obrero agrícola y además se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar un terreno agrícola, en el cual planea sembrar cultivos orgánicos, con la venta de los cuales espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En el futuro desea poder contar con mayor cantidad de ganado y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Para comprar un terreno agrícola para sembrar cultivos orgánicos que pueda vender a un mayor precio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start up a mini-grocery shop.

loans.name: Rohati

texts.en:
Rohati, a member of MBK, is requesting for a loan of $150. Prior to becoming a member of MBK she was selling fried food only. However, after becoming a member of MBK and on attaining this loan, she will be able to operate a store with more comprehensive items and also raise chickens. Revenue of IDR70.000 will generate income of IDR40,000 while she sell the chicken once a month. 1 kilogram (about 2.2 pound) is sold for IDR8,000. She easily qualifies as a member of MBK through her ability to finance the purchase of a motorcycle from her earnings.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: General store

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana sells flower pots and pinatas made from clay. She has been doing this for 7 years. Currently she rents a store in the city market which is an hour drive from her home using public transportation. Turists and city people purchase her products. She plans to invest the money from the loan in new products to increase her sales revenue. This will help her give her four children a better education. Juana is part of Grupo P. 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

. JUANA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MACETAS Y PIÑATAS DE BARRO. LLEVA 7 AÑOS CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD. ACTUALMENTE RENTA UN LOCAL EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD, QUE QUEDA A UNA HORA DE SU CASA USANDO TRANSPORTE COLECTIVO . LE COMPRAN SUS PRODUCTOS TURISTAS Y GENTE DE LA CIUDAD, ESPERA INVERTIR EL PRESTAMO COMPRANDO MAS MERCADERIA PARA AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS QUE LE PERMITAN PODER DAR EDUCACION A SUS CUATRO HIJOS. JUANA PERTENECE AL GRUPO P. 1

loans.use: ALFARERIA

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is orginally from Apodaca, New Leon. She is married with four children. She hopes to offer her children a good education and improve their way of life. This was impossible to accomplish on only her husband's salary. Thus, she was motivated to start her own business selling soft drinks, ice cream, and snacks. She started her business four years ago in her own house. Little by little her reputation has grown among her neighbors, increasing her business' image.

To increase her sales, she hopes to improve the appearance of her business. It is for this reason she asks for a loan of 250 dollars, which she will use toward the renovation. She expects to pay off the loan in 3 months. This business is a very important part of Francisca's and her family's life, and they sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca es originaria de Apodaca, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella desea poder ofrecerles una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida, que sería imposible con el salario que su esposo recibe, esto la motivo a iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de refrescos, helados y botanas hace cuatro años, inició las ventas en su propio domicilio, poco a poco se ha estado dando a conocer entre sus vecinos y surtiendo mejor su negocio.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas desea darle un mejor aspecto a su negocio por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en remodelación, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de Francisca y su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Renovation

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en: R. Kurbon has his own shop in Ckalovsk. He sells different kinds of goods from household goods to electrical goods, toys, towels and so on. He wants customers to be able to find all the goods they need. He has a lot of clients, and his shop is one of the known shops in the area. He is always friendly with clients, and they are satisfied with his service. His nephew helps him in his shop when he is on the trip to purchase goods. (He is in the photo). In the near future he wants to expand his business by including new household goods.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Elcira

texts.es:
Elcira is a happy and kind grandmother who is 63 years old. She makes meals for her neighbors, who sit at her modest tables and enjoy her wonderful food everyday. She invests all of her energy in this so that she can proviD. that which is most important to her—the wellbeing of her son and herself.

Thanks to this effort, her son is close to finishing his university degree in pedagogy. However, the little money she makes is not sufficient to support him fully, since she has to deal with market prices, which are rising all the time. For this reason, she wants to increase her number of customers and thereby grow and be able to satisfactorily pay her daily purchases. This would allow her to cover all of her son’s expenses. Let’s contribute to this noble mother’s happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elcira, es una alegre y tierna abuelita D. 63 años, que se dedica a dar pensión a sus vecinos quienes día a día se sientan alrededor D. sus modestas mesitas y prueban su estupenda sazón y sus riquísimos platillos en el que vierte todo su esfuerzo diariamente, para poder cosechar aquello que es más importante para ella, el bienestar D. su hijo y el suyo.Gracias a ese esfuerzo su hijo esta a puertas D. culminar sus estudios superiores D. pedagogía; sin embargo el poco dinero que obtiene no es suficiente para apoyarlo plenamente, ya que tiene que afrontar los precios del mercado, que cada vez son más altos.Es por ello que desea incrementar su clientela y por enD. acrecentar y asumir satisfactoriamente los gastos D. sus compras diarias, que le permitirán cubrir todas aquellas necesidades que tenga su hijo.Contribuyamos con la felicidad D. esta noble madre.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to continue cooking her delicious meals

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin A. is happily married with 4 children. She is 38 years of age and comes from a semi-urban area in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs.She has been in this business since 2003 and needs a loan of $875 to buy more provision and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: I live with my family in Kot Radha Kishan, a small town in Pakistan since my birth. I am married and a mother of three: two girls and one boy. My kids are small and attend school except one girl who is small and will attend school in future. My husband is a day laborer and I sell and stitch blanket covers. I buy cloth in bulk for this business; my business is at its best in winter due to its high demand. My husband and brother also help me in this business. Last year, I invested a loan of $230 in this business. This year I plan another loan for this business.I am a group leader of few other women: Sughran B. needs a loan to invest in their milk business. Razia B. wants a loan to buy a  donkey cart.  Sufia B. has a tyres shop and wants a loan to improve it.I want these women to receive loans so that they can bring positive changes in their financial conditions.

loans.use: Expand blankets covers production

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul (her husband is pictured) lives in Khudat town. She was born in 1990. 7 years ago she started this business. The Ramazanov family does not have childlren. Now this family needs a loan of $950 to buy a cow to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more plastic bottles of water and hire more workers

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia is twenty-six years old and mother of four daughters who range in age from five to eleven, three of whom attend school. Her husband works as a security agent for a company.

Francia has been operating a small cafeteria for almost three years. She started her business with a loan she took from FSMA. Currently, her business is growing and she hopes that this growth can be constant. The entrepreneur also explains that she would like to have enough money to keep providing good education for her children and to buy a house in the future.

With her loan, Francia will buy products she needs to prepare her delicious typical Dominican food and satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: To acquire products and materials to prepare food for a small cafeteria

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Señor José is 36-years-old, and he lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. He is married and has 2 children, who are 10 and 13. His wife works as a receptionist and supports him with paying for their home's expenses.

Señor Zúniga is a driver, and he would like this loan to construct a garage. In the future, he wants to finish his house so his children have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. José tiene 36 años de edad, y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, es casado y le tienen dos hijos de 10 y 13 años de edad. Su esposa trabaja como conserje y aporta alos gastos del hogar.

El Sr. Zúniga es conductor y el préstamo lo quiere para construir un garaje a futuro terminar de hacer su casa y que sus hijos tengan una vivienda digna.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Risikatu

texts.en: Risikatu N. lives in Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells Agbo (a native medicine) and drinks, a skill that she acquired over 4 years. She has been in this business since 1996. She is 40 years old and is married with 3 children. She needs a loan of $350 to buy more drinks to enhance her business and to better serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy more Agbo (a native medicine) and drinks for sales

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mariama S. is 38 years old with three children. She was born in Atakpamé, but currently lives in Lomé. The area where she lives is somewhat far from the center of town, which makes it difficult for her to do get certain grocery items. Seven years ago, she had the idea to open a general grocery store to serve her area. This fulfilled a need in her local area, which is demonstrated by her increasing clientele.

This first loan will allow her to increase her stock of various general food products.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants, madame S. Mariama est née à Atakpamé mais réside actuellement à Lomé. Son quartier de résidence est assez éloigné du centre ville ce qui fait que l’approvisionnement en divers produits d’alimentation général lui est difficile. Il y a 7ans de cela qu’elle a eu l’idée de desservir son quartier en y implantant une boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle a répondu au besoin de son milieu ce qui est prouvé par une clientèle grandissante.

Ce premier crédit lui servira d’augmenter son stock en divers produits pour alimentation générale.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of staples and basic products for her store.

loans.name: Ester's Maelewano Group

texts.en:
Ester is 40. She is married and has a 10-year-old child. She also provides for two other people, 21 and 26 years of age. She has owned a small shop since 2004. Every day, she works from 6 am to 10 pm and earns about $140 each month.

Ester is aksing for a loan to buy salt, sugar, rice, and oil for resale. She will share this loan with her group members, who retail food and run small cafes.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her grocery.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 48 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 15, 18, and 8 years old. She has been a juice and bread seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Fatma is now seeking a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero, 48 years old and married with nine children, lives in Benin City where she sells provisions and soup ingredients, a business she started in 1988.  She goes to one of Benin's major markets once a day to buy her goods and takes them back to her neighborhood where she sells to her community.  

Vero has been borrowing for some time from LAPO Microfinance to help grow her business and has consistently repaid her loans.  She is hopeful that Kiva lenders will help her as well.  Vero is requesting a loan of $275 to enable her to buy more provisions and soup ingredients to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and soup ingredients.

loans.name: Judith Sanjuanita

texts.es:
Judith es originaria de Linares Nuevo León, es soltera y tiene 21 años. <

> Actualmente, solicita un préstamo por USD$225 a un plazo de 3 meses, con la finalidad de comprar ropa para su venta posterior. <

> Judith inició hace 4 años, primero vendía la ropa personal que no le quedaba o gustaba y al observar que obtenía buen os resultados optó por la compra ropa usada para su venta posterior, y asi ella siguió vendiendo y estudiando al mismo tiempo, cabe señalar que los ingresos obtenidos le permitieron solventar sus estudios y ayudar con los gastos de la casa. <

> La necesidad por estudiar y no ser una carga económica para sus padres motivo a Judith a ayudarles un poco llevando lo indispensable a la casa. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyen a Judith ya que ha demostrado ser una persona emprendedora! <

>
texts.en:
Judith is originally from Linares Nuevo León, she is single and is 21 years of age.

Currently, she is asking for a loan of $225 to be repaid in 3 months, with the goal of buying clothing to then sell.

She started four years ago, first selling her own clothing that did not fit her or that she did not like and, seeing good results, she decided to buy used clothing for resale and that way she continued selling and studying at the same time. It is worth pointing out that her income allowed her to afford her studies and to help with the household expenses.

The need to study and not be a financial burden for her parents motivated Judith to help them a little to bring in what is needed for their home.

I invite you to support Judith as she has shown herself to be an enterprising person!

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Felicita Alberto

texts.pt:
Felicita Alberto T. é natural de Chiconela província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 51 anos de idade, casada e mae de 4 filhos com idades entre 30, 29, 26 e 22 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta uma neta que vive com ela.

Felicita estudou até 10ªclasse e parou quando passou a viver longe da escola e havia falta de transporte, mudou se da província de Gaza quando concluiu a 4ªclasse e veio com a família para maputo, em 1978 casou se. Na suas andanças na vida trabalho numa ONG como auxiliar contabilista a 10 anos atrás.

Felicita vive de negocio de venda de carne, é dona do negocio a 7 anos, compra um kg de carne por 65,00mt e vende por 110,00mt , assim tem tido um rendimento mensal de 15000,00mt. Para Felicita este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva. E conheceu a através de amigas que eram clientes da Hluvuku.

Felicita tem planos futuros a construção de um talho e uma mercearia, dado que na zona onde desenvolve as suas actividades neste momento não existe nenhum talho.
texts.en:
Felicita Alberto T. is a native of Chiconela, a province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children with ages 30, 29, 26, and 22 respectively. She only supports her granddaughter who lives with her. Felicita studied until the 10th grade and stopped when she moved too far from school and did not have transportation. She moved from the province of Gaza when she finished 4th grade and came with her family to Maputo. In 1978 she was married. In her walk of life she has worked in an ONG as an assistant accountant 10 years ago. Felicita lives off her business of selling meat. She has been the owner of her business for 7 years. She buys 1 kg of meet for 65MT and sells it for 110MT. She has a monthly income of 15,000MT. This is her first loan through Hluvuku and with Kiva, and she was introduced to Hluvuku through friends who were already clients. Felicita has plans for the future to construct a butcher shop and a grocery store given that in the area where she conducts her activities no butcher shop exists today.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of meat

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 33 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She and her family live in Benin city, in Edo state, Nigeria. She sells crates of drinks in either wholesale lots or at retail, to her customers. Joy is requesting the loan amount of N102, 000 to purchase additional supplies of drinks for resale. She says thank you to all those who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of drinks for resale

loans.name: Amama

texts.fr:
Madame T. Amama est une revendeuse des céréales à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.  Elle n’a jamais bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES, et elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de haricot et 6 sacs de maïs.  Avec ce nouveau stock elle peut mieux vendre et servir ses clients.
Madame TCHADODOMOU est née à Wahala, une des villes de Togo, et elle est mariée avec monsieur BRAIMA Arimiyawu, un chauffeur.  Ils ont 5 enfants ensemble, et le revenue que Madame TCHADODOMOU peut gagner avec ce prêt va les aider dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Amama T. is a retailer of grain in Agoè, a district north of Lomé. She has never been a recipient of a WAGES loan, and she is requesting this initial loan to buy 10 sacks of beans and 6 sacks of corn. With this new stock, she can do better in her sales and server her customers.

Ms. T. was born in Wahala, a city in Togo. She is married to Mr. Arimiyawu BRAIMA, a chauffeur. Together they have five children. The income she can earn with this loan is going to help them cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans and corn

loans.name: Carolina Guadalupe

texts.es: Carolina Guadalupe B. de Rosales reside en el municipio de Apopa junto a su esposo, su madre  e hijos. Carolina a pesar de no haber cursado ni  la primaria ha sacado adelante su negocio por más de diez años, especializándose en la panadería, y actualmente amplió sus ventas y ha montado un pequeño depósito de bebidas. Carolina y su esposo solicitan un crédito para surtir más de bebidas su tienda y abastecerse de materia prima para su panadería, ya que el precio de esta ha subido en el mercado. Este crédito les permitirá percibir más ganancias para mantenerse económicamente a flote.
texts.en:
Carolina Guadalupe B. de Rosales lives in the municipality of Apopa with her husband, mother and children. Despite not having attended elementary school, Carolina has gotten ahead with her business for over ten years. She has a bakery and has recently expanded her business to include beverage sales. Carolina and her husband are requesting this loan in order to fill their shop with more beverages and to obtain the ingredients they need for their bakery. This loan will allow them to earn greater profits so that they can stay economically afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for their bakery and beverage shop

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
Ibrohim B. has been an active client of our loan progarmme since 2002. Ibrohim started his business practically from zero and, thanks to previous loans, he was able to build a profitable business. He is married and has 3 children.

Ibrohim is engaged in bringing in flour from Uzbekistan for re-sale, and he works also with direct suppliers. He has his own outlet selling flour. Ibrohim wants to import flour on a large scale to increase his business income so it is the best time for flour-selling. Ibrohim is asking KIVA for financial support in the form of a business support loan of 4100 STJ for 12 months. He thanks KIVA lenders for their support.

loans.use: large-scale flour selling

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is Forty-nine year old Ashura M. from Mwanza. She is married, with four children between the ages of twenty two and twenty eight. Ashura has been running a restaurant and soft drinks business since 2006. The business sells food and soft drinks like Coca Cola, Pepsi, and water. She works at the business for sixteen hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by his husband. Ashura currently earns about 370 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Ashura thanks you for her support

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene la responsabilidad de mantener su hogar, y gracias al apoyo de su pareja han logrado satisfacer las necesidades de sus dos hijos, quienes tienen lo necesario dentro de su casa donde habitan todos como familia. Todas las madrugadas Carlos sale a comprar pescado en las playas que están cercanas a su hogar para luego venderlo en el mercado mayorista, pues la venta de pescado es una de las actividades más rentables en su localidad, debido a que los comerciantes, ya sean mayoristas o  minoristas visitan ese mercado por la calidad y cantidad de productos. Esto favorece el negocio de Carlos, pero lo difícil es despertar a las tres de la mañana y salir a comprar el pescado para  luego trasladarlo al mercado, donde solo puede vender hasta las ocho de la mañana, ya que  los comerciantes sólo salen desde muy temprano, y si por algún motivos demora en llegar, tiene pocas posibilidades de acabar de vender su producto. Es por ello que en cuanto más pronto salga de casa, tiene mayor ventaja de terminar temprano. Con el tiempo, Carlos desea tener una asociación de comerciantes pesqueros para ver la posibilidad de exportar los productos o distribuir a diversas ciudades. Carlos es fundador del grupo que desde hace tres años se formó en MFP, y este es su quinto préstamo. Como presidente de su banco comunal tiene una grata experiencia de trabajar junto a sus compañeras, quienes son muy trabajadoras y comprometidas, a pesar de que por algunas circunstancias se llegaron a desanimar en algún momento, siguen trabajando juntos. Adquirir mayor cantidad de producto ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, y es lo que hará con los 1500 soles que ahora solicita.
texts.en:
Carlos is responsible for the maintenance of his home. He has been able to meet his two children’s needs thanks to the help of their mother. The children have everything they need in their house where they all live as a family. Every morning at daybreak Carlos leave for the beaches that are closest to his home to buy fish. He later sells them in the wholesale market. Selling fish is one of the most profitable activities in his area because the merchants, big and small, visit this market for its quality and quantity of products. This works to his favor. But, it is difficult to get up at three in the morning, and leave to buy fish to later take to the market, where you can only sell until eight in the morning. The merchants leave very early; if for any reason you are late getting there you have little chance of selling all of your fish. Therefore, the earlier he leaves home, the better chance he has of finishing early. In time, Carlos would like to have a Fishermen’s Merchant Association to see about the possibility of exporting or distributing products to different cities. Carlos is the founder of the group that formed three years ago in MFP. This is his fifth loan.
