As president of his community bank he has the gratifying experience of working together with his companions. They are very hard working and committed. In spite of the fact that under some circumstances they are momentarily discouraged, they keep working together. Acquiring more product will help him increase his income, and that is what he will do with the 1500 PEN that he is now asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 50 ans, 5 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des grandes familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage dans le quartier Bamanan kin  de Markala quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali
Elles font essentiellement le commerce de pagnes wax, de bois de chauffe, des condiments alimentaires, de céréales, la production de beurre de karité etc. Après avoir vu des cas de réussite d’autres femmes de Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali) qui ont pu mener des activités génératrices de revenus à travers Soro Yiriwaso, les membres du groupe s’organisèrent davantage pour intégrer le programme crédit, avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 25 sacs de mil, 10 sacs de haricot, 2500 kg d’oignon et  35 sacs de fakoye à moudre (plante sauvage utilisée dans la sauce surtout au nord du Mali). Elles s’approvisionnent à la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou auprès des grossistes et des producteurs. Les produits sont revendus en détail, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Kirango à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et pour la prise en charge des fournitures scolaires des enfants.
 Elles ont pour ambition de se procurer de matériels agricoles (charrues et boeufs de labour).
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi average 50 years of age and 5 children each. They live mainly in large polygamous families, and they know one another through community ties in the Bamanan Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They essentially do commerce in Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), firewood, condiments, grains, the making of shea nut butter, etc.

After having seen success cases of other Markala women who were able to run businesses and earn revenues through Soro Yiriwaso, the group members got organized more, so as to join the loan program. They are now on their fourth solidarity loan, which will be used to buy: 25 sacks of millet, 10 sacks of beans, 2,500 kg of of onions, and 25 sacks of fakoye (a wild plant used in making sauces, especially in northern Mali). Supplies are gotten at the weekly fairs of Diamarabougou from wholesalers and producers. The goods are sold retail, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men and women at the Kirango marketplace.

The group members each hope to realize an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used to make loan interest payments and to cover the cost of school supplies for the children. Their ambition is to acquire agricultural equipment (carts and oxen).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain and condiments

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’articles de mercerie, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2006 et s’approvisionne  au grand marché de lomé. Actuellement  elle veut augmenter  son  stock et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 6 pièces de doublure, des fils et d’autres articles de couture.
Elle est mariée et mère de d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman whose business consists in selling sewing supplies. She started this business in 2006, and gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. At this time, she'd like to bolster her stock and she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 6 pieces of linings, thread, and other sewing items. She's married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 pieces of linings, thread, and other sewing items

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: M. Sylvia is a businesswoman. She is 36-years old and single. She deals in stationery items and she also renders computer services and photocopying. She has been in her business for over 10 years. She is using the loan to purchase stationery items such as reams of paper, charts, pens and pencils, ink, manila papers etc. Her future dream is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase stationery items such as ream of papers, charts, pens and pencils, ink, manila papers etc.

loans.name: Max's Group

texts.en:
M. Max is a kind and friendly 40-year-old lady who is married with six children aged 22 – 11 years. She also helps to care for two orphaned relatives and two abandoned children. Of her children, one is at the university while the rest are in secondary schools. She works so hard to ensure that all her children reach university level and get good jobs to support themselves.

For ten years, Max has had a business dealing in agricultural products, buying and selling coffee and cotton from Mirarikye. The coffee and cotton are sold to the coffee factories and ginneries respectively, hence enabling her to make monthly profits of UGX 300,000. Her main challenge is that during the rainy season, the roads become impassable, hence increasing the cost of transportation of the produce.

Max employs coffee and cotton collectors and provides them with bicycles, hence enabling them to make enough purchases. She has a dream of owning a pick-up truck that will help to collect the produce from the furthest of villages and transport it to the factories on time. Her loan will be used to buy coffee for resale and to buy a bicycle to help in the business. In most cases, her loan money helps to replace business capital that is taken out for school fees.

loans.use: To buy coffee for resale and to buy a bicycle to help in the business

loans.name: Alvina

texts.es:
Alvina trabaja como vivandera (vende comida) y tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de su zona; el esposo es chofer asalariado. Ambas actividades constituyen su principal fuente de ingreso con que mantienen a sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 años y el otro de 6 meses; la familia vive en alquiler  en una casa ubicada en la zona German Busch del barrio Alto Lima.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de víveres como  papa, arroz, fideo, etc., por cantidad, así podrá tener un stock de materia prima para poder trabajar por un determinado tiempo.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar otro préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Alvina works selling food and she has a stand in the marketplace of her area. Her husband is a driver and he is paid a salary. Alvina and her husband use the incomes from their two jobs to support their two young children, who are 3 years old and 6 months old. The family rents a home that is located in the German Busch area of the neighborhood Alto Lima.

The loan that Alvina is requesting will be used to buy ingredients like potatoes, rice, pasta, etc. in bulk. That way she will be able to have a reserve of the ingredients that she needs to prepare the foods that she sells.

This is the second loan that she has received through Impro and her good history of making her payments on time has led Impro to approve her request for a second loan.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of potatoes, rice, pastas and other ingredients used to prepare foods to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely Baustista is a fifty-seven-year-old farmer and the mother of seven children. She helps her husband grow rice on their farm in order to provide for their children. Before they were just renting farm land, but because they have produced a better harvest, they were able to buy their own farm, which is a half-hectare in size.

Fely wants a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. She will buy fertilizers and chemicals that are badly needed to maximize the harvest.

Because she likes the services of CEVI, Fely still participates in the CEVI cluster meetings. Because of them she has had loans, received training and has insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline F. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 40 years old. Evangeline is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a "pansit" (fresh canton) business, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.

Evangeline is now requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her food products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evangeline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make her food products for sale

loans.name: Reine \

texts.fr: H. Reine est née vers les années 1976 à Adjara au BENIN. Reine est mariée à AZIZANON Benjamin employé à la société VITAL une société de fabrication d’huile. Reine et Benjamin ont 4 enfants. 3 de ces enfants en âge d’être scolarisé le sont déjà. La famille vit au quartier Ahouassa depuis 16 ans. C’est des diverses (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) et les condiments de sauce que Reine vend. Reine exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans. Reine a commencé par prendre de crédit à ALIDé depuis 2007. Reine est actuellement à son cinquième prêt avec ALIDé. Reine a pu amener son activité au  niveau où elle est grâce aux crédits d’ALIDé. Mais, Reine veut pouvoir faire ses achats en gros, c’est pourquoi  Reine sollicite ce prêt-ci de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Reine was born around 1976 in Adjara, Benin.  She's married to AZIZANON Benjamin, who is employed at VITAL, an oil production company.  She and Benjamin have four children.  Being of school-age, three of them are already in school.  The family has been living in the Ahouassa district for 16 years.  What Reine sells are sauce condiments and various other goods:  candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, batteries, candles, etc.  She has been in this business for 8 years. Reine began in 2007 by taking out ALIDé loans.  She's currently on her fifth loan with ALIDé.  She was able to take her business to the level it's at today, thanks to ALIDé loans.  But she wants to be able to buy wholesale.  This is why she's requesting this ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of concentrated products; boxes of pasta, detergent, Maggi bouillon cubes (shrimp and chicken); and sauce condiments.

loans.name: Arnylyne

texts.en: Arnylyne is married to Elmer, and they are living in Labni, Mabuslo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Both of them are only high-school graduates because they got married at an early age. They had a difficult life because they were both jobless during that time, until their parents gave them a small farm lot and encouraged them to plant vegetables so they would have a source of income. Since then, Arnylyne has started a vegetable vending business. With a small amount of capital, she acquires her products from Bambang public market, and sometimes she also sells their harvested vegetables. To further improve her business, she is now hoping to avail of a loan of 5,000.00 PHP from KIVA lenders. She hopes that through her business, they can continue to meet the needs of their two children and also save something for their future.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem is a 23 year old single man who lives in Nablus city,Palestine with his parents.He is a  grateful son who works very hard at construction in order to support his family. He is the one who handles all the family's expenses with a meager wage from construction.
Kareem is requesting a $1000 loan to help him in purchasing some construction tools to facilitate his job .He thanks Kiva and all its lenders for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing construction tools

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 62 años muy trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la tranquilidad de su hogar con su esposo (Rosendo), de 65 años, y también la acompañan sus hijos mayores: Grermer de 29 y Edilson de 21 años.

Ella se dedica, junto a su esposo, al alquiler de mesas de billar en la amplia sala de su casa. Para lograrlo sacó sus muebles e instaló este singular negocio, el cual tiene mucha acogida, sobre todo los fines de semana. Entre sus asiduos clientes se encuentran vecinos y amigos, quienes visitan su salón de billar para distraerse. 

Para el futuro, Gloria piensa comprar más mesas de billar y hacer crecer su negocio, ya que no tiene mucha competencia. Adicionalmente, esta trabajadora mujer, también se dedica a la costura durante las tardes y confecciona lindas prensas de vestir. 

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque conoce a todas las integrantes desde hace mucho tiempo. Además el dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en herramientas de costura y en su negocio de juegos (billar).
texts.en:
Gloria is a 62 year old woman who is very hard-working and dynamic. She lives in the tranquility of her home with her husband (Rosendo) who is 65. Her grown children, 29 year old Grermer and 21 year old Edilson, live with them. She and her husband rent pool tables in the large living room of their house. To do this she took out the furniture and set up this unique business. It is very well received, especially on the week-ends. Her regular customers are her neighbors and friends. They visit her pool room to entertain themselves. In the future, Gloria is thinking of buying more pool tables to make her business grow. She does not have much competition. Additionally, this hard-working woman sews during the afternoons, and she makes lovely dresses. This is the first time she has had a loan with MFP. She is in agreement with the work the communal bank does because she has known all of the members for a long time. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy tools for sewing and for her pool business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for sewing

loans.name: Mable's Group

texts.en:
Mable M. has been running a secondhand clothing sales business for six years and generally generates 30,000 Ugandan shillings per week in profits. She is married with four children, all enrolled in school, and she is the leader of her group in Ntungamo.

Currently Mable travels to several markets a week to sell her inventory. She believes that, with the continued success of her business, one day she will be able to set up a proper store and will no longer have to travel so much. She dreams of one day being able to help in the fight against HIV/AIDS that so devastates her country of Uganda.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius M. is an entrepreneur who is a married Tanzanian man. He runs a general shop at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases and sells different kinds of goods including bags, clothes and shoes. He has been in the business for six years. The business income helped him to construct a house and capitalize the business. He is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,400,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is  Isatu B., a 23-year-old single woman from Wilberforce, an area within Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. Isatu has one child, a girl, a year old.

Isatu has been a client of LAPOSL for some time now, and has taken out two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Isatu has a shop in Lumley market in Freetown from which she sells soap, toothpaste and creams. With her first two loans, she expanded the inventory of her shop and with her new loan, she decided to buy the same types of goods.

Isatu hopes her latest LAPOSL loan will allow her to move forward to an increased profit and a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her shop

loans.name: Celita

texts.en:
Celita S. is from Catadman Ozamiz City and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Celita owns and operates a fishing business. Celita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Celita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Celita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her fishing business

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en: Mrs. Maxima S. is from the village of Southern Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 72 years old. She is married and blessed with four adult children. She is a pensioner. Her primary source of income is her pension in the amount of 3,500 Philippine pesos monthly. In 2008, Maxima joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maxima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Maxima is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase housing materials. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Maxima from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English

loans.use: Purchase housing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Produce and sell palm oil

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en:
Theresah A. sells oil, onions, tomatoes and other food supplies at Elmina. She is married and has two children and received no formal education. Her husband is a reporter for a local FM station.

Theresah has been selling oil, onions and tomatoes for some time now. She supports her husband with paying school fees and family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more red oil, cooking oil, tomatoes, and other food supplies for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to support her husband building their house.

loans.use: To buy more red oil, cooking oil, tomatoes and other food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene más de 4 años en este negocio. A pesar de lo cansado que es porque tiene que levantarse muy temprano, ya que además tiene otro trabajo labora como conserje en un colegio público, y tenía que buscar el medio para generar más ingresos a su familia porque se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana para dejar todas las cosas hechas en su hogar, ir al colegio a realizar su trabajo y después salir a vender sus productos. Asa es la vida de Maria, pero no la desanima pues todos los días ella misma se da valor. Es por eso que recurre a este financiamiento con el fin de comprar materia prima. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y no quedar mal con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel works selling general groceries, which she has been doing for over 4 years. In spite of the weariness created by getting up very early, Maria also has another job as the receptionist at a public school. She had to look for the way to earn more income for her family so she gets up at 5 every morning to do everything around the house, go to school to do her job and then afterwards leaves to sell her products. This is Maria's life, but it doesn't get her down as each day she herself gives it value. It is for this reason that she requires this loan, to purchase primary materials. She dreams of expanding her business and not being bad with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y esta conformado por 16 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento Cusco.  Urubamba es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país. 

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta D. comestibles, venta D. dulces D. forma ambulatoria, venta D. llantas, venta D. productos secos, venta D. huevos, venta D. bebidas alcohólicas como la chicha (Bebida regional del Sur del Perú), venta D. animales menores y otros brindan servicio D. transportes y soldadura. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Alejandrina es socia del banco comunal Virgen Asunta, tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. La socia Alejandrina tiene tres actividades laborales como por ejemplo la crianza D. animales menores, la venta D. chicha, venta D. comida y venta D. verduras. La socia nos cuenta que hace 27 años que se dedica a la venta D. chicha, comida y crianza D. animales, ella compra animales pequeños del distrito D. San Jerónimo y después los hace engordar, ella lleva sus productos a vender por ejemplo, los días Martes, Jueves y sábados a la comunidad D. Chincheros y los días miércoles y viernes al mercado D. productores D. Pintacha.  Alejandrina nos cuenta que alquila un terreno para cultivar productos como por ejemplo maíz. La socia con mucha pena nos cuenta que los terrenos donD. cultiva sus productos fueron inundadas por las aguas del rió vilcanota dejando perdidas, ella antes toda la cosecha D. los productos vendia a 2,800 soles pero ahora está vendiendo sus productos a bajo precio y pésima calidad. La socia requiere el préstamo D. los 800 soles para comprar gallinas, ella aproximadamente comprara 100 gallinas crías y tambien comprara alimento para los animales.       
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “VIRGEN ASUNTA” communal bank is in its 5th loan cycle and is composed of 16 hard-working and enterprising people who are constantly looking for ways to get ahead in life and proviD., though their efforts, a better future for their children. The members resiD. in Urubamba province, Cusco department. Urubamba is a city that is renowned for its archaeological sites, its scenery and its history; it is a charming city in the southern part of the country. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities; such as: sale of food, sweets sales, and tire sales, dry products sales, egg sales, alcoholic beverage sales (like Chicha, a regional beverage from the south of Perú), the sale of small farm animals. Others proviD. transportation and welding services. The communal bank has had several loan cycles. The members state that they are happy and satisfied with the credit services, the savings and the training; they also appreciate the increase in capitalization they get from leaving their funds in a common account for a period of time. Alejandrina, 48, is a member of the Virgen Asunta communal bank. She is married and has 5 children. She is engaged in three different commercial activities: she raises small farm animals, sell chicha and sells food and vegetables. She relates that for the last 27 years she has sold chicha and food and has raised animals. She buys small animals in San Jerónimo, raises them and, when they reach proper weight, sells them. On Monday, Thursday and Saturday she sells in Chincheros and on Wednesday and Friday at the Pintacha farmers market. Alejandrina tells us that she leases land to farm her products, for example, corn. She regrets to inform us that the lands she uses to plant her crops were flooded by water from the Vilcanota River which caused major losses. She used to sell her products for 2800 soles but she now has to sell extremely poor quality product for a very low price. She needs 800 soles to buy chickens; she will buy approximately 100 chicks as well as feed for them. The members, as a group, are grateful for the opportunity they have been given and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 chicks as well as feed for them.

loans.name: Hada Luz

texts.es: La Sra. Hada Luz N. es comerciante, es casada tiene tres, dos de ellos están casado con ella vive solo una hija que aun no está casada y es su brazo derecho es la que la apoya bastante en este negocio, el dinero lo solicita para capital de trabajo compra de granos básicos como azúcar, arroz, aceite, jabón y cosméticos. Los créditos le han ayudado mucho  ya que ha crecido más en su negocio y ahora tiene más utilidades.
texts.en:
Hada Luz N. is a shopkeeper. She's married and has three children, two of whom are married, so only one daughter lives with her. She is still single and is her mother's right arm. She supports her significantly with the business. Hada Luz is requesting the money for working capital with which they will buy basic supplies such as sugar, rice, oil, soap and cosmetics. Loans have helped Hada Luz very much, so that now her business has grown and is more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic supplies for sale in bulk

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk T. is 46 years old and she is a villager who lives in Prey Mien village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soeun Cheng, are farmers who own a 5-hectare (12.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice and vegetables to earn a living.

In order to increase their income to improve their family’s standard of living, Mrs. Thouk T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

Mrs. Thouk T. is the mother of a child who is on the staff of a printing house. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying corn

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is 34-year-old young woman. She lives in a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 25 years.

She is a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son goes to school for education. She wishes to send all of her children to school but unfortunately due to little resources she couldn’t complete her wish.

Her husband is A. R. and he runs his grocery shop. His shop is located in the busiest market and due to this he faced competition with other grocery shops.

Nargis is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her husband’s grocery shop so he can maintain his customers and complete their needs on time.

She hopes to get good profit from this loan and then she will be able to enroll her other kids into school too.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Perfecta U. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Perfecta is widowed and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Perfecta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Perfecta has been engaged in her business for less than a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Perfecta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perfecta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Perfecta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Perfecta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase women's clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Con Suenos Y Metas Group

texts.en:
Lina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres con Suenos y Metas (Women with Dreams and Goals), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Lina’s group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and three children.

Lina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a fantasia or fantasy (a small store catering to women) by purchasing women's shoes, twelve blouses, twelve dozen rollers, combs, hair clips, shampoo, and a gallon of nail polish remover to sell.

Lina will use the profits to save towards buying a vehicle to make her life and her business easier.

loans.use: To buy women's items for her fantasia store

loans.name: Toetu

texts.en:
Toetu T. is 26 and married with 1 child.  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Toetu has 1 year of experience in this business.  Toetu needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Toetu joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Toetu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en: Sharif K. is 52 years old. He is married with four children. He and his family live in the Spitamen region. Sharif owns a minivan and offers transportation services. His business is the main source of income for the family. At the same time, he raises cattle and sells them in the market. Sharif has been in this business for 20 years and has gained rich experience in driving. Now Sharif is planning to repair some parts of his car and also purchase young cattle. That’s why he requested a loan of 6,000 Somoni. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for his minivan and buying cattle

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin T. L., 32, has one small child. She is a skillful tailor. She has been running a shop where she makes dresses and T-shirts for four years. Her business creates 150,000 VND in profit per day for her. She took her first business loan in 2006. Currently, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her shop.

loans.use: To expand her shop.

loans.name: Rustico

texts.en:
Rustico P. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. He is 58 years old and single. To make a living, he operates a barber shop, providing hair cutting services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over thirty-five years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rustico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. 

Rustico is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aurora;  La socia tiene 58 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, La socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, ella cría animalitos par la venta final  (cuyes, y aves de corral); La socia también tiene terrenos de cultivo de maíz y papa, ella junto a su esposo alquilan los terrenos y otras veces ellos mismos cultivan los productos para la venta al por mayor a los minoristas. La socia en esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Aurora belongs to the communal bank "Clorinda Matto de Turner."  This bank is located in the Calca district in the Urubamba province of the department of Cusco.

Aurora is 58 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She raises small animals (guinea pigs and barnyard fowl) to sell.  She also has some land for growing corn and potatoes.  She and her husband rent out the land, and at other times they cultivate the products themselves to sell at wholesale to the retail traders.  At this time Aurora requests a loan to invest in the purchase of small animals.  

Aurora appreciates and values the loan granted through these means, and likewise pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy small animals to raise

loans.name: Aracelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracely del Carmen O. A., fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora propietaria de una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de gaseosa hace 4 años. En la actualidad vende arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, chivería, pan, carne etc.

O. es madre de un pequeño de 4 años por el cual trabaja arduamente y sueña con mejorar su negocio y que sea una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Aracely del Carmen O. A. is a hard-working, determined and entrepreneurial woman. She owns a small grocery store, which she started by selling soft drinks 4 years ago. Currently, she sells rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, bread, meat, etc. 

O. is the mother of a little 4-year-old child, for whom she is currently working very hard. She dreams of improving her business and making it into a general store.

loans.use: Buying basic foods such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, dairy products, bread, meat, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, a sociable 36-year-old single mother of two, owns and runs N. Boutique for a living.  In her boutique, which she has run for two years, she sells clothes and shoes.  She also does farming in her rural home in order to earn extra income.  Grace has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy more clothes, clothes hangers and shelves for displaying clothes, and dreams of renting a bigger business venue in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, clothes hangers and shelves for displaying clothes.

loans.name: Alejandro Arturo

texts.es:
Alejandro de 28 años, es guardia de seguridad, Vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 4 y 2 años  en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ya que en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

La casa de Alejandro es de cemento y cuenta con agua y luz como servicios básicos aun le falta enlucir y necesita relleno en algunas paredes. Con esfuerzo él trabaja todos los días como Guardia de seguridad  para que su familia tenga una buena vida ya que su esposa es ama de casa y necesita pasar con sus hijos porque son aun pequeños. Una de sus metas es que su familia tenga una buena casa para que puedan vivir cómodos. Por eso el quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques y empaste para comenzar la renovación de su casa.

En el futuro él quiere terminar de construir su casa para darles una buena vida a sus hijos
texts.en: Alejandro is 28 years old and works as a security guard. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 4 and 2, in an urban area called Orquídeas (Orchids) since when it was discovered there were a lot of flowers, and today there is a park full of these flowers. Alejandro's home is made of cement and has basic water and electrical services, although it lacks plaster and some walls need to be filled in. With a lot of effort, Alejandro works every day as a security guard so that his family has a good life. His wife stays at home because she needs to be with the young children. One of his goals is for his family to have a good home where they can comfortably live. To do this, he wants to use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, cinder blocks and filling to begin the renovation of his home. In the future he wants to finish construction on his home and give his children a better life.

loans.use: Purchase cement, cinder blocks, filling

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She plants and harvests rice crops. Edna sells her harvest at the market. She still needs additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Edna is hoping to increase her harvest and improve her income.

Edna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase the farm supplies that she needs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially. 

Edna is married and has 2 children. She does her best to be a good wife and mother to her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely E.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling clothing, cosmetics and shoe products from Natasha, Fullerlife and Avon in her community. She is 41 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin province. Emely has been in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Emely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Emely is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like cosmetics and clothing. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products like cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel S. Mejía no apare en la fotografía por razones laborales, por que aparece su esposa la señora Evangelina Limón quien se encontraba en lugar. 
 
Miguel S. Mejía y su esposa cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada y artículos para el hogar desde hace 2 años. El negocio esta ubicado en la casa de una hija donde se puede exhibir la ropa ya que es una calle muy transitada. Miguel desea comprar más mercancía para que sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en:
Miguel S. M. is not in the above photograph due to his work schedule which makes it difficult to find him at home, for this reason his wife, Evangelina Limon, is photographed.

Miguel S. Mejía and his wife have had a business selling used clothing and items for the home for 2 years. The business is located in his daughter’s home where he can exhibit the clothing as the street a very busy one. Miguel wishes to buy more merchandise in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: Stock her clothing business

loans.name: Las Palomasas De Pachuca Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Las Palomasas de Pachuca  porque las integrantes se identifican mucho con las aves dado que para ellas no existen ataduras, y Pachuca es una ciudad  que les agrada mucho por la tranquilidad con la que se viven en ésta mágica ciudad del estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.La Señora Adriana V. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 56 años de edad, concluyó una carrera comercial,  es casada, tiene 2 hijos: una ñiña de 14 años y un varón de 9 años. Ella es comerciante de calzado por catálogo y cosméticos, realiza venta ambulante a sus amistades y vecinos de su colonia, comenta la señora Adriana como todos sus clientes la conocen porque siempre trae consigo sus catálogos y la recomiendan, ella empezó primero a vender cosméticos pero al darse cuenta de la necesidad de sus clientes comenzo a vender calzado de dama, caballeros y niños desde hace 4 años, está solicitando el prestamo para comprar catálogos y surtir sus pedidos. Desea poner un local como distribuidora directa y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. La fotografia fue tomada en el interior de la casa de la Presidenta del grupo las Palomasas de Pachuca Sra Adriana V. quien amablemente prestó su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is named Las Palomasas (doves) de Pachuca since the members identify a lot with the birds since, for them, there are no tethers and Pachuca is a city that is liked a lot for its tranquility with which they live in this magical city in the state of Hidalgo in Mexico. The group is made up of 10 members. Adriana V. is the president of the group. She is 56 years old. She finished a business career. She is married, has two children: a 14 year old girl and a 9 year old boy. She sells shoes through a catalog and cosmetics. She sells on foot to her friends and neighbors in her area. It is noted that Adriana is known by her customers because she always brings her catalogs with her and make recommendations. She began first by selling cosmetics but after realizing the needs of her customers she began to sell women's, men's and children's shoes four years ago. She is requesting a loan to purchase catalogs and supply her orders. She wishes to start a shop as a direct distributor and be able to offer a better quality of life to her children. The photograph was taken in the interior of the house of the president of Las Palomasas de Pachuca group, Adriana V., who amiably lent her house.

loans.use: Purchase catalogs and supply orders.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda B. is from the town of Trento. She is 52 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is 27 years old while the youngest is only 7. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale.

Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to buy additional piglets and feed. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosalinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky Q. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. He is 42 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ricky owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing computer and internet services to local community members. Ricky has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ricky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ricky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional tools and acquire working capital. Ricky is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed to expand his services business. This loan will be Ricky's second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed to expand services business

location.town: Port Area, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María es una pequeña comerciante que ha venido  creciendo en su inversión con créditos que Afodenic ha dado en su trabajo de costura por más de treinta años, en donde junto a su esposo han logrado formar también una pulpería.
Atreves de los años ha captado sus clientes, también hace ropa para vender, hoy en día necesita más tela para poder cubrir la demanda de uniformes, lo que con este nuevo financiamiento será para la elaboración de uniformes y compra de cosméticos para aumentar sus ventas, y seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
María is a small merchant who has been growing her investment in her 30 year old seamstress with loans that Afodenic has given her.  Together with her husband she’s managed to also open a grocery store.

Through the years she has secured customers.  She also makes clothes to sell.  Today she needs more fabric to cover the demand for uniforms.  This loan, therefore, will be to manufacture uniforms and to buy cosmetics to increase her sales and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make uniforms and to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.ar: يوسف يبلغ من العمر 39 سنة متزوج يعمل في بيع الدجاج واللحم له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله ويريد ان يتطور. يسعى دائما الى زيادة مدخوله وتحسين مستوى معيشته،لذلك عمد إلى طلب قرض من المجموعة وذلك بهدف زيادة رأس ماله وشراء بضاعة بسعر أوفر. يتمييز عمله بالنظافة والدقة، له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض السابق بتطوير مصلحته كثيراً، وهو يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة
texts.en: Youssef is 39, married and works in a butcher's selling chicken and red meat. He has 20 years experience in this. He loves his business and wants to develop it as he is always seeking to increase his income. With this loan he wants to achieve business security by buying products in larger quantities at lower prices. He is distinguished for hygiene and attention to detail in his work. He has good credit history with the company and his last loan contributed to developing his store. He also has the full support of his family.

loans.use: To increase his Capital through buying his products with low prices

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo R. es un hombre trabajkador, esforzado y emprendedor quien desde hace 10 años inicio su pequeño negocio de venta de Tomates. El inicio con poco y luego por su trabajo y los prestamo puso un tramo actualmente vende hasta 15 cajas de tomate.

El invertira el prestamo en la compra de dicho producto.
texts.en: Señor Ricardo R. is a hardworking, determined and enterprising man who, 10 years ago, started his small business selling tomatoes. He started small and later, through his hard work and the loans, expanded to selling up to 15 crates of tomatoes. He intends to invest in the purchase of said product.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Mrs. Lang who was born in 1952 is a widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer. The other is a seamstress in a garment factory. Mrs. Lang is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she grows rice, not to sell but to support her family. Beside farming, she is a chicken breeder. Although she tries to work hard, she can earn only a little income.  Mrs. Lang would like to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Kahor

texts.en:
H. Kahor is a hardworking man. He is married and has three children. His wife works as a nurse. He works as an accountant at a company called "Habib." Besides this, he is engaged in animal husbandry. With the profit from his cattle sales he was able to arrange the marriage of his child. Kahor would like to get a loan of 6000 Somoni to purchase cattle, as he wishes to increase the number of cattle he owns. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina N. is married with six children — one under 15. She lives in a six-room house with two persons per room in Kob (Acha Tudig)Momo division-Cameroon. Christina, who became a member of GHAPE in 2008, has faced problems ranging from her mother's sickness to her father-in-law. She dislikes stealing, killing, and sickness and she has taken out loans twice. This time she wants to use the money to buy oil, rice, beans, and corn. She thinks her business will be successful because of good management and no selling on credit. Her business will help the community have pre-prepared food at affordable prices. She is planning to use her profits to raise pigs. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because the conditions are better and because it has come to send away poverty in many families.


About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit N. based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans and corn

loans.name: Ki

texts.en:
Mrs. Ki is shown in the picture with her little son. She is 40 years old and has lived with family members in the Baray district of Kompong Tom since 1979. She currently generates income by selling pork in the local market from pigs that she and her husband slaughter in a cage behind their house. Besides this, her husband sells firewood in and around his community for additional income. 

Mrs. Ki’s husband was using an old cart to pick his firewood to sell, but it broke while in the operating process. He wishes to replace it in order to have an easy way to transport his items. To help this situation, Mrs. Ki would like to ask for a loan for her husband to buy a new cart in order to replace the broken one.

loans.use: to buy a new cart for her husband to replace a broken one used to gather firewood for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old, married, and has an 8-year-old son.  She has been running a small retail shop for the last three years earning 16,500 KES a month from her business.  Agnes sells various products and goods to residents in her surrounding community at the busy Lukenya market. 

She plans asking for a 16,000 KES loan to buy more goods such as wheat flour and sugar.  This is Agnes’ first loan with KADET.   She plans to use the proceeds from her business to open a supermarket in the future.  Agnes describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and sugar to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Sonia Yamileth

texts.es:
Sonia, es comerciante de ropa y venta de chatarras (hierro y laminas inservibles), tiene casa propia, vive con su esposo y sus hijos 14 y 4 años de edad; el negocio de la chatarrera la inicio hace 4 años, compra y vende; para la compra se anuncia de forma ambulante pidiendo los desperdicios de hierro, luego los vende  a buen precio, este negocio le ha permitido tener una fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Ella requiere de un préstamo para la compra de hierro, bronce, cobre y aluminio, esta es la chatarra que ella compra, para esto debe disponer de efectivo para obtenerla, así tendrá más venta para comercializarla a buen precio.
Sus aspiraciones es tener el negocio fuerte, comercializarlo, tener mejores ganancias y también mejorar el sistema de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia sells clothes and also scrap metal (iron and unusable sheets of metal).  She owns her own home and lives with her husband and her two children aged 14 and 4.  She started her scrap metal business four years ago, buying and selling.  She buys her products by traveling around requesting scraps of iron which she then sells on at a good price.  This business has allows her to make income for her family.

Sonia needs a loan to buy iron, brass, copper and aluminum.  This is the scrap that she buys and she needs to have cash available in order to obtain it.  This will help her to make more sales and sell at a good price.

Sonia's aspirations are to own a strong business, sell her products, make better profits and improve her family's way of life.

loans.use: to buy iron, brass, copper and aluminum

loans.name: Soknim

texts.en: Soknim, 27 year old, is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker and their income is $7.60 per day. They have one child who is two years old. Every month she has to spend $70 on food and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $350 to buy construction equipment. Her husband needs some equipmens for his career. Otherwise, he cannot find customers because the other construction workers have better equipment. For the future, she hopes her husband's career runs well and he makes a good income so that it leads her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment

loans.name: And  Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité And Deggo est créé le 1er juillet 2011, il est composé de douze femmes qui travaillent ensemble depuis 5 ans, elles sont parentes et vivent dans le même village, l'activité dominante est le petit commerce.


Madame Ndéye Adama est âgée de 40 ans, mariée elle est mère de quatre enfants, elle s'active dans le commerce et capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 5 ans. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en blanc.


Elle achète ses denrées alimentaires, fruits, légumes, chaussures, tissus, parfum dans les villes et marché hebdomadaire et revend dans son village.



Son prêt lui servira à renforcer son commerce pour ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle souhaite augmenter son épargne et promouvoir le bien être familial.
texts.en:
The And Deggo solidarity group was formed on July 1st, 2011.  It’s made up of 12 women who have worked together for five years.  They are related and live in the same village.  Their main business is small-scale sales.

Ndéye Adama is 40 years old, married and a mother of four.  She is active in her sales business, taking advantage of over five years’ experience.  She is pictured standing at right in the photo, wearing white.

She purchases food, fruit, vegetables, shoes, cloth and perfume in cities and in the weekly market, to re-sell them in her village.

Her loan will help her to grow her business so as to bring in a large income.

She wants to increase her savings and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables and various products for retail sale

loans.name: Dekontee

texts.en: Dekontee is 25 years old and lives in the airport community. She is single. She stopped her education at the 7th grade. She does not have children. For the past three years, she has been selling used clothes. She started this business with the little money she received from her mother. She learned this trade from her friends. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Rolita

texts.en:
Rolita is 50 years old and married with three school-aged children. Two of her children are in college and need more financial support due to the high cost of school fees. To supplement her husband’s income, Rolita operates a business selling frozen food in her village. 

Rolita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy products such as hotdogs, bacon, ham, and longanisa (pork sausage) to sell. Her goal is to improve her business to earn a higher income to sustain her family's needs. Despite the hardships of life, Rolita hopes that she will expand her business through hard work and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy meat products to sell

loans.name: Segnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie Nicole est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.Marie Nicole est âgée de 39 ans et vit au  Bénin. Marie Nicole est mariée à un certain Jean Marc. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Marie Nicole n’a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Marie Nicole mène comme activité depuis vingt ans, la vente des boissons en cannettes. Marie Nicole s’approvisionne au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Marie Nicole sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEGNON, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group SEGNON is composed of three persons who are friends. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Marie Nicole, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 39 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a man named Jean Marc. They have three children who are all in school. 

Marie Nicole never attended school. To support herself and her children, Sinatou has been running a business selling canned beverages for 20 years. She gets her supplies from Togo, a country neighboring Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Marie Nicole and the other members of the group SEGNON are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy can beverages

loans.name: Jessica Yanina

texts.es:
la sra. Jessica Yanina tiene 32 años de edad,  cuenta con un negocio de venta de abarrotaría,con las ganancias que le genera dicha actividad cubre las necesidades y obligaciones que tiene en su hogar, Jessica es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijas, todas estudian en centro educativo público del municipio de las Trojes.   
La Sra. Jessica Yanina utilizara el credito para la compra de abarroteria y asi surtir mas su negocio, las ventas han mejorado y las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes.
su meta es graduar a sus hijas y hacerlas profesionales.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica Yanina is 32 years old and has a grocery business.  With the income that she generates from this activity, she is able to cover the needs and obligations of her household.  Jessica is a single mother with three daughters, all of whom are studying at a public school in the town of Las Trojes.

She will use this loan to buy groceries to restock her business.  Her sales will improve since the demands from her customers have increased.  Her goal is to see her daughters graduate and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Patterson Fostaren

texts.en:
Patterson is a 29 year old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 10 years. He describes himself to be hardworking. 

He operates a carpentry business where he provides timber and furniture. He has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 1 staff member. He describes his biggest business challenges to be poor road networks and seasonality. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase timber for his carpentry business. 

His business goal is to have bought a plot of his own and put up a permanent structure/show room for his furniture within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase timber for his carpentry business

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante es casada y tiene una niña la cual acaba de ingresar a la primaria. Ella se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de artículos de belleza por catalogo como desodorantes, cosméticos, cremas, shampoo, artículos para el hogar de diferentes marcas. Platica que ella empezó con este negocio por que veía que las demás personas que vendía esos productos tenían buenas ganancias y para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa decidió invertir poco capital que tenia aparte que tenia muy poquitas clientas. Ahorita dice que gracias a Dios y a las ganas de salir adelante ya tiene muchas clientas y que vende muy bien sus productos que ofrece através del catalogo. Ella surte sus productos cada mes en una tienda autorizada, dice que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y dice que su sueño es poner una local estable y poner una tienda de ropa interior para dama en su casa para que así sus vecinas no se desplacen hasta población y así no gasten en pasajes.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very hardworking woman with a strong drive to get ahead.  She’s married and has a little girl who has just started elementary school.  She’s been selling beauty supplies like deodorants, cosmetics, creams, shampoo and items for the home of various brands via catalogue for a year.  

She relates that she started the business because she noticed that other people who sold those products earned good profits and to help her husband she decided to invest the little capital she had set aside because she had very few customers.  Now, thanks to God and to her drive to get ahead, she has many customers and the products she sells via catalogue sell very well. 

She stocks up monthly at the authorized distributor.  She says that she’s asking for a loan to continue investing in her business and she says that her dream is to set up a stable locale and open a women’s underwear shop at home so that her neighbors won’t have to go all the way to town and have to pay transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 55 years old, married, and has six children 3 of whom are in school. 

Lorna has a pig raising business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Lorna has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF in order to sustain her business.

Lorna would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El socio tiene 30 años de edad, el socio es soltero, El socio se dedica a la construcción,el es albañil realiza trabajos de construccion de casas y tambien pintado de casas,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el socio quiere mejorar en trabajo como albañil. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su trabajo.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower is 30 years old and single. He works in construction and is a builder who constructs homes and also paints homes. He works from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm. Through this business, he wants to get ahead. He want to improve in his work as a builder. He is asking for a loan to buy tools for work. 

He is thankful for the support he’s been given, and he is committed to repaying his loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy tools for construction work.

loans.name: Saint Jean Baptiste Group

texts.fr:
Mme ODETTE est la représentante du groupe SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE .Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle prépare et vend le dolo  depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de Bendatoega village environnant. Ses clients sont les femmes et les  hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  02sacs et demi de sorgho rouge pour la préparation de son dolo.

Mme épargne et améliore les conditions de vie de sa famille avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne augmenter sa production et acheter un motocycle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Odette is the representative for the Saint Jean Baptiste group. She is married and has six children. Her oldest is 23, and the youngest is 6. Three of them are attending school. She has five of them in her care.

She has been making and selling dolo (a type of beer) for 12 years. She buys her supplies at the nearby Bendatoega village market. Her customers are comprised of men and women. 

She wants to buy 2.5 sacks of red sorghum to make her dolo.

She is saving money and improving her family's living conditions with her profits. She would like to increase her production and buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy 2.5 sacks of red sorghum for making dolo.

loans.name: Mahuzar

texts.en: Mahuzar is a 49-year-old woman who has engaged in cattle and sheep breeding for the last five years. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and three children in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She breeds cattle for meat, and sheep for meat and wool purposes. Her monthly profit from this business is 200 AZN. She applied for a 600 AZN loan to purchase one calf and four lambs.

loans.use: to purchase lambs and one calf.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.ru:
Гарник родился в 1957 году. Он окончил школу-интернат в городе Капане, после чего поступил в Капанское профессионально-техническое училище, где получил специальности токаря. 
Гарник женат и у него трое детей: сын и две дочери. Сын женат и живет со своей семьей отдельно от родителей; старшая дочь не замужем, она живет с родителя и преподает в школе; младшая дочь учится в средней школе. 
С 2008 года Гарник занимается частным предпринимательством: торгует овощами и фруктами. Гарник сам построил помещение, где осуществляет свой бизнес. Благодаря своему бизнесу Гарник приобрел небольшой грузовой автомобиль, на котором он раз в неделю ездит в Ереван за товаром для своего бизнеса. Жена Гарника помогает ему в бизнесе и благодаря этому они работают без выходных. 
Гарнику нужен кредит на сумму 900.000 армянских драм для завершения внутренней отделки, торгового помещения и установления окон и дверей в нем.
texts.en: Garnik was born in 1957.  He graduated from a boarding school in the city of Kapan and then was accepted to the Kapan professional-technical college, where he obtained a profession of a turner.  Garnik is married and has three children: a son and two daughters.  The son is married and lives with his family separately from the parents.  The oldest daughter is not married, lives with the parents and teaches at a school.  The youngest daughter attends a secondary school.  Since 2008, Garnik has been involved in a private entrepreneurship and selling vegetables and fruits.  Garnik himself built the store space, where he runs his business.  Thanks to his business, he bought a small truck, which he uses to travel to Yerevan once per week to get products for his business.  Garnik's wife helps him with the business, and, thanks to this, they work without days off.  Garnik needs a loan in the sum of 900,000 Armenian dram to finish the interior decoration of his store space and to install windows and doors there.

loans.use: to finish the interior decoration of his store space and to install windows and doors there

loans.name: Ivania Azucena

texts.es: Ivania Azucena tiene una  actividad económica que  es la venta de mercadería en general, toda la vida a luchado para salir adelante junto con su esposo formaron un pequeño  negocio en el cual le ha  generado ingresos para sostener a la familia. Ivania  tiene dos nietos en el cual todavía están a su cargo y a sacado adelante, el préstamo que está solicitando  es para la compra de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, aretes  entre otros productos, con este préstamo estará invirtiendo más en mercadería y podrá satisfacer a su clientes con los productos que tendrá.
texts.en:
Ivania Azucena sells general merchandise. All her life she has struggled to get ahead in life. With her husband she started a small business, through  which she has generated income to support her family. Ivania has two grandchildren who are still in her care, and she has raised them. 

The loan she is applying for is to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, earrings, and other products. With this loan she will be investing in more merchandise, and will be able to satisfy her customers with the products she has.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, earrings and other products.

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon lives in the village of Bashi, West Georgia. He is 33 years old, married and lives with his wife, Maya, and parents. The main source of income for the family is agriculture. They have four milk cows, producing and selling, on average, 62kg of cheese per month. Along with agriculture, Pridon is busy with buying and reselling bread. He purchases in Samtredia (nearby town) 400 loaves of bread each morning and takes them with his car to nearby villages. He sells directly to the villagers, as well as to grocery stores. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris, including the monthly pension of Pridon’s mother. 

Recently Pridon’s car went out of service and he had to stop his work. Pridon has requested credit for fixing the car, in order to continue his business and provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for car repair service so that he can continue selling bread in nearby villages.

loans.name: Yolanda De Jesús

texts.es: A sus 46 años de edad, la señora Yolanda se dedica a la atención y administración de una tienda en la cual trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, esta labor la realiza desde hace poco puesto que anteriormente su hermana era quien estaba responsable de la tienda, pero debido a dificultades de salud no pudo continuar, por lo cual la señora Yolanda tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio. Con los ingresos que la tienda genera puede pagar el arriendo de esta y suplir los gastos de su hogar y su única hija. Con el ánimo de mejorar el surtido de su tienda que se encuentra bajo, la señora Yolanda necesita de la compra de gaseosas, snacks y licor para poder aumentarlo y generar mayores ventas y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 46, works managing a store where she works from 8:00am until 10:00pm.  She started doing this work a little while ago because her sister, who was responsible for the store previously, had health problems and could not continue working there, so Yolanda had to take over the store.
