Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Angel Armando Q. T., 28, is living with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  He has two children.

The “SEÑOR DE LA SALUD” (Lord of Health) communal bank is located in Soloma which is part of Echeandia canton.  Its members are short cycle corn, rice and passion fruit farmers.  They have been in this occupation for a long time.

Angel Armando is a corn, rice and passion fruit farmer.  He buys is products in Comercial Viscarra and sells them in Comercial Escudero.
He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and passion fruit crops.  Support from the loan will help him meet his economic needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a house.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: El Sr. Benito trabaja como chofer con vehículo propio hace ya ocho años siendo fundador de la línea de transporte donde actualmente el trabaja, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería ya que el colegio donde trabaja su esposa como empleada le autorizo la apertura de una tienda, solicita el crédito para la compra de refrescos, dulces galletas para surtir su tienda, su familia actualmente esta compuesta por su persona, su esposa y sus dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el sr. Benito es una persona trabajadora y responsable, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sr. Benito has operated a taxi business for eight years.  He owns his own car and started the business himself.  He is applying for a loan to buy merchandise for a retail business that he wants to start at a local school.  His wife works at the school and he now has approval to open a store there.  He wants to buy soft drinks and snacks to stock the store.  Sr. Benito is married and has two school-aged children.  He is a hard-working, responsible man, grateful for the help that he's received from the institution.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for new retail business.

loans.name: Bwizi Tukundane Balisa Group

texts.en: K. Gorreti is the leader of Bwizi Tukundane Balisa Group in Kyenjojo. She is 30 years old and married with 6 children ranging in age from 1 to 12. She has a retail shop in Bwizi trading center where she sells sodas, sugar, soap, grain flour, water, beans and so on. She has had her shop for over 2 years and her customers are mostly daily home use customers. She is able to make 40,000 UGX as weekly profits and she is grateful that she is also involved in agriculture and rentals. Her retail shop is a self-initiative and her prayer is to have a continuous stable family and business. She needs a loan to be able to restock her retail shop with more goods.

loans.use: Buying sodas, sugar, soap, grain flour, water and beans for increased stock.

loans.name: Kisimba Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en: For the last nine years, 30-year-old Babra S. has made a living running a fishing business in the town of Najja-Lugazi. She opened her business after saving 150,000 shillings while working in farming. Babra is happily married, has three children and makes about 600,000 shillings a month in her current line of work. She is a member of the Kisimba Women's Group-Lugazi and she says she will use her portion of this group loan to improve her business by buying better fishing nets.

loans.use: The purchase of better fishing nets

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: For the past five years, Fati A. has sold clothing and cosmetics at Akaa Krom near Abura. She is married and has one child. She and her husband, who is a carpenter, combine their incomes to support their small family and pay for their child's education. She will add the funds from this loan to her capital in order to expand her business. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To add to her capital to expand her cosmetics sales business

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh T. N. is a 33-year-old woman with 3 children who is living in Luc Canh hamlet. She joined with our credit program in 2004. Being in business when she fist received a loan size of 1,425,000 VND, she invested in opening a small restaurant that serves breakfast. Her business has developed more and more and created a stable income for her to manage her family life. Since participating in our credit program, she has always been a good re-payer. To buy sets of table and desks, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,374,000 VND

loans.use: To buy more equipment

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos aun dependen de él. Viven en  casa propia de material rustico en el distrito de Sallique en la provincia de Jaén. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos como luz y agua. La única fuente de agua es la que obtiene de una vertiente que pasa cerca del pueblo.

Desde hace más de 10 anos, Fernando se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz , menestras y yuca. Cuenta con un pequeño terreno cerca de su casa donde siembra y cosecha sus productos. En la actualidad siembra 01 hectare de café y proyecta cosechar entre los meses de abril y junio 05 quintales de café, 08 quintales de menestras, 05 quintales de yuca, un millar de paltas y 12 quintales de maíz.

Desea invertir una parte de su crédito en el abono de su finca de café y otra parte para sembrar los mil plantones de café en un área que está preparando. Considerando que el precio del café está alcanzando niveles que no tenía en años anteriores, el invertir en nuevas áreas es una buena opción. Por lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Fernando, 41, is married and has 5 children, 2 of whom are still dependent upon him.  They live in their own house, made of rustic materials, in the Sallique district of Jaen province.  At this time they lack basic services such as electricity and water.  Their only source of water is obtained from a spring that is located close to their town.

Fernando has been farming coffee, corn, beans and cassava root for more than 10 years.  He has a small piece of land near his house where he cultivates and harvests his products.  He is currently cultivating one hectare of coffee, and between the months of April and June expects to harvest 500 pounds of coffee, 800 pounds of beans, 500 pounds of cassava, 1,000 avocados and 1,200 pounds of corn. 

He wants to invest part of this loan in fertilizer for his coffee plants, and part to plant 1,000 coffee plants on some land that he is preparing.  Considering that the price of coffee is going up to levels not seen in previous years, investing in new areas is a good choice.  To achieve his goals, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for growing coffee

loans.name: Mr. Kov Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The nine people who make up this village bank loan will use their portions of the loan for different purposes that can improve their families' standard of living. 

Mr. Kov is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. He was born in 1964. He is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where he can grow rice. He sells some part of the rice and rest of the rice he keeps to support his family. 

His wife is a silk weaver. Through these activities, this couple supports four children, one of whom is a silk weaver while the others are studying in the local public school. 

In the rice field, Mr. Kov faces an obstacle because his field is infertile soil. So to improve his crop, Mr. Kov is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en: Mkhitar M. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Tufashen.  He is a widower with three children. His two daughters are 17 and 21 years old and his son is 13 years old.  Mkhitar has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for the past 22 years.  He considers himself to be an honest and hard working person.  He is looking for a loan to purchase seeds and animal feed.  According to his business plan, this investment will increase the family income by 25 percent.  Mkhitar’s dream is to have his three children graduate from university.  He would also like to renovate the family home.  He is grateful that he is able to support his family as a farmer and is proud to live in Armenia.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and animal feed

loans.name: Ndang

texts.en:
C. was born in 1973. He is married to Amuteng Florence and is a father of two young children. The family lives together in 3 rooms in Funam-Samtang, a quarter in the Mbengwi Momo Division North West Region of Cameroon. 

Due to the untimely death of C.' parents while he was still young, he was unable to attend secondary school which is one of his set backs now in life. Since then, he has been struggling doing odd jobs. He was encouraged by one of his neighbors, who is a member of GHAPE, to join the organization. C. joined GHAPE in 2007. He took his first loan and invested it in a motor bike business. He used his second and third loans to purchase (palm) kernels. 

Comparing his life in the past when he was not a GHAPE member and now, he says he is very fine and that his life has changed dramatically. With this loan, C. wants to buy a kernel-crushing machine. 

With his experience and the high demand for (palm) kernels, C. is convinced that his business is going to succeed. The profit from this business will be used to add to his capital, provide medication to the family, and also provide school needs for the children. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the low interest rate and the training he frequently receives from the GHAPE staff.


About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to purchase a kernel-crushing machine

loans.name: Teht

texts.en:
Mrs. Teht, 36, owns a small shop in front of her house where she sells coffee and other soft drinks. She typically makes around $4.50 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. Her husband helps her with the business. She has three kids, all of whom sell different kinds of products in their own kiosk next to their house. 

Mrs. Teht is concerned that she is hardly going anywhere, and she dreams of having a vehicle, but she doesn’t have money yet to buy one. Therefore, Mrs. Teht would like to borrow a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for traveling needs. With the rest, she will use to buy a new cask for selling meatballs.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for traveling needs and to buy a new cask for selling meatballs.

loans.name: Nkoisa

texts.en:
Nkoisa has been in the livestock trading business for the last three years and earns an income of KES.16,500 per month. He is married and a father of three school-going children.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy three cows, ten sheep, and ten goats to rear and sell later at a profit. He will use the anticipated profit to buy a plot of land and build commercial houses.

In future he plans to open a butchery and start supplying meat to Bama open-air market in Nairobi.

loans.use: to buy three cows, ten sheep, and ten goats to rear.

loans.name: Marina Esperanza

texts.es:
Marina, actualmente vive con su familia, tiene hijos pero ya no viven con ella porque están casados, ella tiene un negocio ubicado en el mercado municipal, vende ropa y mercería, trabaja de lunes a domingo y este negocio es el medio de donde obtiene ingresos para su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva, específicamente blusas, camisetas, faldas, ropa interior, también mercería cuchillo de cocina, utensilios de cocina como cucharas, tenedores.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio con esta inversión, para que su inventario tenga de todo lo necesario en los hogares, y así contar con la preferencia de muchos clientes, quienes le generan las ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Marina currently lives with her family.  She has children but does not live with them because they are married.  She has a business located in the municipal market.  She sells clothing and haberdashery.  

She works Monday-Sunday and this business is how she earns the income for her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy new clothing, specifically blouses, t-shirts, dresses, undergarments, and other kitchen utensils such as knives, spoons and forks.  

Her goal is to improve her business with this investment so that her inventory has everything necessary for the home and so that she can have the preference of many customers, the ones who generate the most income to cover their needs.

loans.use: To purchase clothing: blouses, shirts, skirts, undergarments and also kitchen utensils such as spoons and forks.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en: Suzette has a shop that sells biscuits, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She is married, 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. Suzette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She requested a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy snacks and beverages, and for the education of the children. In the future, Suzette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and beverages, and for the education of her children.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad, administra un negocio en el que trabaja su esposa y también sus hijos ofreciendo productos al mayoreo, todos colaboran en diversas actividades, este negocio inicio hace 20 años pues fue una herencia familiar.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en gaseosas y jugos, pues las bebidas son parte importante dentro del negocio, dando a los clientes un buen servicio.
Sus aspiraciones con el negocio es aumentar sus ventas, su clientela y las ganancias, para crecer en el comercio y ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, formándose académicamente para mejorar sus oportunidades de superación.
texts.en:
Tomas lives with his wife and two children who are 14 and 17 years of age.  He runs a business that his wife and children also work in selling products at wholesale.  Everyone helps out with the various activities.  The business started 20 years ago because it was a family inheritance.

At present, he’s asking for a loan to buy soft drinks and juices because beverages are an important part of the business to provide good customer service.

His business goals are to increase sales, the number of customers and profits to grow in the marketplace and help his children with their schooling so that they can attain academic development to improve their opportunities for self-improvement.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and juices at wholesale.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is forty-six years old and married. Her husband is a teacher and they have nine children aged between twenty-four and ten years old. She runs a general store in which she sells such items as sugar, salt, bread, flour, cooking oil and others to the local people in Kakamega. She has been in this business for three years. She says that the business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. 

Loida is using her loan of Kes. 40,000 to increase her stock of sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil, flour, etc. to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to the wholesale level. She also hopes to give a good education to her children. She describes herself as humble, bright and focused.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Myriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 29 years old, a mother of three children. She finished college but could not find a better job so she decided to build up a business.  She is a sari-sari (variety) store owner and she sells candies, canned goods, powdered soap and breads. She usually gets here all the expenses to finance their daily needs. 


She is requesting a loan amount P10,000 to buy cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar and detergent to sell in her store. The people in their community are always looking for those goods and that’s why she wants to have stocks of these goods.

She hopes that her business will get over the "humps" so that she can provide for all the needs of her school-aged children and let them finish all their desired courses someday.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, soy sauce, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anexo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANEXO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Hilaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pan, venta de polleras, venta de mandiles, zapateria, venta de papa, tejido de chompas, venta de comida

La señora Hilaria  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una socia antigua. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de de tejidos que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de mercadería (compra de lana) que comprará de la Ceja de los puestos de venta y posterior elaborados los productos los distribuirá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The Anexo Community Association will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Centre. The group is composed of nine members with a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Hilaria. They run a variety of businesses: selling bread, selling traditional skirts, selling aprons, shoe seller, potato seller, knitting sweaters, food selling.

Sra. Hilaria says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer; she was invited by a long-term member. Currently she sells knitted items and has had the business for five years.

Hilaria will use the loan to buy more merchandise (wool) and then after making the garments, she will distribute them according to the orders she has received. The work allows her to earn money to support her family. She lives common-law and has three children.

When Hilaria is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes everything.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Eder

texts.es:
Eder de 27 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de La Arena que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Eder cuenta con su negocio propio de preparación y venta de refrescos y sanguches, la cual lo tiene en el interior del mercado de la zona donde vive, actividad que realiza desde  hace algunos años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocido en la zona donde vive por la limpieza y la buena atención que tiene con sus clientes, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá solventar sus gastos  familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y utensilios para continuar preparando sus refrescos y sanguches, para  seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con sus ganancias cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Eder con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que más adelante tenga un negocio más grande con una variedad en los productos que ofrece para seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Eder is 27 years old and lives with his family in their own home. The house has electricity and is located in the rural district of La Arena in the department of Piura. This is an agricultural and livestock area.

For some years now, Eder has had his own business making and selling soft drinks and sandwiches in his local market. He has established a clientele and  is known locally for his cleanliness and the good service he provides his customers. The income he generates allows him to pay for household expenses.

He has requested a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles from Kiva Field Partner, Edpyme Alternativa, to buy supplies and utensils to continue preparing his drinks and sandwiches and to keep providing good service to his customers. He will use  the profits to repay the loan and improve his quality of life. His work and his desire to succeed have earned Eder the trust of his customers. His aim for the future is to have a bigger business offering a variety of products, so that he can continue helping his family financially.

loans.use: to buy supplies and utensils to continue preparing his drinks and sandwiches.

loans.name: Vita

texts.ru:
Вите нужен кредит для закупки осеннего товара. Она хочет приобрести женские колготки и теплые мужские рубашки.
За счет предыдущего кредита Вита расширила ассортимент рубашек и увеличила оборот. В ее бизнесе появился бухгалтер, который помогает Вите считать и планировать финансовую деятельносить.
texts.en: Vita needs a loan for the purchase of fall merchandise.  She wants to buy women's stockings and warm men's shirts.  Vita used her previous loan to expand her shirt selection and increase turnover.  Her business now includes an accountant, who helps Vita to count and plan financial activities.

loans.use: to purchase fall merchandise

loans.name: Margarita Catalina

texts.es: Margarita es una persona emprendedora y madre soltera de tres hijos, peero solo dos dependen de ella actualmente y estos se encuentran en el colegio. ella acude a ceprodel para solicitar un prestamo para comprar mercaderia para el negocio como son: gaseosas, jugos, cola shaler, gatorade, granos basicos, carnes, perecederos y otros todo esto para que su negocio tenga un mejor funcionamiento  de mercaderia para ofrecer a su clientela. ella agradece a ceprodel por los prestamos brindados ya que a hora cuenta con otro local donde vende comida.
texts.en:
Margarita is an entrepreneurial person and the single mother of three children.  Only two of her children are currently dependent on her and they are in high school.

Margarita came to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy merchandise for her business such as soda, juice, Kola Shaler, Gatorade, basic grains, meat, perishables, etc.  She will buy all these products so that her business has more merchandise to offer her customers.  She is grateful to Ceprodel for the loans that they have given her as she now also has other premises where she sells food.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 50 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Norma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing equipment. Norma has been in this business for three years. 

Norma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
A sus 52 años de edad Blanca es una mujer emprendedora que debido a la difícil situación económica decidió montar un negocio en un pequeño espacio de su casa allí ofrece vende cerveza, gaseosa, dulces y snacks en general, es madre de 3 hijos y su mayor ilusión es poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro por lo que trabaja con gran dedicación para sacar su negocio adelante y progresa, sueña con tener una casa propia y un espacio mas grande donde tener una tienda de mayor variedad, pues hoy en día el espacio es muy limitado.

Con el anhelo de progresar, blanca quiere comprar mercancía en mayor cantidad para obtener mejores ganancias pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para hacerlo, por lo que solicita un crédito que le permita comprar mas gaseosas, cervezas, dulces y snaks, así sus ingresos se incrementaran y su calidad de vida mejorará notablemente
texts.en:
At 52 years of age, Blanca is an enterprising woman who must deal with a difficult financial situation. She decided to establish a small business in a space in her house where she offers beer, sodas, candy, and snacks. Blanca is the mother of three children. Her best intention is to provide them with a better future, so she plans to work with great dedication in order to move her business forward and make progress. She dreams of having her own house and a larger space for her store so that she can offer more variety. Today her space is very limited.

With the desire to make progress, Blanca wants to buy merchandise in bulk so that she can generate better earnings. However, she does not have the necessary capital to accomplish this. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more sodas, beer, candies, and snacks. As a result, her income will increase and her quality of life will improve considerably.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beer, candies, and snacks.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
It's two years since Everlyne started a business selling spare parts. Her business grew since she borrowed a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings, which she used to buy engine oil, spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid.  She also testifies that her clientele has grown.

Everlyne needs another loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy engine oil, brake fluid, brake pads and battery acid.

loans.use: To buy engine oil, brake fluid, brake pads and battery acid

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Claudia de 35 años, tuvieron la bendición de tener un hijo que actualmente tiene 15 años.

Don Oscar cuenta con un local donde alquila películas y todo tipo de discos. Se dedica a esto hace 8 años, antes de emprender esa actividad estuvo con su esposa trabajando en el exterior y de ese trabajo que tenia pudieron ahorrar para su pequeño capital y emprender el comercio que actualmente tiene. El comenta que su esposa siempre ha sido un gran apoyo para el, y que gracias a ella también han podido salir adelante. El motos de ellos es su hijo, por quien luchan diariamente.

Oscar Solicitó el crédito para la compra de mas películas ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda con sus servicios de alquileres y anhela ir ampliando su comercio para brindarle la mejor atención a sus clientes.-
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar is 43 years old and married to Sra. Claudia, age 35.  He is blessed to have a son who is currently 15 years old.  

Oscar has a shop where he rents out movies and all types of discs.  He has been in business for eight years.  Before starting this business, he and his wife worked abroad.  Through their work, they were able to save up a small amount of capital in order to establish the business they currently have.  Oscar says that his wife has always been a great help to him.  Thanks to her, they have been able to get ahead.  They are motivated by their son, for whom they strive on a daily basis.  

Oscar is requesting a loan to buy more movies.  There is already great demand for rental services, so he wants to expand his business in order to better serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy movies for rent.

loans.name: Sisina Shg Group

texts.en:
Zebedayo is the facilitator of the Sisina SHG group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Zebedayo takes care of ten children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Zebedayo had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Zebedayo was only able to harvest two and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Zebedayo and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Zebedayo will educate his children and buy more land. In 2012, the members of Sisina SHG Group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Zebedayo is pictured with his group members. The field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: El Joven  juan es cliente nuevo, será su primera secuencia de su crédito,  el  es soltero y trabaja junto a su hermanito en la venta de chocolates por mayor  en una feria muy concurrida de la Ciudad de la Paz,  juan vive  en la ciudad de la paz, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de material de construcción refacción de dos cuartos donde vive actualmente  que es casa  de su mama. Los clientes trabajan sacrificadamente  ambos hermanos  cooperándose mutuamente en  el trabajo, se encuentran muy contentos por  ser beneficiados con el crédito, el joven Juan es una persona muy trabajadora, con ganas de superación.
texts.en:
The young man Juan is a new client. This will be his first loan cycle. 

He is single and works with his younger brother selling wholesale chocolates in a crowded market place in the city of Paz. Juan lives in Paz. 

He will use the loan to buy construction supplies to repair two rooms where he currently lives in his mother’s home. Both of the clients make sacrifices, cooperating with one another at work, and are very happy to be given a loan. 

Juan, a young man, is a hard worker and eager to triumph.

loans.use: purchase of materials for repairs to 2 rooms

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustín compró mercancía con la que surtió el negocio y sus ventas aumentaron, en la actualidad su negocio está más surtido, y su nivel de vida se ve mejorado, Su meta es continuar su crecimiento y en un futuro tener una gran ferretería donde trabajen todos los miembros del hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el que comprará nuevamente materiales que rotan facilmente,  tales como clavos, tornillos, raspadores, pintura, yeso, cemento, destornilladores, PVC tubos, lija etc.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente : “ Gracias por darme la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito con tan importante entidad y espero que cuando terminen este me otorguen otro.”
texts.en: Agustín bought merchandise that he used to stock his store and his sales increased. His business is now better stocked and his quality of life has improved. His goal is to continue this growth and, in the future, to have a large hardware store where members of his family can work. He is asking for a new Kiva Credit with which he will purchase materials that sell quickly, such as nails, screws, scrapers, paint, plaster, PVC tubing, sandpaper, etc. His message to those who fund Kiva is this: “Thank you for giving me the opportunity to access a loan with such an important institution and I hope that when I finish with this one [this loan] they will give me another.”

loans.use: to purchase nails, screws, sandpaper, paint, plaster, cement, PVC tubing, etc.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El comité se ha formado con la gestión de la señora Sofía, una mujer trabajadora y servicial, ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para conformar el grupo en la zona. El comité se denomina “Virgen del Carmen”, están  en el Séptimo Ciclo y está constituido por 17  integrantes; es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido y responsable. Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, de lucha y trabajo en equipo.
La señora Sofia se dedica a la venta de gallinas caseras, lo cual logró con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Ella gracias a su arduo trabajo le da a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para tener una vida cómoda, sin privaciones ni limitaciones. Su sueño es poder tener un local donde vender las gallinas que tiene.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar gallinas y de esa forma aumentar su stock para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank formed with the management of Sofía, a hardworking and helpful woman.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the group in the area.  The bank is named Virgen del Carmen; there are 17 members and they are in their seventh cycle.  It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being united and responsible.  The members have a great spirit of entrepreneurship, struggle, and working together.

Sofía works selling domestic chickens, which she achieved with great effort and sacrifice.  Thanks to her hard work she gives her family everything they need to have a comfortable life, with no deprivation or restrictions.  Her dream is to be able to have a place where she can sell her chickens.

She is requesting the loan to be able to buy chickens and in this way increase the stock she offers to her customers.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is 59 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.

Victoriana has a grocery store. She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan to purchase four gallons of cooking oil, a sack of sugar, a sack of salt, assorted biscuits and candies.

Victoriana has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Victoriana hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase four gallons of cooking oil, a sack of sugar, a sack of salt, assorted biscuits and candies.

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.en:
My name is Jose Arnulfo. I have a passenger transportation vehicle in the area of El Paraiso/Las Manos, on the border with Nicaragua. I’ve been in this business for several years now. With the income, I support my family and my kids’ education. With the income I get from the bus I’ve been able to have my kids get their high school degree, and I’ve improved my home.

I currently need to invest in the transportation vehicle, since it has depreciated with time. In order to provide a better service, I need to repair it.

Loan Use: Repair and maintenance of the vehicle: floor change, seat covers, replace windshield, front and back repair and purchase of wheels.

Mi nombre el Jose Arnulfo, Cuento con una unidad de transporte de pasajeros con ruta de El Paraiso Las Manos Frontera con Nicaragua, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia incluyendo la educacion de mis hijos, con los ingresos que me genera este autobus he lagrado que mis hijos obtengan su titula de educacion Media, tambien he mejorado mi vivienda. Actualmente necesito invertir en la unidad de transporte ya que con el tiempo se depresian y para brindar un mejor servicio necesito realizar algunas reparaciones.

loans.use: Reparacion  y mantenimiento de Unidad tales como, Cambio de piso, tapizado de asientos, cambio del vidrio delantero, cambio de terminales y compra de llantes

loans.name: Ake

texts.en: Ake, with help from her husband, owns a convenience shop in her village of Vaitele.  The income from the shop is used for multiple reasons. Her first priority are her payments, as she wants to continue working with SPBD. She also spends money on improving her home as it is getting old and in need of renovations.

loans.use: To purchase flaps, turkey tails, chicken, soda, milk, soaps, powder cement and timber.

loans.name: Delia Deyanira

texts.en:
Delia is married and has two young children--a two-year-old daughter and a six-year-old son. Her husband works as a maintenance man but his pay is very low so six years ago, to help her husband with the family's expenses Delia decided to begin her own business in sales. Lately she has been selling home decor items like paintings, decorations and furniture, as well as lingerie, out of catalogs. She shows her merchandise in the homes of friends and family and has seen demand for her products and her business grow. At this time Delia needs a loan of $200 to invest in merchandise and meet customer demand. You can play an important role in the life of this family so please do not hesitate to help her.

translated by a Kiva volunteer

Delia es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, una niña de 2 años y un niño de 6. Su esposo trabaja en el departamento de mantenimiento en una empresa, pero su salario es muy bajo, para ayudarle a su esposo con las obligaciones del hogar, Delia se dedica a las ventas desde hace seis años, últimamente comercializa productos para diseño de interiores como cuadros, decoraciones y muebles, así como también ropa interior por catálogo, ella ofrece demostraciones de sus productos en casas de familiares y amigas, esto le ha permitido incrementar la demanda por sus productos y crecer con su negocio.

En estos momentos, Delia necesita de un préstamo por $ 200 dólares que invertirá en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y continuar creciendo. Tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Delia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru:
Isroil S. has been an active client of Microinvest for over 4 years. He has been in the sales business for over 13 years. He is married with 3 school going children. His dream is to give his children a good education. He began his business by selling men’s shoes. His assets were initially worth only $100, but today they are worth $500. Isroil needs $500 to increase his sales. He plans to use the resulting profit for his children’s education.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Султонов Исроил, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 4 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 13 лет. Он женат, имеет 3 детей. Его дети ходят в школу. Его мечта, дать своим детям достойное образование. Свою деятельность начал с продажи мужской обуви, его актив составлял 100$. Сейчас его активы составляют 500$. Ему необходимо 500$ для увеличения товарооборота, а полученную прибыль потратить на обучение своих детей.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith O. is 42 years old; she operates a mini provisions store, selling bread, local gin, & provisions to earn her living. She is a married mother of one child and has been with LAPO for the past 6 years, a faithful and trusted member of LAPO union. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 1996. Edith is asking for a loan of US$ 475 to increase the variety of her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, local gin and bread for resale

loans.name: Narcisa Idelsa

texts.es:
Sra. Narcisa is 70 years old and lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She has 5 children, only one of whom--a son who works--lives with her. Sra. Narcisa finished three years of high school.

Thanks to a niece who showed her the ropes, Sra. Narcisa started a business selling roasted meats as often in the city of Trujillo as in her own town of Mache. Once she learned the business, she joined the "Mujeres con Futuro" (Women With Futures) community bank because she needed new funds to support the business. The bank gave her an initial loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100) which she used to buy and sell cheese, a product that her customers demanded. She also subsequently added sales of pork meat.

With her own earnings and other loans from the community bank, she set up a small store in her house where she works most days so she only has to travel out to sell her products once a week now.

The recently-granted loan of S/.1,000 (about US$333) from Manuela Ramos, to be repaid in 4 months, will be used to buy merchandise like writing supplies and lamps for the store. Sra. Narcisa dreams of having a large store with a range of products so that she can earn her living solely from it and give up the weekly trips to Mache to sell her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Narcisa tiene 70 años D. edad, actualmente vive en el distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco, Departamento D. La Libertad; tiene 5 hijos, solo uno vive con ella pero él trabaja. La señora Narcisa estudió hasta el tercer año D. secundaria.

La Señora Narcisa empezó con un pequeño negocio gracias a su sobrina quien le facilitaba carne D. res para vender tanto en Mache como en Trujillo así fue aprendiendo el negocios por eso es que se animó a participar del Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Futuro” y también porque cada vez tenía mayor número D. clientes y necesitaba mayor capital. En el Banco Comunal obtuvo un primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $100) con el que se inició en la compra y venta D. quesillos debido a que sus clientes también pedían ese producto, posteriormente también incrementó su negocio con la venta D. carne D. cerdo.

Con lo que ganaba en este negocio y con los otros préstamos que obtuvo en el Banco Comunal fue implementando una pequeña bodega en su casa a la cual también se dedica ya que viaja a vender sus productos sólo una vez a la semana.

El reciente préstamo que obtuvo D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000.00 ($. 333 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, será utilizado para comprar productos como útiles D. escritorio y lámparas para surtir más su bodega. La señora Narcisa sueña con tener una tienda granD. con variedad D. productos para dedicarse solo a ella y dejar D. viajar a vender fuera D. Mache.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es:
Dinora G. is 33-years-old, is a native of the city of Bluefields, and is married to Ramón Rosales. They have 7 children. Mrs. G. is the owner of a business in which she sells cheese and cream. She has 2 years of experience. Her clients are men and women of all ages who prefer her because she offers a delivery service. Mrs. G. needs to buy 253 pounds of cheese at $1 each and 16 pounds of cream at $0.82 per pound. This investment will let her cover her demand.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra Dinora G. tiene 33 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, esta casada con el Sr. Ramón Rosales ambos tiene 7 hijos. La Sra G. es propietaria de un tramo donde vende queso y crema, tiene 2 años de experiencia. Sus clientes son hombre y mujeres de todas las edades que la prefieren por brindar un servicio a domicilio. La Sra G. necesita comprar 253 libras de queso a C$1.00 dólar cada libra y 16 libras de crema a C$ 0.82 centavos dólar la libra, con esta inversión podrá cubrir su demanda.

loans.use: To purchase cheese and cream

loans.name: Rocio A.

texts.es:
Rocio is a street vendor who sells goods and ladies clothes. Her husband works in the city and comes home every three months. They have one child, their main source of income is the business that Rocio has. She's been able to maintain her one year old child this way; they live in the Munaypata zone of La Paz city.

The credit will be used to increase her goods and therefore increase their earnings.

This is her second credit with Kiva and Impro; the evaluation has qualified her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson.

Roció es comerciante ambulante de víveres y ropa para damas, el esposo trabaja en el interior del país y llega cada tres meses. Ellos tienen un hijo, su principal fuente de ingresos es por la actividad comercial que tiene Roció con la que mantiene a su pequeño niño de un año; vive en la Zona de Munaypata de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara para incrementar su mercadería y así generar mayores ingresos familiares. Es el segundo crédito con KIVA e Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle otro préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of goods and clothes for her business

loans.name: Jinja Kawempe C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Claire N.. She is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment. Claire is 27 years old and is single. She has two children, aged 5 and 7, both of whom are in school.

Claire is joined in her small group by Joyce S., Mary N. , Florence N., and Margret N.. Joyce S. has a business selling charcoal and wants to expand. Mary N. is currently operating a business selling used clothes and wants a loan to start up a shoe-selling business. Florence N. also operates a salon and wants to re-invest in her business. Margret N. runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan to buy another fridge and weighing scales.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment and expand businesses

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
The broad smiles and the enthusiasm of Ms. Vũ Thị Hương, 25 years old, is the main factor of her successful beauty salon. She is single and has had her salon for 2 years now. After 6 months of vocational training from big town, she came home and opened her own shop. To get the capital she joined the TYM Fund. The monthly income is hefty at 200USD. She is applying for a loan of 825USD to expand her salon.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Thái độ niềm nở, nụ cười luôn thường trực trên môi là một yếu tố làm cho cửa hàng của chị Vũ Thị Hương lúc nào cũng đông khách. 25 tuổi, chưa lập gia đình, chị Hương làm nghề trang điểm phụ nữ được 2 năm nay. Sau thời gian 6 tháng học nghề tại cửa hàng trang điểm trên thị trấn, chị Hương về địa phương tự mở cửa hàng của riêng mình. Để có thêm vốn đầu tư vào cửa hàng, chị Hương đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương. Nhờ tay nghề khéo léo, chỉ sau một thời gian ngắn cửa hàng đã có nhiều khách quen. Thu nhập hàng tháng khoảng 200USD. Vòng vốn đầu sử dụng hiệu quả, sang năm nay chị Hương tiếp tục xin vay thêm 825USD mua thêm dụng cụ làm đẹp.

loans.use: Buy tools for her beauty salon

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga M. studied to be a beautician. Five years ago she decided to set up her own beauty salon, first in her parents house, and now in her own. What motivated her to do this were the lack of jobs close to her home.

She now requests a loan for US $250, which she will pay in 3 months, to buy working tools, because she needs a machine to cut hair and materials for waxing. With your help Olga will continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Olga M. estudio belleza, hace 5 años decidió poner su propia estética primero lo hizo en la casa de sus papas y ahora ya le tiene n su casa, lo que la motivo a hacer esto fue la falta de empleos cerca de su casa.

Ahora solita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar herramientas de trabajo, ya que requiere una maquina para corte de cabello y material para depilación. Con tu ayuda Olga seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying working tools (Comprar herramientas de trabajo)

loans.name: Wema Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Albert Birundi M. is a 30 year old Kenyan father of six children. Also living with him are the two orphaned children of his late sister, who passed away two years ago.

Albert started his business four years ago after accumulating savings from his previous job. He currently operates a small retail cereal stall, but he would like to expand his business and start operating a wholesale shop. He is the breadwinner for his family, and expanding his stall would enable him to support his children and wife, who has a low-paying job. With the little profit that he gets from the business, Albert still struggles to feed, clothe, and educate his children and pay the rent on his house. But with the help of his loan, he will be able to expand his business and increase his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Albert will expand his cereal stall with his portion of this group loan.

loans.name: Nicacia

texts.es:
Nicacia works offering housecleaning services in private homes and her husband is an electrician. She has a butcher shop that doesn’t operate at 100% of its potential due to the lack of working capital. Her home is located in Valle Hermoso Ladera Este in the city of La Paz and it belongs to her parents.

With this assistance she will be able to increase her income and quality of life. This is the fourth time that she is requesting a loan from Impro. The money will be used to buy merchandise for her business (groceries, meat and soft drinks). Her work and desire to get ahead allows her access to this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicacia trabaja ofreciendo los servicios de limpieza en domicilios particulares y su esposo es electricista. Tiene una carnicería que no trabaja en un 100% ya que le falta capital de trabajo y con esta ayuda podrá incrementar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de valle Hermoso Ladera Este de la ciudad de La Paz. que es de propiedad de sus padres. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para compra de mercadería de su negocio ( abarrotes, carne, y refrescos). Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise like meat, soft drinks and various other items to sell in a butcher shop

loans.name: Ines Carmen

texts.es:
Ines is a mother who is very engaged in the care of her children. So that she could work without neglecting her children, Ines devoted herself to selling various products such as clothing, home furnishings, ceramics, etc. She would like to have her own shop where she could sell clothing and accessories. For this, she saves whatever she can every day. However, many times, expenses increase and Ines' savings have to diminish. Ines needs your help so that she can have her own store. She will continue selling her products on foot. Nevertheless, she needs to purchase more wholesale merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Inés es una madre de familia muy entregada al cuidado de sus hijos para poder trabajar sin descuidar la atención de ellos, Inés se dedica a vender todo tipo de artículos como; prendas de vestir, adornos para la casa, cerámica, etc. A ella le gustaría tener una tienda propia donde pueda vender ropa y accesorios, para eso ahorra todo lo que puede día a día, pero muchas veces el gasto en su casa se incrementa y los ahorros de Inés tienen que disminuir. Para que su proyecto de tener una tienda propia de sus primeros pasos, Inés necesita de su colaboración. Ella seguirá vendiendo sus productos de manera ambulante, pero necesita comprar al por mayor más mercadería.

loans.use: Increase her working capital and acquire new products so that she can continue her business.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah makes adire fabrics and supplies them to outlets. Adire is a locally made cloth, most commonly custom-patterned to suit customers’ tastes. Deborah made the cloth she is wearing in this picture, and she makes all of her relatives’ and husband’s clothes. She has been in this business for eight years and studied it for a year and a half. She said she needs a loan of $850 to buy more materials for adire making in order to meet the demand of her customers.

Deborah is the leader of a lending group. She is 47 years old and is married with a child. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making Adire cloth

loans.name: Narindj

texts.en: Narindj is the mother of 6 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli town, settled in Fizuli region in Alkhanli village. She was born in 1950. She has run this business for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of US$ 625 to buy a calf to expand her cattle-breeding business.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
La señora Iris C. tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera pero esta viviendo en pareja desde hace varios años con el señor Arnaldo Neris, tambien de 31 años de edad. Viven en una casa en la cual estan de caseros pero además tienen su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio San Miguel Cambyreta. 

Ellos tienen 3 hijos que viven con ellos y aun dependen económicamente de los padres porque son menores de edad. A parte la señora Iris está esperando otro bebé.

Ella es costurera y posee su Taller en su casa y además trabaja medio dia en otro lugar asociada con otras costureras. El señor Arnaldo, su cónyugue, se dedica a ser plomero y trabaja de forma independiente desde hace varios años. Mediante este trabajo el tambien colabora para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar y la educacion de sus hijos.
La señora ha solicitado el credito para la compra de mas telas e insumos para su taller, debido a que cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Señora Iris C. is 31 years of age. Her marital status is single but she has been living as a couple for several years with Señor Arnaldo Neris, also 31 years old. They live in a house in which they act as house agents, but they also have their own house that is situated in the San Miguel Cambyreta neighborhood. They have 3 children that live with them and still depend on their parents economically because they are under-age. In addition, Señora Iris is expecting another baby. She is a seamstress and keeps her workshop in her house and also works half-days in another place associated with other seamstresses. Señor Arnaldo, her partner, is dedicated to plumbing and has worked independently for several years. By means of this work he also collaborates to be able to cover the expenses of the home and the education of their children. The lady has requested a loan for the purchase of more fabrics and supplies for her workshop, due to the fact that she relies on a good quantity of clients in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fabric for making articles of clothing.

loans.name: Inoyatullo

texts.ru:
Сайфиддинов Иноятулло, 1971 года рождения, женат и у них 4 детей. Иноятулло имеет 7 летний стаж в этой деятельности. Он торгует на центральном рынке Гисара продуктами питания. В его ассортименте имеются разновидность сливочного масла, маргарина, конфет производства России, Ирана и Турции. Также в продаже имеются кондитерские изделия такие как печенье, пряники, халва, сахар и сушеные фрукты. У Иноятулло небольшая лавка, но в дальнейшем хочет арендовать большое помещение для открытия магазина оптовой торговли. Покупает свой товар в оптовых магазинах Сафар – Центра. 
Иноятулло нужны средства для покупки сахара, и он хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Inoyatullo S. was born 1971, married and has four children. Inoyatullo has seven years of experience in his business. He sells food and produce on the central market of Gissar region. His inventory includes different types of butter, margarine, candies from Russia, Iran and Turkey. He also has confectionery goods such as cookies, gingerbread, halva, sugar and dried fruits. Inoyatullo has a small shop, but he want to rent out a bigger space in the future to open a store for wholesale. He buys the merchandise from wholesale stores in Safar-center. Inoyatullo needs financing to buy sugar and he wants to receive a loan for 2000 somoni (USD$600).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Dendi

texts.id:
Diusia yang sudah lebih dari setengah abad Ni Nyoman Dendi, 55 tahun, masih saja tekun dan giat membuat sarana persembahyangan. Usaha ini dimulai saat Ni Nyoman Dendi sudah tidak menjadi pedagang hasil bumi. Ni Nyoman Dendi  dulu menjadi pedagang hasil bumi yang rute perjalanannya sampai ratusan kilometer setiap hari. Jenis dagangan yang dijual dari kelapa, pisang, sayur mayur, beras dan hasil bumi lainnya. Karena usia yang sudah lanjut, Ni Nyoman Dendi menghabiskan waktu menjadi pembuat dan pengepul sarana persembahyangan dirumahnya. Ni Nyoman Dendi juga membeli sarana persembahyangan ini dari para tetangganya  yang menjual  kepadanya dan akan dijual kembali ke pengepul yang lebih besar. Kurangnya modal yang dimiliki Ni Nyoman Dendi membuat usahanya tersendat-sendat.
              Tapi kini Ni Nyoman Dendi merasa lega dengan adanya bantuan pinjaman modal dari yayasan Dinari. Ni Nyoman Dendi berharap dari modal yang  diperolehnya nanti bisa memperlancar usaha yang  sudah dirintisnya selama  8 tahun. Keuntungan yang diperoleh tiap hari sebesar Rp. 30.000,-  dipergunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari, sisanya ditabung untuk masa tuanya nanti jika Ni Nyoman Dendi sudah tua dan tidak bisa berjualan lagi.
texts.en:
Even at the age of 55, Ni Nyoman Dendi is still hard at work to make praying items. She started this after she decided to stop working as a trader. She used to sell coconute, banana and other locally produced stuff, and need to travel up to hundreds of kilometers daily for this. Due to her old age, Ni Nyoman Dendi decided she would make Praying materials from her home. She makes and also buy from other housewives, which she would then later be sold to a local trader. Due to limited capital, she is facing problems. However with the help of Dinari, she hope that her 8 year old businees will grow. She earns about Rp. 30.000 which she saves for her retirement.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bamboo and Coconut leaves - Bahan baku berupa daun kelapa muda dan bambu

loans.name: Virtud Group

texts.en:
The Virtud (“Virtue”) Village Bank is starting its 16th loan cycle and has 19 members. The group members are involved in a variety of businesses, including selling fruits, vegetables, cancha (dried, toasted corn), ice cream, tubers, handicrafts, animals, food, clothing, and cheese. Some sell from home or in the marketplace; others sell from door-to-door and on foot.  For example, Haydee is 28 years old and lives with her four children. Haydee sells ice cream from a mobile cart in the Nery Garcia Market.  Sonia is 36 years old and is separated with four children. Sonia has a stand in the F. Vivanco Market, where she works seven days a week selling a variety of fruits.  Alicia is 22 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son. She and her husband have an auto repair shop, and in the afternoons she sells prepared meals from the door of their home.  The group members need different loan amounts, ranging from 200 to 1,000 PEN. The group is asking for a total of 7,500 PEN.  They plan to use their loans to buy ice cream, fruit, tires, vegetables, rice, sugar and small animals.  Some of the women’s dreams are to own their own homes, to save enough, to proviD. their children with a good education and to expand their businesses.
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal Virtud  inicia su 16 ciclo, con 19 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la frutas, verduras, canchas, helados, tubérculos, artesanía, animales, comida, ropa, quesos. Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, ambulantemente, D. casa en casa y en mercados. 
Como es el caso D. Haydee que es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 4 hijos, Haydee venD. helados D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García. 
Por otro lado Sonia es separada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Sonia tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. frutas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días. 
Mientras que Alicia es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Alicia junto a su esposo tienen una vulcanizadora y por las tardes venD. comida en la puerta D. su casa. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 300 soles, 400 soles y 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 7,500 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. 
Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. helados, frutas, llantas, verduras, arroz, azúcar, animales menores. 
Los sueños D. las socias es tener casa propia, ahorrar lo suficiente, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

loans.use: Buy supplies of ice cream, fruit, tires, vegetables, rice, sugar and small animals

loans.name: Kwamina

texts.en: Kwamina A. is married and has 2 children. He has a primary school education. Kwamina sells fish which he buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation. He then sends them to the market for sale at the sea shore in Elmina, which he has done since 2000. His wife is a trader. Kwamina uses his income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses of the family. Kwamina will use the loan as additional capital to enable him increase his purchases of fish for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwamina plans to save towards a house which he wants to build, with his wife, for the family.

loans.use: Kwamina will use the loan as an additional capital to increase his purchases of fish for resale.

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es:
La señora Loydith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, vive en el Jr. Progreso Nº 209 del distrito y provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento San Martín. Tiene 58 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, ninguno depenD. D. ella, es casada,  su esposo se dedica a trabajos temporáneos dentro D. la ciudad. Loydith con el primer prestamo recibido D. S/ 300.00 deciD. preparar bocaditos. Esta 8 años con el banco.

En la actualidad ella hace bocaditos en cantidad, que los reparte a bodegas mercado, y pedidos y además prepara kekes, tortas, que hace en ocasiones especiales como bautizos, matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc. Esto le permite un ingreso regular para poder pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo D. S/ 1, 000, será pagado en 6 meses, comprara un horno eléctrico, lo que facilitara el trabajo que realiza y además disminuirá el gasto y el tiempo para realizar su trabajo.

Loydith manifiesta que el Banco Comunal es un excelente apoyo para las mujeres que desean progresar y crecer como empresarias.
texts.en:
Loydith belongs to the Las Brisas (“The Breezes”) cooperative bank. She lives in the Bellavista province, located in San Martín. She is 58 years old and the mother of three children, none of who still depend on her. She is married, and her husband dedicates himself to part-time jobs within the city. With her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, she decided to prepare finger foods. She has belonged to the bank for eight years. Currently, she prepares her snacks in quantity, which she distributes to stores and on order. She also makes cakes for special occasions such as baptisms, weddings, birthdays, etc. This allows her to earn a steady income so she can make her loan payments on time. With this loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six months, she will buy an electric stove that will facilitate her work and also lower her cost and time expenditures. Loydith states that the cooperative bank is an excellent source of support for women who want to get ahead and grow their enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an electric stove that will facilitate her work and also lower her cost and time expenditures.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Mrs Imelda I. hails from beautiful province of Antique. She is 37 years old, married to a fisherman, and blessed with 2 children. 

She is engaged in fish vending.  She sells the fish catch of her husband and buys more fish for sale from other fishermen as well. She requested a loan amounting to P 5,000 that she will be use to purchase 3 basin (100 kls. per basin) of fish. 

From the start they have good life and with their good business it may be the beginning of much better life.  She dreams that she will have better fishing gadgets in the future. She likes to raise her children in good values, send to school and to have a comfortable house they own.

She wants to thank ASHI for giving the poor an opportunity to have capital for the business. She also would like to thank Kiva lenders who will support her loan.

loans.use: To purchase 3 basin of fish

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 6 hijos, que actualmente están viviendo en su casa. Desde su juventud se dedicaba a labrar la tierra donde sembraban plátanos, cítricos, café y Kion, pero hace 5 años atrás se introdujo en el negocio de la compra y venta de frutas y kion, con  la ayuda de su esposo, quien es el encargado de recorrer las chacras durante la madrugada para realizar las compras y después acumular los productos en su deposito, Doris se encarga de encostalar si es kion o de encajonar si es fruta, para tener lista su carga cuando llegue el camión que los transporta hasta un mercado de Lima. Doris está muy contenta con sus labores, y lo que más le agrada es la venta, la cual le permite estar en contacto con la gente y se olvida de algunos malestares físicos que tiene. En todo este tiempo su negocio le ha generado ingresos muy buenos que le han permitido cubrir la educación de sus hijos, por ello tiene esperanzas de progresar aun más con la agricultura. Doris está muy motivada por ser parte de este nuevo banco comunal, y se ha ofrecido para apoyar en las charlas educativas a su asesora de crédito, así como se comprometió a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de sus productos; el kion y toda fruta que se pueda comercializar, lo que le permita incrementar sus ganancias en bien de su economía.
texts.en:
Doris is 42 years old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of 6 children, who at present are living in her house. Since her childhood, she was working the land, where was sowing bananas, citrus, coffee, and kion, but five years ago, she started her business of buying and selling fruits and kion with the help of her husband, who is responsible for traveling to farmhouses in the morning to make the purchases. After accumulating the products in his warehouse, Doris puts the kion in sacks and puts the fruit in boxes, so that her cargo is ready when the truck that transports them to the market in Lima arrives. Doris is very happy with her work and what she likes most is selling, which lets her be in contact with people and lets her forget about some physical discomforts that she has. In all this time, her business has generated very good incomes, which have permitted her to pay for her children’s educations, which she hopes to continue even more than agriculture. Doris is very motivated by being part of this new community bank and has offered support in the educational talks to her credit advisor, and in this way, she promises to pay her installments punctually. The money that she is requesting is to buy her products, the kion and all the fruit that she can sell, which will allow her to increase her earnings for the sake of her well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Los Laureles Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Laureles inicia su ciclo 33 con 15 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes en general, golosinas, comidas, ropa, cereales, gas, brindan servicios D. transporte y reparación D. carros.

Como es el caso D. Yeny es casada, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Yeny junto a su esposo tiene un taller mecánico en un local alquilado, Yovana se encarga del cobro.

Mientras que Vilma es soltera, tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres, Vilma venD. gas y leña en su casa, además Vilma estudia contabilidad.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,150 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. repuestos, gas, azucar, arroz, chompas, polos, golosinas. 

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar su taller, que sus hijos sean mejores que ellos, terminar sus estudios, tener casa propia y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Village Bank Laurales began cycle 33 with 15 partners.

Partners carry out different businesses, like selling general groceries, sweets, food, clothing, grains, gas, providing transportation services and repairing cars.

Such as Yeny, who is 24 years old, married and has two children. Yeny and her husband have a mechanic shop in a rented space. Yovana is responsible for the collection.

While Vilma is single, she is 22 years old and lives with her parents. Vilma sells gas and firewood at home, and also studies accounting.

The partners need different loans amounts, such as 300 soles, 600 soles, or 750 soles, making a total loan of 9,150 soles at the Village Bank.

Their loans will be invested in the purchase of spare parts, gas, sugar, rice, sweaters, polos and sweets.

Dreams of partners are to improve their workshops, so that their children will be better off than them, will finish their studies, have their own homes and that their own kids may study.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts, gas, sugar, rice, sweaters, polos and sweets.

loans.name: Faizali

texts.en:
T. Faizali is a talented entrepreneur with a successful business selling teenager’s clothing and shoes at a busy market in Pyandj district, Tajikistan. He is not married and lives with his parents.

Faizali started his business three years ago out of a desire to earn a living and meet people’s clothing needs. He sells clothes that are both popular and affordable, which helps to ensure a strong demand for his products. Faizali is a serious business-owner who wants his business to be the best it can be while continuing to grow and be profitable. One of his main goals for the future is to have his own family and to build his own house.

Faizali has requested a loan of $3000 to purchase new inventory. The change of seasons makes this a busy time of year for business-owners like Faizali. This loan will help him keep a good supply of inventory on hand so he can meet customer demand and make a good profit.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Tima

texts.en: Tima is 28 years old and comes from Klokotnica, a big village near the town of Doboj. Unfortunately, she became a widow very young and raises her son and daughter alone. She works in a bakery in shifts. In the time that she isn't at her job she works in agriculture. We followed the progress of Tima's business for the last four years because she is our long-time client. She plants cucumbers in season but her basic business is poultry. Tima has worked a lot in the past years to develop this business and she has decided to build a poulterer. She requested loan from WWI, a Kiva partner, in amount of 3000 KM to invest in her business.

loans.use: To build a poulterer

loans.name: Niagnéguéton 5 Group

texts.fr:
Niagnégueton 5 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du hameau Sinsina Sesso de la ville de Koutiala région  de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles excellent principalement  dans la culture de l’arachide et du mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Niagnégueton 5 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter exclusivement  au grand marché de Koutiala ville, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, de mil, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture. 
Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes et aux consommateurs.
Les membres du groupe Niagnégueton 5 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 80 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Niagnéguéton 5 is comprised of married women of the Sinsina Sesso hamlet of the town of Koutiala, region of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They live in big, extended traditional families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They have an average age of 33 and are the mothers of at least 4 children each. They principally excel in growing peanuts and millet.

In order to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the group Niagnégueton 5 decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso, four years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans, they are now on their fourth rural loan.

The present loan will be used to buy, exclusively in the big open-air market of the town of Koutiala, a sufficient quantity of peanut and millet seeds, minor agricultural materials, and entrants for the crops. After the rainy season, the harvests are stocked for a time so that they gain in value before being sold in the big market of Koutiala and the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) for cash, to a clientele mostly coming from the big cities but also to consumers.

After the sale of the harvests, each of the women of the Niagnéguéton 5 group expects to make a profit of 80,000 F CFA which will be used to cover current family expenses and reimburse the loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of entrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Азиза кредитор , которая берёт займы на расширение своего бизнеса. Она торгует семечками, жвачками и мелкими продуктовыми товарами. Следующий кредит она хочет потратить для закупа семечками оптом мешками и пожарив продавать их в розницу.Она благодарна инвесторам KIVA за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
Aziza is a borrower, who obtains loans for business expansion. She sells seeds, gum and small food products. She wants to use her next loan to purchase seeds by bags wholesale, toast them and then sell them retail. Aziza is grateful to Kiva investors for the financing and support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of seeds

loans.name: Anselma Del Carmen

texts.es: Anselma del Carmen M. tiene la edad de 46 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo y asiste a una escuela pública. La actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio inicio estableciendo una pequeña mesa, en el mercado de la terminal aquí solamente ofrecía desayunos, como pan, café, leche, donas y refrescos naturales, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro con sus muy pocas ganancias vender almuerzo, y así es como posee este negocio con mucho esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos para la elaboración de su comida. Su deseo es seguir administrando su negocio de buena manera y establecer una gran distribuidora en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Anselma del Carmen M. is 46 years old. She is a single mother. She has one son and helps in the public school. She sells food to make a living. She has worked in this for over 15 years. Her business started as a small table in the bus station market where she could only offer breakfasts such as bread, coffee, milk, donuts and juices. With enough strength and sacrifice, she was able to use her little earnings to offer lunches. This is how she obtained this business, with much strength and the wish to succeed.
