The loan that she requests is for working capital to buy basic grains to prepare her meals. Her wish is to continue running this business well and establish a large distribution from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a widow who has three children. Two of her children are still in school (one in secondary school and one in college). She operates a café in the city centre and usually serves food and tea to all the staff within her premises. Her major challenge is space, because patrons cannot fit in and they are forced to eat while standing. She aspires to open a big restaurant where all her customers can relax enjoy their meals. She is requesting a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to buy a microwave and a refrigerator.

loans.use: Buy refrigerator and microwave

loans.name: Jenielyn

texts.en: Jenielyn G. is from the village of Manga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, is single, and has two infant children. Jenielyn owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jenielyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jenielyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es:
La socia  Raymunda, es natural de Pisac en el distrito de Calca, ubicado en el valle sagrado de los inkas, ella actualmente reside en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestra socia tiene 53 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 6 hijos cinco de ellos ya tienen sus propias familias, la socia vive con su esposo y el menor de sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, tiene entre sus responsabilidades la crianza de  animales menores (cuyes, ovinos, gallinas) y mayores (vacas toros y terneros), también la socia tiene su stand en su casa en el cual venden chicha (debida a base de maíz), a su ves ella tiene un terreno de cultivo de maíz, papas y hortalizas. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más animalitos menores.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Member Raymunda is natural from Pisac, in the Calca district, which is located in the Inkas’ sacred valley. She currently lives in the province of Urubamba. Our partner is 53 years old, married, and has 6 children. Five of them already have their own family. She lives with her husband and her younger child.

She dedicates herself to retail trade. Among her responsibilities is the breeding of animals both small (guinea pigs, sheep, chicken) and big (cows, bulls and calf). In addition, our partner has a small shop in her house where she sells “chicha” (a traditional beverage made out of corn). At the same time, she has a crop of corn, potatoes and vegetables.

Our partner requires the loan to buy more small animals. She thanks for the loan and commits to pay her debits on time.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small animals

loans.name: Abies

texts.en: Abies sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 60 years old, married with three children and a retired civil servant.  She hopes for the loan of N70000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su hermana en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección de ropa para damas desde hace 15 años, empezó trabajando en un taller de costura como operaria y luego pudo independizarse, actualmente confecciona prendas en base a pedidos y con los ingresos percibidos en este negocio sostiene la economía familiar.

La calidad con la que realiza su trabajo ha hecho que tenga bastante demanda por parte de sus clientes, pero las máquinas de coser con las que trabaja no son adecuadas y continuamente están fallando, por lo que no le garantizan una producción eficiente, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de una máquina de coser industrial.

Manuela sueña con extender su negocio y hacer un taller más grande para dar trabajo a otras mujeres y enseñarles a usar su creatividad y paciencia en la confección de prendas de vestir, otro de sus sueños es vender los productos de este taller en su propia tienda de ropa.

Ella es una mujer reponsable, trabajadora y sus clientes siempre están contentas con la calidad de las prendas que confecciona.
texts.en:
Manuela is 58 years old, single and lives with her sister in the city of Chiclayo. Sh has been making clothes for women since she was 15. She began work in a sewing workshop as a sewing machine operator and later she was able to start working independently. She currently makes clothes to order and with the income she receives from this business she is able to keep up the family's costs. The quality with which she carries out her work has resulted in a lot of demand from her customers, however the sewing machines that she works with are of poor quality and are continually breaking down. Because of this she cannot guarantee efficient production, so for this reason she is now applying to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles that she intends to use to buy an industrial sewing machine. Manuela dreams of extending her business and creating a bigger workship to provide employment for other women and teach them to use their creativity and patience by making items of clothing. Another dream of hers is to sell the products she makes in her workshop in her own clothing store. Manuela is a responsible, hardworking woman, and her customers are always happy with the quality of clothes that she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Davlyatbek

texts.en:
R. Davlyatbek is 58 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He has dedicated himself to farming grain, carrots, and other vegetables for more than 5 years. He enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious part of farming is preparing the land for planting and protecting the crops from insects that spoil his harvest. Fortunately for Davlyatbek, the products that he cultivates are in high demand in his area and fetch high prices at the market. This is his first loan from IMON International. He will use the money to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants. Davlyatbek thanks all who are supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants

loans.name: Go Try Group

texts.en: The women of the Go Try Group are, as their name suggests, ambitious and hopeful. They are Aminata K., Fatmata K., and Fatmata S.. Aminata is the group’s leader, and at only 23 years old, she has already been in business for four years selling powders, creams, and other cosmetic goods. She is not married but has one child, who is not yet old enough to attend school. These women are seeking a loan of 1.5 million LE from Kiva and SMT to invest in and expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their business inventory

loans.name: Santos Paula

texts.es:
Desde las Cinco de la mañana, todos los días en el mercado del departamento de León, la señora Santos M. se dedica a vender tortillas elaboradas por ella misma las cuáles son comercializadas a sus clientes que le visitan a comprarle por ser tortillas de alta calidad.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y por llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Solicita el crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es maíz, leña y cal y de esta manera continuar con la elaboración de las mejores tortillas del departamento de León.
texts.en:
Every day, starting at 5am, Mrs. Santos M. sells her home-made tortillas in the department of León's market to customers who buy them because of their high quality. She has distinguished herself by being very hard-working and for supporting her household. She is requesting financing to buy ingredients like corn, firewood and lime powder in order to continue to make the best tortillas in the department of León.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy, stock, and sell consumer goods

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites C. is from the village of Bug-ong in Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Marites is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites buys and sells coconuts in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Marites is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This Marites's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Maki

texts.en: Maki is a 46-year-old married woman and mother of two unemployed children. She has owned a tailoring shop since 1998. She has 30 years of prior experience in this sector. She works to help her husband raise her children. Today, Maki is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine and develop her business income.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Bernardina,  pertenece al banco comunal  “Amanecer Anteña”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Anta Iscuchaka, a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene  48 años de edad, nuestra socia es soltera tiene una tienda abarrotes,  la socia ayuda a cuidar a su mamá y se dedica de lleno a su tienda de abarrotes, nuestra socia es una mujer muy buena y dedicada a su familia, ella no tiene hijos y nunca se caso debido a una mala experiencia, pero a cambio cuida y adora a sus padres y en todo lo que ella puede ayuda a sus hermanos y sobrinos, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su pequeña tienda abarrotes y comprar mercadería. 

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our associate, Bernardina, is a member of the “Amanecer Anteña” communal bank, and lives in the Anta Iscuchaka district, located 45 minutes from the City of Cusco. Our associate is 48 years old, single. She helps care for her mother and runs a small grocery store. She is a very good woman who is dedicated to her family. She has no children of her own and never married due to a bad experience, but now she cares for and loves her parents and helps her brothers and nephews all that she can. She is asking for a loan in order to be able to start a small grocery store and invest in inventory. She is thankful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Esperando En Dios 2 Group

texts.en:
Jaqueline is the coordinator of her group Eseperando en Dios (Hoping with God), and her story is representative of other in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients overall, many of whom have recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El-Seibo, a poor agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their child.

Jaqueline is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loans which she successfully used to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing more gasoline, charcoal, and boots to sell. This is a good business as there is no gas station in her area, thus she provides a much-needed service. She will use the additional profits to purchase school supplies for her children and to make home improvements. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, gasoline, and boots to sell.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol tiene 37 años, su actividad económica es la venta de calzado y fajas. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que su esposo estableció un lugar en el mercado en donde podían ofrecer sus productos, por lo que después hablo con todas las personas que realizaban la elaboración de fajas y calzado, de esta manera su esposa Marisol comienza a realizar este trabajo, además ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que tiene hacerse cargo. Por lo que busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos es por eso que realiza este financiamiento para obtener la compra de materia prima que se utiliza. Ella sueña con mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marisol is a 37-year-old woman who sells belts and footwear for a living. She has been in business for over 6 years. Her husband set up a space in the market where they could sell their products. He then got in touch with people who make belts and footwear, and that is how his wife, Marisol, got her start in this skill. Additionally, she has to look after her 2 underage children. She is looking for a way to boost her income, which is why she is requesting this loan, which will be used to purchase the raw materials she needs. She dreams of improving her financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhorn H. is 51 years old. She is a villager who lives in Kouk Roka village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn enough for her family's living expenses. Her husband, Mr. Sakhon Un, is a duck egg seller, where he can make a small income to support the family's living. Since her husband's business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chhorn H. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more duck eggs, in order to expand her husband's business. This couple has two children, one is a soldier and one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more duck eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying pagne cloth and some fabrics for sewing clothing

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 27-year-old entrepreneur from Lebanon. He is married and has two dependents living with him. His wife is currently pregnant with their second child. Adham has rented a shop for selling and repairing motorcycles and spare parts since 2005. His customers include friends, neighbors, and other people from his community who have learned about his business from previous or current customers. Adham believes that it is high quality work and experience that have helped him succeed. 

He is requesting a loan of US$ 1500 from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to purchase more spare parts to sell as well as purchase a new motorcycle. Adham is hoping to continue expansion of his business in the future so that he can better provide for his family and the new baby.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Kaim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy K. is 24 years-old. She is the village bank president as selected by nine members. The group loan is located in Trapeang Krouch village in Takeo province. This village bank loan has been made up by all the members who will use their share of the loan to do something that can improve their businesses. 

Mrs. Thy K. is a door-to-door mosquito net, scarf and blanket seller. Her husband, Mr. Chrey Val, is a famer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family.  Their problem is that her husband’s field has infertile soil. In order to improve production, Mrs. Thy K. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of the loan to hire a plow machine to plow her field. This couple does not have a child.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Self Empowerment Group

texts.en:
Daniel K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Self Empowerment. He is 37 years old, married, and has five children who range from 3 to 16 years old. He also cares for three siblings. He is a college student but could not continue his education due to financial constraints. All of his children are attending school.

For five years, Daniel has been operating a mini photo studio at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

Daniel plans to use his 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 41,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy a photo printer. He describes himself as a hardworking man. His dream is to expand his business and open a modern photo studio.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Edu is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy a photo printer

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Nelida; ella tiene 36 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 menores hijos la socia se dedica a la lavandería, ella va a lavar ropa a las diferentes casas familiares y lo hace cada dos semanas por casa, la socia desde hace 3 años ofrece sus servicios de lavandera y tienen ya muchas clientes que la conocen y ella se anticipa los días de semana y las busca en sus casa para quedar el día y la hora para ir a lavar la ropa, con este dinero que la socia ahorra puede pagar los estudios de los colegios de sus hijos. Ahora ella quiere un préstamo para comprar algunos electrodomésticos para el hogar, el cual irá pagando mensualmente con su sueldo. La socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su casa comprando electrodomésticos (licuadora, plancha). 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Nelida belongs to the communal bank "Tres Marias" (Three Marias). She lives in the Santiago district of the Cusco province in the department of Cusco. Nelida is 36 years old, has a partner and two small children. She does laundry for a living. She goes to wash clothes at different houses, and goes to each house every two weeks. She has offered her laundry service for three years and now has many customers that know her. She arrives early on weekdays and asks at houses to arrange a time to come and do the laundry. With this money, she is able to pay for her children's schooling. Now she wants a loan to buy some appliances for her home, which she will pay with her salary every month. She is asking for this loan to improve her home. Nelida values and infinitely appreciates the loan she is awarded, which lets her grow her business and improve her quality of life, and she promises to follow through with the payment of her installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para mejorar su casa comprando electrodomésticos (licuadora, plancha).

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline A. is 55 and married with 6 children (ages 11-28). She is starting a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women). Karoline needs a loan of WST$2900 to purchase additional equipment & tools such as needles & threads. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 650 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2005, Karoline joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Karoline's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment & tools such as needles & threads.

loans.name: Nisson Ney

texts.es:
Nisson Ney G. V. tiene 40 anos. Es casado y vive en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7, y 5 anos. 

Nisson es una socia de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Nisson se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz. La semilla compra en Mata de Cacao para la cosecha. Compra sus abonos al mes. 

Solicita el credito para crecer mas maiz. Con la producion del maiz va a mejorar su situación economico. Su sueno es seguir superando. 

Trabaja todo el mes, pero le gusta jugar a veces el futbol.
texts.en:
Nisson Ney G. V. is 40 years old, is married, and lives in the Chillanes hamlet within the Bolívar province. He has three children, ages 9, 7, and 5. Nisson is part of the “Ventanilla Rural Genesis” group, located nearly two hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, most of whom raise corn, rice, soy, bananas, papaya, and other things. Nisson raises corn. He buys his seeds in Mata de Cacao and buys fertilizer once a month. He is asking for this loan in order to grow more corn. His economic situation will improve with his production. He wants to continue to get ahead. He works the entire month, but sometimes likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn seed

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Sabenty” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Aminata J.. Aminata was born in a place called Sanda. She is thirty-eight years of age. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Aminata owns a shop wherein she sells mints, lollipops, milk, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She will use her share of the loan to add more goods to her business by buying mints, lollipops, cans of milk, Maggi, etc. wholesale.

loans.use: Buy mints, lollipops, cans of milk, Maggi, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Michael Kamoni

texts.en:
Michael Kamoni is a single motorbike operator in the area of Thika. He has been in the business for about one year now and he says that he is able to take home a monthly profit of approximately 11,940 Kenyan Shillings. 

This is Michael’s second loan with KADET; he repayed his previous loan successfully. With the profit he wants to buy more motorcycles so he can establish and manage a serious motorcycle business. He hopes to own at least five more motor cycles very soon.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycles

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma P. is from the village of Balingoan, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old and is married with four adult children. Wilma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES DE SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Saylla en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana;  La socia tiene 69 años de edad;  ella es casada  y tiene 4 hijos, La socia se dedica a la atención de su tienda abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la cual vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, La socia desea implementar su negocio comprando todo tipo de abarrotes al por mayor, ella comprar arroz. Fideos, leche, azúcar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra productos de abarrotes.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is part of the Los Rosales de Saylla communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Saylla, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Juana is 69 years old, married, and has four children. She works at her small grocery store where she sells all types of basic needs items. Juana wants to stock her business and buy all types of wholesale groceries such as rice, pasta, milk, and sugar. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of grocery items.

She appreciates and values the loan provided and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of grocery items.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: For the last two years, Kamala O. has dedicated herself to selling men's clothing in the market. She began by selling small quantities but, through the years, she has gone on to acquire greater quantities for sale. Kamala began her business due to the needs of her family; her husband’s income did not suffice to cover the household expenses. Currently Kamala requests 1000 AZN in order to re-stock her clothing inventory. She counts on your help and thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Mercado Solidario Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mercado Solidario es conformado por 19 socios,  pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca. Sus principales negocios son de manualidades en tejidos, telar, decoupage y pinturas; venta de artesanías y preparación y venta de colaciones. 
Paula es la presidenta de este grupo y en la foto se encuentra por el centro de la foto, justo detrás y a la derecha de la señora que tiene la muñeca de pelo rojo en la mano. Ella hace muñecas de tela, pinturas sobre madera y decoupage, hace 10 años. Desde hace 2 años tenía un local en el mercado central, en el centro de Talca, el cual lamentablemente quedo destruido por el terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero, por lo que ahora vende solo en su casa y a domicilio. Con este  préstamo comprará algodón y telas usadas para hacer las muñecas. En noviembre abrirá un nuevo local, ubicado en una galería nueva, en donde atenderá con su mamá, quien también participa en Fondo Esperanza y tiene el mismo rubro que ella. 
Su meta es que sus productos sean reconocidos por su calidad y originalidad.  Tiene 2 hijas, de 18 y 15 años, quienes viven con ella. 
A  Paula le ha sido muy grato participar en Fondo Esperanza y con sus compañeros de grupo.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. La mayor parte de la población habita en el sector rural, la cual se dedica principalmente a las actividades económicas propias del campo. Se caracteriza  por su hermosa artesanía y arquitectura colonial.  Sus principales atracciones son la flora, la fauna, y sus viñedos. A pesar que la fuerza de trabajo se ha incrementado, esta región sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
The “Solidarity Market” cooperative bank is comprised of 19 members from the city of Talca.  Their businesses are primarily knitted and woven articles, decoupage and paintings; making and selling handicrafts and light meals.  

Paula, the president of this group, is located in the center of the photograph just behind and to the right of the woman holding the doll with red hair.  She has been making cloth dolls, paintings on wood and decoupage for the past 10 years.  For the past 2 years she has had a site at the market in Talca, which was unfortunately destroyed in the earthquake that occurred this past February 27th.  For this reason, she now only sells her products from her home or door-to-door.

She will use this loan to buy cotton and used fabrics to make her dolls.  In November, she will open a locale located in a new gallery, where she will work with her mother’s help as she also participates in Fondo Esperanza and is in the same business as Paula.  Her goal is to have her handicrafts recognized for their quality and originality.

She has 2 daughters, ages 18 and 15, who live with her.  It has been very pleasant for Paula to participate in Fondo Esperanza and with her associates in the group.  Talca belongs to the Maule region, in the central part of the country.  The majority of the population is involved in agricultural economic activities.  The area is known for its beautiful handicrafts and its colonial architecture.  The principal attractions are the flora, fauna, and vineyards.  Despite the fact that the workforce has increased, the last census indicates that it continues to be one of the poorest areas in the country.

loans.use: Cotton and fabrics.

loans.name: 02.08.1.10 Group

texts.en:
Huong N. T. is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Huong is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.08.1.10 Nam Ngan.


Huong is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Huong owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Huong has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Huong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huong has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Le is a 55 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


2.  H. T. Nam is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


3.  D. T. Hue is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


4.  N. T. Thanh is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


5.  T. T. Nguyet is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


6.  V. T. No is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


7.  N. T. Que is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
N. Margret is 30 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Margret has a grocery store business, which she has had for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more goods.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Margret hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: more goods

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie R. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 28 years old, married and has 1 infant. Jessie owns & operates a transportation business, providing habal-habal, or motorela services (habal-habal/motorela is a passenger carrying motorcycle with an extended seat). Jessie has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of this service. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to maintain service

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia A. is a 38-year old widow who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: Sari-sari (general) store and fish vending businesses.  She lives in Prk. Everlasting, Brgy. Sta. Monica, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Sari-sari (general) store and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 PHP.  Cynthia is now borrowing 17,000 PHP so that she could purchase more stocks to sell.  This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Cynthia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 				
								
About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta, de 60 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Alejandro (62) y tienen cinco  hijos mayores que ya viven independientemente.El negocio de venta de gaseosas y cervezas de esta trabajadora mujer es uno de los más concurridos en el poblado de San Francisco, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en realizar sus compras en su centro de atención, ya que saben que es un negocio que esta a la disposición de sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes de los  problemas que les atormentan y así puede aconsejarles, ya  lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es soportar algunos ebrios  que tratan de sobrepasarse con la confianza de las ventas,  pero siempre los pone en su lugar. Muchos días tiene que atender de corrido, si no quiere que sus ventas bajen, y para  más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el más frecuentado de su pueblo.Este el segundo préstamo de Violeta con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal.Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará dulces y mostradores pequeños  para incorporar a su negocio, de esta manera espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Violeta is 60 years old.  She is a very kind and humble woman who lives in a rental house together with her husband, 62 year-old Alejandro.  The couple have five grown up children who live independently.

This hard-working woman's business selling soda and beer is one of the busiest in the town of San Francisco.  Her great charisma and the kindness with which she serves her customers have made her business the most popular among her neighbors who don't hesitate to make their purchases in her store since they know that it is a business that is at its customers' disposal.

What Violeta most likes about her work is chatting to her customers about their problems and giving them advice.  She has been in this business for two years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is putting up with the odd drunk who tries to go too far with their purchases.  However, she always puts them in their place.  She often has to serve non-stop if she  doesn't want her sales to drop.  In the future, she hopes that her business will grow and become the most popular in her town.

This is Violeta's second loan with MFP.  She knows that if she makes her repayments on time she will be able to access another loan more easily and without causing problems for her community bank.  Violeta will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy candy and some small counters for her business.  In this way, she hopes that her business will continue to grow,

loans.use: To buy candy and some counters for her business

loans.name: Irine

texts.en: Irine is a married lady with five children. She owns and runs a green grocery. She has been in the business since 2000. She runs her business in Kawangware open-air market, and most of her customers are people of her locality. She hopes to expand her business so as to get more income. She is very thankful to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to take her children to school. She has requested 40,000 KES to buy mangoes, cabbages, onions, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, cabbages, onions, and potatoes

loans.name: Dulia

texts.en:
Dulia is a farmer living in the town of Banga with her family. She owns and tills her own land where she plants and harvests rice crops. Dulia sells her rice to the traders. Dulia has many plans for her family. One of those is to improve their house in order to have a better shelter.

Dulia works hard to earn a living from her farm. She currently needs fertilizers and other inputs. She is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which she will use to buy the farm supplies she needs.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis U. de 20 años es un joven emprendedor el cual desde pequeño ayuda a su madre con su negocio y ahora alquila una tricimoto en el cual va a seguir trabajando con una nueva línea de entrega en tricimoto de leche y soya.

Unas de sus dificultades es el afalto de las calles de su sector el cual ha impedido un poco el buen desempeño  de sus labores. Con el préstamo quiere darle mantenimiento a su moto y va a comprar productos de soya para vender.
texts.en:
Luis U., age 20, is a young entreprenuer.  He has been helping his mother with her business since he was little.  He now rents a “tricimoto” (three wheeled motorized vehicle).   He will continue working with his tricimoto in the new line of delivering milk and soy.

One of the difficulties is the asphalt on the streets in his sector has impeded a bit the good performance of his work.  He wants to use the loan to provide maintenance on his motorbike.  He will also buy soy products to sell.

loans.use: Maintenance on his motorbike and soy milk

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is married to a gymnastics teacher, but has no children. They live in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, Sera has operated a beauty salon. Her potential customers are the neighbors and passersby. Sera faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season, the number of customers is higher compared to the months of January to May. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Sera decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase chemicals, hair pieces, hair weaves and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase hair pieces, hair weaves, chemicals and cosmetics

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Bonifacio runs a business venture in which he makes furniture.

Bonifacio has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. Bonifacio joined PMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 42,000 PHP from PMPC.

Bonifacio is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which he will use to repair a transport vehicle used in delivering orders to his customer. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Bonifacio from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

<b>About PMPC</>
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in delivering to his orders to his customers

loans.name: Bishobire

texts.en: Bishobire D. is 35 years old, married, and has three children.  They live in Ibanda. He has a business of selling bananas from Kitonzi B. He has been in this business for 10 years after saving from the sale of other produce, such as matooke (green plantains), and  from his farm. He is very hard working and works with his spouse selling to the local community. He is able to make 220,000 UGX as monthly income, which has enabled him to provide for their children. His dream is to be able to increase production so that he can increase his revenue. He is requesting a loan to purchase more farm inputs for improved productivity and output.

loans.use: To purchase more farm inputs for improved productivity and output.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is 30 years old and lives in the Paynesville area.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is a physician assistant at a local clinic.  With all three children in school, both she and her husband have to struggle to make ends meet.

Abigail started her seamstress business four years ago and now has a lot of customers.  On a daily basis, she has to deliver not less than ten suits per day.  Abigail is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth and a sewing machine for her shop.  She hopes to have her own boutique that will sell only her own clothes.

loans.use: buy cloth and a sewing machine for her tailor shop

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph K. M. has been selling clothes for about two years and earns about $175 per month. He is married to Salome who is a business lady, and they do not have children yet.
	
He was introduced to KADET LTD by a group already registered with KADET and he is applying for his second loan of 15,000 KES which he plans to use to add more stock of secondhand clothes for resale.

In future he plans to grow his business and own a boutique where he will be selling clothes wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en:
Mr. Ngen is a hardworking man who always tries to earn money to support his family with many kinds of expenses. He has good skills with making wooden chairs and wooden tables for a furniture shop in Siem Reap province. He can earn an income in average of $3.25 a day from his job. He has a life partner in his wife who is a rice grower. They have four single children and most of them are attending a local school. 

With this loan, Mr. Ngen will purchase a plot of a plantation from a villager in order to grow bananas. This will enable the family to accrue an extra profit to meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of plantation for growing bananas.

loans.name: Roukaya

texts.en:
Roukaya is a 30-year-old married woman, living in Qana with her husband and three children. Roukaya has had her own special business for eleven years. Roukaya helps her husband with their family's income to cover their expenses. 

Roukaya is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the first time, in order to increase her stock of summer fruit and to pay for what's left of the price of a new car they intend to buy.

She is a hard worker, beloved by most of her neighbors and friends. She's known for her famous smile, and special customer care she provides. She works hard on improving customer care to face competition around her.

Roukaya hopes to expand her business through selling wholesale and hopes to cover her family's needs as much as she can.

loans.use: to increase her stock of summer fruit.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona es comerciante en venta de ropa y productos de cosméticos, también vende helados, el cual tiene cuatro años en las ventas, ya que años anteriores, laboraba como domestica. Hoy en día cuenta con la ayuda de sus tres hijos que están en el país de Costa Rica, los cuales envían remesas, y los otros viven independiente.
Durante varios años, ha venido construyendo su casa toda de concreto, gracias al ahorro y apoyo de sus hijos, así como el financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en cuatro ciclos todos para la infraestructura en donde ha avanzado más rápido la construcción.
Hay un cuarto que es el que va a mejorar que aun  es de zinc, y cuartones ya muy viejos, en donde tiene comprado piedra, piedrín, arena, y comprara con este préstamo laminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, hierro, cemento para comenzar e ir poco  a poco cerrándolo más seguro.
texts.en:
Petrona sells clothing, cosmetics and also ice cream.  She has been in this business for four years and before that she worked as a maid.  Now her three sons and daughters who are in Costa Rica help her by sending her money and the others live on their own.
For several years she has been building her house of concrete, thanks to her savings and the help from those working in Costa Rica.  With the financing from Afodenic she has had four loan cycles for the infrastructure which has advanced faster than the construction.
There is a room which she wants to improve that’s made of zinc and has roofing timbers that are very old.  She has bought stone, pebbles, sand and she will use this loan to buy sheets of zinc, timbers, nails, iron and cement to begin to finish it more securely.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to begin building a concrete room since it's now made of zinc, and to change the roof

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells breads, biscuits and snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, breads and beverages. Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads and beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicken, cracklings, soft cheese, bread, and soft drinks for the business.

loans.name: Saadatu

texts.en:
Saadatu is a widow with six children. She sells waakye (a rice and beans delicacy) at Takoradi. This dish is normally served with other ingredients, including boiled eggs, macaroni, salad, hot black pepper sauce, and tomato sauce. She explains that her business is 3 years old.

She would like to use the requested loan proceeds to buy rice and beans, which will be used to make additional waakye for her customers. She plans to reinvest any additional profits back into the business.

loans.use: To make waakye for her customers by purchasing rice and beans.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 35 years old, married and has two school-age children. He operates a motorcycle transport business in his village to earn income for his family. He has been in this business for almost 20 years, earning a net profit of 7,000 PHP a month. 

Rodrigo aims to strengthen his business to have a stable source of income for the sake of his family. He is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy gasoline and spare parts for the motorcycle in order to provide a better service. Despite hardships and difficulties, he is still hoping that someday he can achieve his business goal through his patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Flor Canelitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR CANELITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Producción de lechuga, venta de muebles, venta de comida, cría de ganado, Taller mecánico, producción de leche.
 
La señora Martha,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace diez y siete años, aprendiendo el mismo de un trabajo anterior. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de refrescos) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en una parada de minibuses. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene nueve hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Flor Canelitas" will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of Centro Collpani. The group is made up of eight members and it is directed by a board of directors, lead by Martha. The businesses held by the members of the communal bank are varied, and among them we have: lettuce production, furniture sales, food production and sales, livestock farming, mechanic shop, and dairy production.

It is Martha's first time joining Pro Mujer and she joined following an invitation by a promoter. She currently has a food production and sales business. She has had her business for the past sixteen years. She learned the business from previous employment.

The loan that she will access will be used to increase her inventory (to purchase soft drinks) which she will acquire from the commercial district of the city. She will later resell them at a minibus stop. This type of business will help her generate an income to support her family in whatever possible. She is married and she has nine children. 

When she was asked what she appreciates about Pro Mujer she said she enjoys the savings program.

loans.use: to purchase softdrinks.

loans.name: Elias Samuel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Elias Samuel lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, el coordinador del grupo es el señor Mauricio Jerónimo  se dedica a la venta de productos básicos desde hace 5 años con unos pequeños ahorro y luego siguió con los préstamos.  El con el crédito invertirá en la compra de granos básicos con el firme propósito de seguir aumentando su negocio.
Los otros integrantes son Gilma Antonia de 25 años desde hace 7 años y María del Carmen de 31 años tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The "Elias Samuel" group is made up of three hard-working people.  

The group's coordinator is Señor Mauricio Jerónimo.  He has been working selling basic products for the last five years, which she started with some small savings and later continued through loans.  With this loan, he will invest in the purchase of bulk grains with the end goal of continuing to grow his business.

The other members are Gilma Antonia, aged 25, who has been working for the last seven years, and María del Carmen, aged 31, who has a general store.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена замужем. Она торгует одеждой на одном из небольших рынков города Запорожье. Елена занимается этим бизнесом уже 11 лет. Ей нравится продавать женскую одежду. У нее есть постоянные клиенты, которые покупают одежду именно у Елены. Таким клиентам Елена предоставляет хорошие скидки.

Недавно Елена приобрела бытовую технику для кухни. Она смогла это сделать, так как получила дополнительную прибыль за счет кредитных средств.

Елена просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 6,000 гривен на закупку осеннего товара: колготок, верхней одежды. Бизнес цель Елены – расширить бизнес и открыть еще одну торговую точку.
texts.en:
Elena is married. She sells clothes at one of the small markets in the city of Zaporozhye. Elena has been running this business for the last 11 years. She likes selling women's clothes. Elena has steady clients, who especially come to buy clothes only from her. For such clients Elena gives a nice discount. 

Recently, due to additional business profits Elena was able to improve her kitchen. This would not have been possible without the previous loans she received from HOPE. 

Elena is applying for a loan of 6000 griven to purchase fall clothing: nylon tights and warm coats. Elena's current business goal is to expand and open a second store at the market.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal goods - nylon tights and fall coats.

loans.name: Barrio Las Canoas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Barrio las Canoas” está conformado por siete personas son siete mujeres y cuatro hombres  el nombre lo eligieron ya que así se llama el barrio donde viven u el lugar está dividido en varias secciones sin embargo a los integrantes de este grupo lo que más le gusta de su comunidad sus árboles es algo que admiran porque los vecinos de la comunidad ha sabido cuidar muy bien sus árboles.
Los integrantes les grupo invertirán el préstamo en la compra de borregos en diferentes cantidades ya que ha esto se dedican todos es la primera vez que participan en un crédito con FRAC y KIVA.
Sin embargo el representante del grupo que es el señor Alberto invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes comprara todo aquello que considera que le hace falta como leche, pan, huevo, refresco, agua, azúcar, frijoles, etc. En si comprara lo que más vende que en todo caso sería alimentos para la gente de la comunidad.
En la actividad lleva ya diez años en todo este tiempo no ha tenido problemas anteriormente si ya que dada fiado y no le querían pagar es por eso que dejo de dar fiado y ahora ya no lo hace, porque a la hora de pagar no quieren y a perdido amistades. Quien le ayuda a atender la tienda es su esposa su meta es llegar a tener otro negocio en otra localidad o municipio también quisiera comprar unos animales más adelante.
Don Alberto tiene 51 años de edad está casado con la señora Mónica que tiene 46 años están casados desde hace 28 años, juntos han procreado 5 hijos uno aun dependen de ellos Jesús que tiene 16 años estudia la secundaria.
texts.en:
The “Barrio las Canoas” group is composed of seven women and four men.  They chose that name because that’s the name of the neighborhood where they live and the place is divided up into several sections.  However, what the members of this group most admire about their community is the trees because the neighbors from this community have been very good about caring for their trees.  The members of the group will use the loan to buy various amounts of sheep since this is what they are all involved in.  This is the first time they’ve participated in FRAC and KIVA loans.

However, the group representative is Alberto and he will invest the loan in his grocery store.  He will buy everything he considers necessary like: milk, bread, eggs, soft-drinks, sugar, water, beans, etc.  As a matter of fact, he will buy everything that sells the most which would be food items for the people in his community.

He’s been in business ten years and has had no problems lately. Previously he did because he’d sell on credit and then they wouldn’t want to pay him back so he stopped selling on credit; he doesn’t do it anymore because when payment time comes around many don’t want to pay and he has lost friendships that way.  His wife helps tend to the store and his goal is to have another business in another location or town; he’d also like to buy some animals later on.

Alberto is 51 years old and married to Mónica who is 46 years old.  They’ve been married for 28 years and have five children together.  Jesús, 16, goes to middle school and still depends on them.

loans.use: to buy everything needed to stock his store.

loans.name: Rakhil's Group

texts.en:
Rakhil is 32 years old. Her husband operates a glass selling business. He also manufactures glass items like doors, tables and windows for his customers on order. Rakhil is a beauty expert and operates a beauty salon at her home through which she offers her services of bridal make up, hair cutting, etc to her clients. She has given birth to three daughters. Two of her daughters study. The youngest daughter is only one year old. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy glass in a larger quantity that will allow him to provide better quality services to his clients and earn him more profits. He has a good experience in his business and has been operating it for the past eight years. Rakhil is hopeful that after an investment, he will be able to make more profits, which will allow her family to live a better financial life. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rakhil.

loans.use: To buy glass

loans.name: Custodio

texts.es: Custodio de 27 años, casado con rosa de 23 años, fruto de este amor tuvieron 2 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de jose Olaya, Pangoa. Custodio es un hombre humilde, con ganas de sobresalir. Cuenta que cuando llegó a este lugar en busca de mejores condiciones de vida, se dio cuenta de que las cosas no eran tán fáciles, pero como él es un hombre de entrega rápidamente fue adecuándose a las formas de trabajo. Gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad, demostro habiliada y desde entonces nunca le falto trabajo. Pero tampoco todo el tiempo trabajaría de peón, desde que tuvo su familia decidió comprar un terreno con cultivos de cacao que ahora es su fuente de ingreso, ahí mismo cultiva café y árboles maderables que a la larga le generará ingresos. Custodio está feliz por dedicarse a este negocio que le va muy bien. Su producto final lo expende en el centro poblado de canayre donde se encuentra los grandes acopiadores. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,500 soles que solicita, contratará peones para que se encarguen de limpiar un terreno virgen, que pronto cultivará cacao.
texts.en: Custodio, 27 years old, is married to Rosa, 23 years old, whose two children are the fruit of their love. They live in their own home located in the community of Jose Olaya, Pangoa. Custodio is a humble man with a desire to excel. He says that when he arrived to this place in search of better living conditions, he realized that things were not so easy. However, as he is a man of action, he quickly adapted to the ways of work. Thanks to his effort and perseverance, he demonstrated skill and since then has never lacked work. He also won't always work as a laborer. Since he began a family he decided to buy land with cocoa crops which is now his source of income. There he grows coffee and timber-yielding trees that will generate income for him over time. Custodio is happy to make a living in this business that is going well for him. He sells his final product in the village Canayre's center where the main middle men are located. This will be his first loan with MFP due to which he has committed himself to making his payments on time. With the 2,500 soles that he's requesting, he will hire laborers who will see to clearing the virgin earth that will soon grow cocoa.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Ehritam

texts.en: Ehritam is a 51-year-old farmer who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last ten years. He is married and has three children. His wife helps Ehtiram to run the business. He usually sells his crops in the central bazaar. His business generates 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) profit per month.  He would like to expand his business and for this purpose he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. This will be the second loan from AqroInvest and he has a good client history.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a widow with five dependents. Aba sells salted fish and other food items at Kwahinkrom. She has done this for thirty years. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees.
 
She will use her loan to purchase more salted fish and other food items.  With the new profit, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy salted fish and other food items.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a 26-year-old man with four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Abdalla has operated a fish selling business for the past six years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase a boat and fishing nets for his business. He decided to join Yehu because they have fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing nets for his business.

loans.name: Claudia Catalina

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga, tiene 42 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 17 años.
Claudia es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes y ropas, recuerda con mucha satisfacción todo lo que Finca le brindó y le pudo ayudar para progresar, ella empezó su negocio vendiendo gelatina y poco a poco reunió su dinero y empezó a traer ropas, tuvo su puesto en el mercado, cuando su papá necesitaba ayuda ella le pudo ayudar, agradece mucho a Finca que le ayudaron cuando ella mas lo requería, aprendió mucho de las capacitaciones que le dieron una guía para poder tener una vida ordenada, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos para tu tienda.
texts.en: Claudia is a member of the Amauta Huamanga Communal Bank. She is 42 years old and is the mother of two children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 17 years. Claudia owns a grocery and clothing store. She remembers with a lot of satisfaction, all that FINCA has offered her and how they've helped her to progress. She started her business selling gelatin and little by little she was able to save money and started to sell clothes too. She had her own place in the market and when her father needed help, she was able to help him. She appreciates that Finca helped her when she needed it most. Claudia has learned a lot through their trainings and they gave her a guide on how to live a more organized life. The current loan she is requesting through Finca, will be used to purchase cosmetics for her store.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Argenis De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Argenis es un carpintero quien desde muy joven aprendió este oficio y desde entonces lo practica en su propio taller ubicado en su casa localizada en el municipio de caldas ubicado al sur de la ciudad de Medellín. Antes de tener su propio taller, el señor Argenis trabajaba como operario en una empresa pero un accidente lo obligó a retirarse de su empleo, teniendo así que buscar la forma de trabajar para poder conseguir los ingresos para su sostenimiento y el de su esposa. El señor Argenis trabaja todos los días desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m con un conocido quien le ayuda en su taller. Para poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene en su carpintería, el señor Argenis necesita de la compra de madera y herramienta de trabajo que le permita cumplir con los pedidos. El sueño del señor Argenis es ampliar su carpintería y brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Argenis is a carpenter who learned the trade when he was very young.  Since then he has been working out of his workshop in his house, which is in the town of Caldas, south of the city of Medellín.  Before having his own workshop, Mr. Argenis worked as an operator for a private company but due to an accident had to retire and seek ways to earn an income to support his wife and himself.  

He works everyday from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. with an acquaintance who helps him at the workshop.  In order to fill pending orders, Mr. Argenis must buy wood and tools for his work.  His goal is to expand his carpentry business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wood and tools such as hammers, a screwdriver and a drill.

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 1 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Benita is the coordinator of her group Unidas Para Triunfar (United to Triumph). This group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. All the 10 women are dedicated to selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, beauty salon, etc. Benita makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Benita is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. All these loans have given the opportunity to increase her sales and to get more clients. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes like jean pants, t-shirts, blouses and underwear, also she is planning to buy a bag of used clothes, which she could sells by pieces.

Benita will use the profits to save, she has been finishing her house by using previous loans benefits and her house is almost built. Her dream is to one day be able to travel the world with her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and a bag of used clothes to resell

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 33 años, convive con Liliana de 26 años fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos con los que viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Tarancato del distrito de Pichari. William es un hombre honesto en su trabajo, él se dedica al cultivo de cacao y café, que son productos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. Por ello tiene más de 10 años cultivando éste producto, aunque al principio estaba desanimado, porque aún no percibía los ingresos suficientes, y eso lo desanimaba continuar. Pero su querida esposa intervino, por lo que no permitió dejarlo; ya que William decidió inclusive vender su terreno agrícola. Ahora William agradece a su querida esposa que gracias a ella, logró mantener su parcela y actualmente esta recibiendo buenas ganancias de la producción de éste producto, por lo que ahora deesa ampliar la siembra. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará plantas de café para sembrarlos.
texts.en:
William is 33, and lives with his partner Liliana, 26. They have two children, with whom they live in their own house, located in the community of Taracato, in Pichari district. In his work, William is an honest man. He grows cacao and coffee, which are products with a lot of market demand. 

This is why he has been growing this product for more than 10 years, even though in the beginning he was discouraged, because he still wasn't earning enough income, and that discouraged him from continuing. 

William had even decided to sell his farmland, but his dear wife intervened and wouldn't let him give it up. Now William is grateful to his dear wife, because thanks to her, he managed to keep his parcel, and now he is getting good earnings from growing these crops.  

This why he now wishes to expand his plantation. This will be his second loan with MFP, so he promises to make his instalment payments on time. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy coffee seedlings for planting.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a single man who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year he has operated a poultry business, selling at the market to café operators and restaurant operators. He faces major challenges in the high cost of transportation and in competition. Amani dreams of establishing a big poultry farm in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) he wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feeds. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is  young and energetic, and he is happy to serve his community and to uplift the welfare of his family. Eric is married with two children and lives in the crowded Kawangware neighborhood of Nairobi.  Eric has been involved in small-scale retail business, and now he wants to purchase a motorcycle to  make a difference in his community by engaging in community health outreach programs run by a local  Community-Based Organization (CBO). A motorcycle will enable him to do volunteer community health work, along with income-generating activities, more efficiently. 

Additionally, he will enroll in the local clinic to be on call for any emergencies at night. He will also take part in volunteer community health worker (CHW) counseling lessons for advising youth on drug abuse and HIV/AIDS prevention. 

Eric is excited to own his own motorcycle and is ready to give back to the community as a trainee CHW volunteer in Nairobi. Eric will also use the income generated from his motorcycle business to support his family and pay back this loan.

He plans to buy another motorcycle and support more CHWs in future. Eric wants to lead youth to volunteer as CHWs in their communities, aiming to recruit more members.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to support community health work

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.en:
Maria Concepcion is a very hard-working woman, with 3 children to take care. She needs to work every day to help with the family expenses. She is married to Daniel who works as truck driver; he earns an unstable salary and this makes it more difficult to cover the education and expenses for their three children. She decided to start her own business 2 years ago, which is a homemade foods sales business. Her work place is in her own kitchen, where she cooks different Mexican foods and offers them among her neighbors and well-known people.

Maria Concepcion is recognized in her neighborhood by her excellent ability to cook and the next Christmas season she hopes to have a great demand for her Mexican foods. For that reason she requires a loan of $275 USD to purchase raw materials that allows her to increase her production capacity and sales. She hopes to be able to cover her Christmas demands. Maria Concepcion needs your support and your generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Concepción es una mujer muy trabajadora, con 3 hijos a su cuidado, ella necesita trabajar todos los días para ayudar con los gastos de su familia. Casada con Daniel quien trabaja como chofer de un camión de carga, percibe un salario inestable y esto hace más difícil cubrir los gastos de educación para sus tres hijos.
