Ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace 2 años, el cual consiste en vender comidas caseras. Su lugar de trabajo es en su propia cocina, donde prepara diferentes comidas mexicanas y las ofrece entre sus vecinos y conocidos.

Concepción es reconocida en su barrio por su excelente habilidad para cocinar y esta próxima temporada navideña ya cuenta con una gran demanda que desea sus comidas, por lo que requiere de un préstamo de $275 USD para la compra de insumos que le permitan aumentar la capacidad de producción y venta, ella espera hacer frente a la alta demanda navideña. Concepción necesita de tu apoyo y tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: I am a grandmother of 32. My 4 daughters and 1 son died of HIV/AIDS. I am the main breadwinner. I sell food stuffs. I will use the loan to expand my business and meet the basic needs of my dependents and be able to pay for their school fees.

loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hadiyahon

texts.en: Hadiyahon has been a client of Microinvest for a year. She is married, is 49 years old and has 3 children. She receives a small pension and her trading is an addition to her income. Her business is small, but allows her to cover the family's expenses. She sells national Tajik shoes and different small things. She goes to Istaravshan to buy goods. The demand for her goods is high and Hadiyahon tries to always be in the market in order not to lose customers. She is asking for a loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: A business woman who sells river fish and crayfish, Mrs. Betty O. hails from Benin City. She is 49 years of age, has two (2) children, and is married to Mr. O.. According to her, if the amount of $400 is given to her, it will go a long way in boosting her business by allowing her to buy more river fish and crayfish. She is a trustworthy LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more crayfish and river fish

loans.name: Ni Wayan Weg

texts.id:
Nyoman Weg is originally from Timbrah village, Karangasem. Since 1981 she moved to Denpasar to work. Her business is a Food stall. The location of her food stall is quite strategic, next to a school. This has a positive impact on her business. At school times, her food stall is busy from incoming school children. In that time daily profit could reach Rp45,000 (about US$5). Daily expenses of Rp15,000 (about US$1.65) is manageble. Of course she is thinking of savings, since she would not be working forever. At this moment she lives with her 2 sons. Both are working, but not yet married. Her husband passed away. Although a widow she is busy running her business. Also her 2 sons support her in the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Nyoman Weg berasal dari Desa Timbrah, Karangasem. Sejak tahun 1981 dia pindah ke Denpasar untuk bekerja. Usaha yang ditekuninya yaitu warung makanan. Letak warung makanannya cukup strategis. Warungnya terletak bersebelahan dengan sekolahan. Hal ini berdampak positif dengan usaha warung makanannya. Pada musim sekolahan warung makanannya ramai dikunjungi oleh para murid. Selama ini keuntungan per hari yang dia peroleh mencapai Rp 45.000,00. Biaya hidup perhari Rp 15.000,00 dapat ia penuhi. Tentu saja dia berpikir untuk menabung, karena tidak selamanya dia bisa bekerja. Saat ini dia tinggal bersama 2 anak laki-lakinya. Keduanya masing – masing sudah bekerja, namun belum menikah. Sementara suaminya telah meninggal dunia. Walaupun dia janda tapi dia tetap tekun menjalankan usaha. Lagipula kedua anaknya tetap mendukungnya.

loans.use:
To add business capital

Menambah modal usaha.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: 49 year old Kamil  lives in Khachmaz town with his wife and 3 children. He has a butcher shop. This man buys calves to process and sell for meat.  He needs a loan of $950 to buy 2 calves.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Ashurgul

texts.ru:
Ashurgul R. is 48 years old, she has secondary education, married with 4 children. Ashurgul has been breeding cattle for the past 15 years. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 young calves for breeding and sales. She plans to sell them after 40-45 days of feeding. She will use her loan to buy food for the calves and the rest of it to help support her family. Ashurgul's son is also helping her with the business.

She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рустамова Ашургул, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Ашургул уже в течение 15 занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. На полученный кредит Ашургул планирует приобрести 2 молодых бычков для их откормки и продажи. Она планирует продавать их в течение 40-45 после. На полученный кредит она будет покупать молодых бычков и корм для них, а оставшуюся сумму будет использовать для оказание помощи в содержание своей семьи. В этом бизнесе ей помогает сын.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Breeding and sales of cattle

loans.name: Wakimese A Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Hasifa K.. She is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to purchase more chicks. Hasifa is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has 4 children ranging in age from 2 to 10 years, and all her children go to school.

Hasifa is joined in her small group by Deborah W., Grace K., Mariam N., and Suzan N.. Deborah Wanyana has a business operating a retail shop and wants to expand her business. Grace K. is currently operating a poultry business and wants a loan to buy poultry feed. Mariam N. also operates a poultry business and wants to start up a pig business. Suzan N. is currently in the salon business and is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment.

loans.use: To expand he poultry business

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.en:
Zulhumor O. is a married 39-year-old mother of two living in Kairakkum. For the past 12 years, Zulhumor has earned a living by selling the fabric used to make national dresses. These dresses are an important part of Tajikistan culture: Every girl must own some for her dowry, and women wear them on important occasions. As a result, Zulhumor's fabric is in high demand.

Today Zulhumor has requested a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to purchase more fabric in order to expand her business. Her income is crucial in supporting her family, and she hopes to secure a stable future for her children. Zulhumor has a solid credit history, and she is confident that she'll be able to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to expand a clothing business

loans.name: Sugiri

texts.id:
Sugiri is a roaming fruit vendor. He sells bananas, salak and oranges that has been packed in small batches to be sold in local kiosks, that are mostly his regular clients. He buys those fruits in bulk from the local market, then packed in smaller batches. Each day, Sugiri can earn about $7 profit. He uses the earnings for daily living expenses and to pay is two kids' tuition. He wants to improve his business and family's finances. He and his wife dreams that his kids wil finish school all the way.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sugiri adalah seorang pedagang buah yang setiap hari berkeliling dengan sepeda motornya, buah yang dijualnya adalah pisang, salak dan jeruk yang sudah dibungkus-bungkus untuk dijual di warung-warung yang sebagian adalah para langganan Sugiri. Buah-buah yang dijual Sugiri didapatkannya dari pasar buah yang dibelinya dengan jumlah yang banyak kemudian dibungkus. Dalam sehari Sugiri mendapatkan keuntungan sekitar 60.000 rupiah/hari, yang dipakai untuk biaya hidup setiap hari serta membiayai kedua anaknya yang masih kecil dan sekolah. Keinginan untuk menjadikan hidup lebih baik merupakan harapan dari Sugiri bersama keluarga, bisa membesarkan dan menyekolahkan anak merupakan mimpi dari setiap orangtua seperti Sugiri.

loans.use: Fund to Buy Fruits to be resold

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda has worked selling gas for three years. The idea to involve herself in this business came from an acquaintance who assured her that it was profitable and that there were opportunities. She was immediately convinced to file all the necessary paperwork to undertake her gas business. Once she did so, she realized that these papers would also help her receive loans and start new businesses. Thanks to a loan she was able to build her home and she worked renting rooms to businesses and as apartments. Happily she has the support of her husband who works as a carpenter, and also her children. With the money she earns from her businesses, she sets aside a large part for her home and her children, and she saves the remaining money with the goal of building more rooms in order to rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Nilda se dedica a la venta de gas desde hace tres años. La idea de involucrarse en este negocio vino de un familiar quien le aseguro que era rentable y que ella tenía las posibilidades. Es así que de inmediato se convenció de legalizar todos los papeles necesarios para emprender su negocio de gas. Una vez que lo hizo se dio cuenta que estos papeles le servían también para recibir préstamos y emprender nuevos negocios. Gracias a un préstamo ella pudo construir su casa y se dedico al alquiler de habitaciones para negocios y como vivienda. Felizmente ella cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja como carpintero, y también de sus hijos. Con el dinero que recibe de sus negocios, ella destina una gran parte para su casa e hijos y la otra parte la ahorra con la meta de seguir construyendo más habitaciones y alquilarlas.

loans.use: Finish construction of a bedroom in her home in order to rent it out

loans.name: Miralem

texts.en: Miralem A. is a 46-year-old trader who keeps his own store in the Bilasuvar region. He has more than twenty years of experience in this field. He is married and has three children. He has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.name: Melegalenuu

texts.en: Melegalenuu F., 48, is married with six children. She's the centre chief of their community of 34 women running different small businesses. Her husband is a farmer by profession supporting her business. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 2 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$250 USD). SPBD loans are Melegalenuu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Melegalenuu would like to purchase pesticides and chemicals for her plantation.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra weaves huipiles (the typical dress of Guatemala women) by hand and raises chickens, ducks, and turkeys. She has woven since she was a little girl, but with more simple patterns. Five years ago she began to weave really detailed and fancy huipiles, such as for weddings. These cost a lot to weave, not only in terms of thread, but also, more than anything, in terms of time. She works for up to two or three months on one huipil, but she can sell them in the city of Antigua Guatemala for 3,000 to 3,700 Guatemala Quetzals (US$400-500), depending on the quality and level of detail. Alejandra is very talented and weaves very beautiful huipiles.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more thread for weaving her huipiles and to buy more chickens and turkeys, food for them, and medicine to prevent illnesses. She also would like to make improvements to the shelter where she keeps them, such as constructing better walls and buying more corrugated tin to better protect them from the rain. Right now she has one cow in addition to a bunch of chickens, ducks, and turkeys. When they are big she takes them to the market in the nearby city of San Martin Jilotepeque for sale.

Alejandra is married and her husband works in construction in Guatemala City. They have six children ranging in age from six to twenty-one years old. All of her children have studied or are currently studying, but only up to the sixth grade because of a lack of economic resources. Her oldest son just got married in February and, while this was a very happy occasion, it cost a lot, so this loan would help Alejandra a lot right now, as resources are currently a little tight. This is her first loan with FAPE and she is really excited to have the opportunity to invest in her businesses. She notes that if she doesn’t have thread, she can’t work, so she needs this loan right away to help her continue working.

Alejandra has many dreams for her businesses and her family. She wants to expand her businesses enough to increase her income to be able to pay for more school for her children and to be able to buy more necessities for them, such as shoes and better clothing. More than anything she dreams that her children study, find jobs, prosper, and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Alejandra teje güipiles (el vestido típico de mujeres en Guatemala) a mano y cría pollos, patos, y chompipes. Ha tejido desde chiquita, pero con diseños más sencillos. Hace cinco años, empezó a tejer güipiles muy detallados y elaborados, como para bodas. Estos cuestan mucho para tejer, no solo en términos de hilo sino, más que nada, en tiempo. Ella trabaja por hasta dos o tres meses en un güipil, pero los puede vender en la ciudad de Antigua Guatemala por 3.000 a 3.700 Quetzales Guatemaltecos (aproximadamente $400-500), dependiendo de la calidad y nivel de detalle. Alejandra tiene mucho talento y sus güipiles son bellísimas.

Está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar más hilo para tejer güipiles y para comprar más pollos y chompipes, comida para ellos, y medicinas para ellos para prevenir enfermedades. También tiene ganas de mejorar el refugio donde guarda los pollos, como con unas vallas mejores y más lámina para protegerlos de la lluvia. Ahora tiene un ganado además que varios pollos, patos, y chompipes. Cuando están grandes, los lleva al mercado en la ciudad cercana San Martin Jilotepeque.

Ella es casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil en la ciudad capital de Guatemala. Tienen seis hijos de edades desde seis a veintiuno años. Todos sus hijos han estudiado o están estudiando, pero solamente hasta el sexto básico por falta de recursos económicos. Su hijo más grande acaba de casarse en Febrero, y aunque este era una ocasión muy feliz, costó mucho, entonces ahora este préstamo la ayudaría muchísimo en este momento, porque tiene pocos recursos ahora. Este es su primer préstamo de FAPE, y está muy emocionada de tener la oportunidad de invertir en sus negocios. Dice que si no tiene hilo, no puede trabajar, entonces necesita el préstamo ahorita para ayudarle en seguir trabajando.

Alejandra tiene muchos sueños para sus negocios y para su familia. Quiere crecer sus negocios bastante para aumentar sus ganancias para pagar para más estudios para sus hijos y para comprar más necesidades como zapatos y ropa mejor. Ella sueña que, más que nada, sus hijos estudien, encuentren empleo, prosperen, y sigan adelante.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving huipiles; to buy chickens and turkeys, food for them, and medicine to prevent illnesses

loans.name: Paulet

texts.en:
Paulet O. sells drinks in her shop located in the Agdede area of Lagos State, Nigeria. Paulet sells drinks like malt, soft drinks, juice, and alcoholic beverages. Paulet is 36 years old and married with one child. She is a LAPO client.

Paulet needs the loan amount of US$ 1200 to buy more drinks for sale. She says that this will increase her profit growth. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Celso

texts.es: Celso tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y muy emprendedor, desde muy temprana edad se dedicó al transporte de pasajeros, ahora es propietario de un motocarro, el cual es gran ayuda para el sustento de su  familia, ya que él aporta con el gasto del mercado familiar, muy aparte de sus gastos personales. En sus ratos libres, se dedica a reparar motos, ya que aprendió empíricamente este oficio, sin embargo, ahora necesita de un capital para la compra de repuestos para el arreglo de su motocarro, y poder trabajar tranquilo sin interrupciones.
texts.en:
Celso is 28 years old and single. He is a very hard worker, and has been in the transportation business since he was young. Now Celso owns a motorized rickshaw, and the income that he earns helps to support his family. In his free time he repairs vehicles, a skill that he has taught himself over time. Celso needs capital to buy spare parts to repair his rickshaw, so that he can work peacefully, without interruptions.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts to repair his motorized rickshaw

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Mrs. Nan C., 32, is a farmer and raises pigs in the Tuol Chombok Village, Kompong Cham Province, earning around $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Dy Thea, 34, is a farmer too. Nan has two children, both in primary school. Nan requests a loan of 1,200,000 Riel to purchase more small piglets and food to feed them. She and her husband hope the loan will make their family’s living conditions better and help further their children's studies.

loans.use: To purchase more small piglets and food to feed them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy four more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Lissette Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lissette S. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a la venta de derivados del maíz como lo es el refresco de chicha muy común en Nicaragua y en su ciudad de León donde comercializa este producto en el mercado La Estación.

Es importante destacar que la señora S. es madre de dos hijos que debe de mantener sus estudios debido a que es madre soltera. Es por este motivo que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para su respectiva comercialización en su establecimiento en el mercado La Estación de la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
Lissette S. works very hard selling products derived from corn, such as chicha, a type of cold beverage. Chicha is very common in Nicaragua and in her town of Leon, where she sells it in the La Estacion Market. It is important to point out that Ms. S. is the mother of two children and that she is responsible for their continuing education as she is a single mother. This is why she is looking for support from Kiva partner Ceprodel in order to get a loan to buy the products she sells in the La Estacion Market in the city of Leon.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn to make beverages

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.en:
Rosa Maribel is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. She is 33 years old and is married, with two children who are 4 and 3 years old. Rosa Maribel sells “cancha,” a popular local snack made of salted, toasted corn or pasta, and "cocoliche," a sweet snack made of sweetened, inflated pasta. Rosa sells cancha and cocoliche both wholesale and by the kilo. Together with her husband and several workers, Rosa takes the corn off the husk and toasts it in a large oven. She has had this business for the past three years. 

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy corn, pasta, and sugar. Her goal for the future is to own her own home. She currently lives in a rental house.

loans.use: Buy corn, pasta and sugar

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, vive en el Jr. Progreso Nº 172, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 48 años y es madre de 3 hijos quienes todavía dependen de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja es jubilado en educación, quien le apoya en el negocio. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en el negocio de venta de abarrotes ubicado en su casa. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el negocio de venta de abarrotes y golosinas  lo que genera un ingreso diario permitiendo el pago puntual de las letras del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/. 1,500 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara artículos para regalos, 1 saco de arroz,  fideos en cantidad, menestras, bebidas gasificadas, etc.

Yolanda manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Yolanda belongs to “Los Eucaliptos” (“Eucalyptus”) Community Bank and lives in the Tarapoto district of San Martín. She is 48 years old, the mother of three dependent children, and lives with her partner. Her partner is a retired teacher and helps her with her business.

Yolanda has been working with the bank for two years. She used her first loan of 300 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $95) to start a grocery store in her home. Her store currently generates enough income to guarantee the punctual repayment of her loan.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles (US $475), to be repaid in six months. She will invest the money in gift items, one sack of rice, bulk beans, canned soups, soft drinks, and other merchandise.

Yolanda is very grateful to Kiva's partner Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 38-year-old married man with two children, living in Ain A. Rimaneh in Beirut. He has been supplying and installing glass windows for the past 15 years, a profession that he inherited from his father. Jihad is now requesting US$ 1,000 to purchase merchandise to further expand his supply.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana started her business in March 2005. She had been looking for a way to be productive, and one day she accompanied a friend to pick up some brochures. From that she had the idea to start her own business selling items from catalogs. She bought a few catalogs and has been having good results continuing and growing this activity. 

Adriana needs a loan for $3,000 that she will repay in 6 installments, she wants the loan to purchase merchandise and have variety of products for the new summer season.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León la señora Francisca V. se dedica a trabajar arduamente para mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que ha iniciado a reconstruirla para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción tales como piedrín, cemento, ladrillos, laminas de zinc, entre otros para así continuar con obra y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
In the Telica district of the city of León, Francisca V. works tirelessly to improve her living conditions by making improvements to her home. She has begun rebuilding her house to provide better living conditions for her family.

The reason that Francisca has come to CEPRODEL is to request a loan to purchase construction materials such as gravel, cement, bricks, corrugated zinc sheeting, and other items to be able to continue construction and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
Ghazi has been working as a blacksmith for 25 years. He is a 54-year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Ghazi does his work well. His clients can be anybody from his region or surrounding regions. When he first started his business, he didn’t have start-up capital and he had to face competition. Ghazi decided on this business because he wanted to work independently and use his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose B. est une jeune femme de 25 ans mariée sans enfants. elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome. Dans son magasin, rose installe divers articles. Avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, elle souhaite réapprovisionner sa boutique. Les remboursements de son premier crédit ont été promptement effectués. Rose compte sur cette aubaine afin de réaliser ses ambitions.
texts.en:
Rose B. is a young woman of 25, married with no children yet. She owns a grocery store in Wome. In her store, Rose sells various items. With this second loan from FECECAV, she hopes to replenish her inventory. She made her repayments on the first loan in a timely manner. Rose is counting on this chance to realize her dreams.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: replenish her inventory

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina B., who lives in a suburb of Gradačac, is 27, married and the mother of one girl. Her husband is employed as a seasonal worker in construction outside of BiH while Jasmina is a housewife who keeps busy working in the field and her garden. She grows vegetable for her own use and produces strawberries, paprika and tomatoes for sale to earn extra income for the household.

She has already repaid three loans from WWI and is now requesting a fourth one in the amount of 1000 KM to buy supplies for growing fruits and vegetables. She hopes to develop this business and provide a higher living standard for her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy T., from the village of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon, is a 35-year-old married mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Dorothy owns and operates a specialized retail store, its main source of income derived from selling a variety of ready-to-wear items such as sandals, slippers and underwear. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Dorothy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, Dorothy is now requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education and provide for the needs of the family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy alegre y bastante ágil en sus actividades, vive con el padre de sus 7 hijos, de los cuales sólo los 6 menores viven en su casa. Se dedica a la crianza de vacas y al cultivo de sus chacras, pero lo que más le gusta es el cuidado de sus animales. Para ello se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para acumular la cantidad necesaria de forraje para alimentarlos, posteriormente sujeta a sus vacas, encerrando a los becerros en un corral, hasta que termine de ordeñar la leche y luego los alimenta, esa leche la lleva a su comprador quien le paga 1.60 soles por cada litro. Una vez terminada esta actividad carga las viandas del almuerzo en su espalda y camina entre 3 a 4 kilómetros de distancia hacia donde está su esposo trabajando en sus cultivos. Genoveva se siente muy feliz de hacer este trabaja cada día, ya que le genera buenas ganancias, permitiéndole acumular dinero para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Para el futuro, tiene planes de comprar más becerras para que cuando crezcan se conviertan en vacas lecheras que le ayuden a aumentar sus ingresos económicos diarios. Genoveva ingresa al noveno crédito con MFP y hace el compromiso de seguir cumpliendo como hasta ahora con sus cuotas de pago. Ella quiere mucho a su banco comunal, ya que en él encuentra compañerismo y apoyo. El dinero que viene solicitando lo va a invertir en la compra de chacras de avenas sembrada para alimentar a sus vacas, la otra parte es para la compra de fertilizantes con lo que sembrará papas.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 57 years old. She is a very happy woman who remains active in her work. She lives with the father of her 7 children, 6 of whom still live at home. She raises cows and plants crops, but of those two activities, she enjoys caring for her animals the most.

She wakes up each morning to gather the necessary amount of fodder to feed her cows. Once the cows are together in a single place, she locks up the calves in a corral until she finishes milking and feeding the adults. The milk is delivered to a buyer who pays 1.60 soles per liter. After that, she packs a lunchbox on to her back and walks 3 to 4 kilometers to where her husband is working in the fields.

Genoveva is very happy to do this work every day because it generates a good income and allows her to accumulate money to maintain her home. In the future, she plans to purchase more calves that become full grown dairy cows that can help increase her daily earnings.

Genoveva is on her ninth loan with MFP and is committed to completing her payments as she has done previously. She enjoys very much the companionship and support of her communal bank group. Part of the money she is requesting will be used to purchase another plot of land to plant oats that will feed her cows. The remaining funds will be set aside to buy fertilizer for her potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and animal feed

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina O. is married and has two children. Her husband is a physician. Faustina has received an education.

Faustina sells porridge and smoked fish at Elmina, which he has done since 1999. She uses her income to support her husband in paying for their children’s school fees.

Faustina will use the loan to purchase more fish for processing before selling them at the market and also to buy maize and beans to prepare her porridge which she sells in the morning. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to save and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for processing and to buy maize and beans to prepare her porridge

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda C. is from the village of Bacolod, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, is single, and has one school-aged child. Esmeralda owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling both food and daily used products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Esmeralda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Veronica De La Concepcion

texts.es: Verónica de la Concepción S. M. tiene 32 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la vena de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Lo más difícil para ella fue conseguir clientes por lo que tenía que salir a vender sus productos y con el tiempo fue obteniendo suficientes clientes. Verónica tiene mucho carisma y eso es lo que más les gusta a sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para damas, para caballeros, niños, cosméticos, toallas, sabanas y colonias. El deseo de Verónica es terminar de construir su casa que por proporcionarla a sus hijos lo necesario no ha podido comprar los materiales.
texts.en:
Verónica de la Concepción S. M. is 32, married, and she has three children. For over six years she has sold general merchandise. The most difficult part for her was getting customers. She had to leave to sell her products. In time she got enough customers. Verónica has a lot of charisma, and this is what her customers like best. The money she is asking for is for working capital to buy clothes for women, men, and children. She will also buy cosmetics, towels, sheets, and cologne. Verónica’s dream is to finish building her house. Providing the necessities for her children has not allowed her to buy the materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.es: Blanca Marina O. D. M. resiD. en Atiquizaya municipio del departamento D. Ahuachapán. Blanca D. 55 años D. edad, vive con su esposos y sus tres hijos. Blanca posee su propio negocio ubicado en su casa, donD. ofrece variedad D. servicios, como impresiones, fotocopiados, anillados, alquiler D. computadoras por hora. Blanca solicita un crédito para comprar papelería que utiliza en su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca Marina O. D. M. lives in the Atiquizaya municipality in the Ahuachapán department. Blanca, 55, lives with her husband and their three children. Blanca has her own business, which is located in her house. She offers a variety of services like printing, photocopies, binding services, and computer rental by the hour. Blanca is asking for a loan to buy stationery to use in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stationery for her busines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing gasoline and motor oil

loans.name: Mohisa

texts.en:
Mohisa R., currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant, is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs such as beans and rice. Mohisa, 22 years old and married to a peasant, has two children, both of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay their school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Maria de Jesús C. de 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores los cuales trabajan y le ayudan  su pequeño negocio es la venta de café, pan, comida,  y tiene 26 años vendiendo, y ha logrado tener su clientela, comenzó  con  préstamos y su objetivo ha sido mejorar su casa para tener una casa digna. Vive en barrio marginal donde hay aguas negras,  preocupante ya que cada familia tiene que pagar los gastos para hacer su sumidero y poder estar en condiciones higiénicas, sus planes es poder ampliar su negocio, vender mas. Con este crédito comprara zinc para cambiar una hoja mala que tiene en el techo y no quiere sufrir otro invierno más ya que tiene que mover sus cosa para que no se frieguen, también comprara cerámica para poner en la sala y poder estar en condiciones mejores todo esto gracias a los financiamiento de Afodenic que da las gracias por hacer posible los sueños de cada familia Nicaragüense
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria de Jesus C. is a 47-year-old single mother of 6 older children who work and help her with her small business, in which she sells coffee, bread, and food. She has done this for 26 years and has managed to build up a clientele. She began with loans and her objective has been to improve her house in order to have a decent place to live. She lives in a neighborhood in the outlying area of the city, where there is contaminated water, which is troubling since each family has to pay expenses to make their own drain and be able to be in hygenic conditions. Her plans are to expand her business and sell more. With this credit she will purchase zinc in order to change out a bad sheet on her roof. She does not want to suffer through another winter this way, since she has to move her things so they don't get ruined. Also, she will buy ceramics to put in the living room and improve the conditions, all thanks to the financing of Afodenic, which makes possible the dreams of every Nicaraguan family.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase zinc to replace some sheets on her roof and ceramics to put in her living room

loans.name: Rosa Anastasia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Anastasia se dedica a la actividad de elaboración de alimentos siendo comercializados por ella misma y elaborados con la más alta calidad para beneficiar a los clientes que le compren. 

Ella requiere comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros con el propósito de elaborar los alimentos y por esto es que ella espera en que el crédito le sea otorgado y así continuar sus ventas en su localidad y así llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Anastasia sells food that she prepares herself. Her dishes are of high quality and provide enjoyment to the customers who buy them.

She needs to buy rice, beans, oil, and other products used in preparing her dishes. For this reason, she hopes her loan will be approved so that she can continue selling from her vending post and supporting her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro vive en la calle “Manoa”  de la zona Brasil en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es soltero vive en unas habitaciones las cuales tomo en alquiler.

Trabaja en la confección de chamarras y buzos deportivos a poca escala, los cuales vende a los intermediarios.
 

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de telas y cuero al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos.
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Ramiro lives on Manoa Street in the Brasil area of the city of El Alto. He is single and lives in some rented rooms. He makes jackets and tracksuits on a small scale and he sells them through intermediaries. He will use the loan to purchase fabric and leather wholesale and thereby lower his costs. This is his first loan with Impro whose evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum That is 59 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang province, where she and her husband make a living farming rice. Beside their farm work, the family also goes to shovel sand in and around the lakes to sell for extra income. The older couple now has three married and three single children. Almost all of their children are employed at different occupations. In the past, Chum That has rented a boat to use as transportation for the sand sales that is part of her business activity. To reduce the hiring fee, she hopes to own a boat but she has no money yet to buy one. That is why she requested a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To buy a boat.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 34-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Wissam owns a pickup truck that he has used for three years to transport construction materials or even furniture. He decided to start this business because he realized that he could improve his financial situation since this business allows him to increase his income.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to do some maintenance work on his truck. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His clients are people from his region and from the surrounding villages. In the future, he plans to keep expanding his business.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his truck.

loans.name: Las Negras Group

texts.es:
El grupo las negras está integrado por Elizabeth C., Verónica P. y Yolanda P.. Ellas decidieron ponerse este nombre para demostrar lo orgullosa que son por ser morenas.
	
Yolanda P.  tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual quiere mejorar e invertir mayor cantidad de productos. Mientras  Elizabeth C.  se dedica a vender cosméticos  de manera ambulante y Verónica P. también comercializa dicho productos.
texts.en:
The Las Negras Group is comprised of Elizabeth C., Verónica P., and Yolanda P.. They decided on this name because they wanted to show how proud they are of their dark skin. Yolanda P. has a small mini-market, which she wants to improve and invest in a greater quantity of products. Elizabeth C. sells cosmetics as a traveling salesperson. Verónica P. also sells said products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, meat, instant soup, vegetables, and stationery, etc.

loans.name: Ruly Mary

texts.es:
Ruly es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Ruly es conviviente, tiene 33 años, 2 hijos y esta esperando a su tercer hijo, Ruly se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal en la comunidad de Compañía, sus productos lo vende en el mismo lugar y también los lleva a las obras. Además Ruly vende comida.
Ruly necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y ladrillos crudos para quemar.
Los sueños de Ruly son ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ruly is an associate of the Los Trigales (wheat fields) Communal Bank. Ruly lives in a shared home. She is 33 years old, has children and is expecting her third child. Ruly is dedicated to the production of bricks by hand in the community of Compañía. She sells her products from her workplace and also carries them to worksites. Ruly also sells food. Ruly needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and raw bricks to fire. Ruly hopes to expand her business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and raw bricks to be fired.

loans.name: Den

texts.en:
Den T., age 49, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in the business of weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning approximately $4 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has been with this business since 2004. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. The standard of living has been improved since T. began this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. 

T. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more silk. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to weave for sale

loans.name: Rito

texts.es:
La persona que sale en la fotografía es la esposa de Rito C. Míreles.

Rito C. Míreles es una persona trabajadora que quiere ir mejorando su calidad de vida; es por ello que ha ido construyendo su vivienda poco a poco para ofrecer a su familia comodidad y un buen patrimonio para el futuro. El señor quiere terminar un baño que empezó hace tiempo y por otras cosas que se le han presentado no ha podido terminarlo; por eso es que pide el apoyo para terminar su proyecto ya que necesita pintar el baño y comprar accesorios.
Rito es quien mantiene la casa es por ello que tiene dos trabajos, uno en el se desempeña como chofer de transporte de carga y el otro como vendedor de casas y con estos ingresos pagara el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Rito C. M.' wife. Rito C. M. is a hard-working person who wants to improve his quality of life. This is why he has been building his home gradually to offer his family comfort and equitiy for the future. He wants to finish a bathroom that he began some time ago and which, due to unforeseen circumstances, has been unable to complete. The funds will be used to finish the bathroom; it needs paint and several accessories. Rito supports his household with two jobs: he transports cargo and sells real estate. He will use income from these to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Com complete bathroom interior finishes.

loans.name: Sonia Maritza

texts.en:
Sonia Maritza G. M. lives in Pococi, Limón, a rural area located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. Sonia lives on a farm where she is involved in various productive activities including animal rearing (and selling), harvesting crops such as bananas, plantains and peppers, and the production of organic fertilizer. This loan will be used to make general investments in the expansion of her various productive activities. For example, Sonia plans to use this loan to finance the purchase of chickens and animal feed as well as nutrients to use when working with her crops.

The daily routine in Sonia’s family consists of an early wakeup followed by tending to the animals and then working on fertilizer production and tending to the crops. Her goal is to everyday improve her productive methods and to integrate her family into the farming process.

Sonia has lived on the farm in Pococi for the past six years. She is described by the loan consultant that has been working with her as a hardworking, organized woman with an entrepreneurial spirit. Sonia is dedicated to her business as much as she is to her family. She would like to study English and accounting; her dream is to brand her farm as a rural tourist destination where individuals interested in organic foods could come to observe her methods of production. Sonia is very knowledgeable about agriculture and she hopes to use this loan to exploit the benefits of her home-made organic fertilizer. Occasionally, Sonia offers workshops to people interested in agriculture and farming.

Sonia has cited communication problems as one of her main obstacles. At the moment, she is waiting to hear back from the government body in charge of phone installations to find out how she might go about getting a phone in her home. Another obstacle for her has been a lack of access to financial services. In the past, Sonia has not been able to obtain the economic resources necessary for the expansion of her poultry-selling business. This loan will fill the void in financial services that has existed in the past for Sonia and her family.

loans.use: To finance the purchase of chickens and animal feed as well as crop nutrients

loans.name: Rik

texts.en:
Mr. Rik L. is 57 years old, and currently resides in Siem Reap province. He is a Khmer medical doctor who has learned the skill of producing medicine from his grandfather. The medicine is made from many kinds of tree roots. Rik L. is a good father of two school-aged children, who are dependent on him. He has a life partner in his wife, who owns farmland on which she cultivates a variety of crops. 

Rik L.’s wife has often faced difficulty irrigating her crops because the farmland is located far from the watering system. Because of this problem, Rik L. has decided to ask a loan in order to hire a laborer to dig a small pond, where he will pump the water for crops.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to dig a small pond for irrigation

loans.name: Aleyda Marynee

texts.es: La joven señora Aleyda de edad de 39 años, es madre de familia de tres hijos, que junto a su esposo dan el cuido. El trabaja como cadete de taxi, con ayuda de su esposo y ahorro logro comprar ropa usada  y comenzó a vender para poder ayudar a pagar gastos básicos, el cual se vender por ser bonita, barata, también vende juguetes y cosmético  productos Avon, estos por catálogos al gusto y preferencia del cliente, este producto  lo da al crédito de quincena. Con este financiamiento comprara cosméticos zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientes como poder dar los pedidos solicitados ya que no tiene en existencia. Solo ropa. Sus planes es lograr hacer mejoras a su casa ya que es  parte de concreto y tablas el cual desea hacer toda de concreto para una mejor seguridad ante la delincuencia. También proyectarse metas para el crecimiento de su negocio
texts.en:
Aleyda is 39 years old. She and her husband care for their three children. With the help of her husband, who works as a taxi driver, Aleyda was able to save enough money to buy used clothing to sell so that she could help pay for basic expenses. The clothing she sells is both beautiful and inexpensive. In addition, she sells toys and Avon cosmetics through a catalog based on her customers’ likes and preferences. She offers her products on credit for a two-week period.

With this loan, Aleyda will buy cosmetics and shoes to offer to her customers. This will allow her to fulfill her orders because she does not have anything in stock except clothing. Her plans include making improvements to her house because it is part concrete and part wooden boards. She wants to make her house all concrete so that it will provide better security against crime. Aleyda also has goals to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & shoes

loans.name: Tseveendolgor

texts.en: Tseveendolgor A., 51, is a widow and the mother of three children. She and her family live in an apartment in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Two of her children are university students and one of her daughters, Andrah, is a secondary-school student. Tseveendolgor makes a living as a tailor, sewing traditional Mongolian dresses and coats (known locally as Deel). She began operating this business in 1986 in her home, and has become a very experienced seamstress over the past 24 years. In 2007, she started manufacturing traditional clothing for local sellers, and has been very successfully in this field. Tseveendolgor says, “Now the most important thing to expand my business and create my own working capital by getting a loan. My dream is one day to open my own sewing workshop.” She has applied for a loan for 285,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for a tailoring business

loans.name: Remee

texts.en:
Remee F., 33 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Remee owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Remee has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Remee joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remee has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Remee is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Remee from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 35-year-old married man living with his parents and his three children. He has worked in construction since 1995 and has many years of previous experience. He works on a freelance basis, taking housing projects and other projects such as building shops.

After gaining a good reputation in this occupation, Ghassan plans to expand his business services. That is why he has now requested a loan to purchase steel beams for his work. He hopes, in the future, to keep on improving and expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase steel beams for his work

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es: Bernarda tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de productos platicos. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, pues sus inicios se han dado porque no tenía un trabajo que le proporcionara los ingresos mensuales. Pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido creciendo siempre le ha gustado ser una persona independiente y tener una forma cómo sobrevivir, por lo que disfruta de hablar e interactuar con sus clientes que siempre llegan a comprar a su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como valdes, bolsas, pajillas, entre otras cosas. Sueña con ampliar su negocio para establecer otro local.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 45 years old and has been selling plastic products for more than 11 years. She started this business because she did not have a job that could provide a monthly income. Her business has grown over time. Bernarda likes being an independent person and having a means of survival. She also enjoy talking and interacting with her customers who always come by her business to shop.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as buckets, bags, drinking straws, and other items. She dreams of expanding her business by opening another store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase buckets, bags, drinking straws, and other items

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people that located in Ping Pong village, Kandal province. Mrs. Sarom S. is 33 years old and is the leader of a group loan having been selected by its members. With the loans, the members of this group will use it’s to purchase supplies, equipments and other items to support their different purpose. 
 Mrs. Sarom S. and her husband, Mr. Poh Khorn, are farmers who work very hard to support their three children. Aside from farmer, Mr. Poh Khorn is also fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family living. For fishing business, Mrs. Sarom S. will use the loan that asked from AMK to buy fishnets for fishing. This couple has three children, two are attending in the local school and the youngest one is 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy fishnets for fishing.

loans.name: Pablo Santiago

texts.es:
Pablo Santiago J. P. tiene 32 anos. Vive soltero en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 anos. 

Pablo es un socio de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, arroz, soya, plátano, papaya, y otros.

Pablo se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz, cacao, café, plátano, y papaya. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao una vez por cosecha. 

Solicita el credito para invertir en la agricultura, para comprar maiz, y para comprar mas o menos 3 chanchos. El apoyo de este prestamo le daria éxito en su negocio y permitirlo seguir adelante. Su sueno es darles educación a sus hijos para que tengan éxito, y tambien que duplica su negocio. Un desafio que le ha enfrentado es que el precio de la venta del producto de maiz ha bajado. Espero que no baja el precio para la cosecha que viene. 

Le gusta pasar tiempo dando vueltas por la finca, mirando como estan las plantas.
texts.en:
Pablo Santiago J. P. is 32 years old. He is not married and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar province. He has 2 children who are 13 and 11 years old. Pablo is a member of the “Genesis” communal bank, which is located almost two hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, and the majority of them grow corn, rice, soy, cacao, coffee, plantains, papaya, and other crops. Pablo works in agriculture. He has corn, cacao, coffee, plantains, and papaya. He makes his purchases and sells his products in Mata de Cacao once per harvest. He is requesting the loan to invest in agriculture, to buy corn, and to buy approximately 3 pigs. The support of this loan would give him success in his business and allow him to get ahead. His dreams are to give an education to his children so they can be successful, and also to double his business. One challenge that he has confronted is that the price of corn has gone down. He hopes the price won’t go down again before the next harvest. He likes to pass his time walking around his farm, seeing how his plants are doing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in agriculture and to plant corn

loans.name: Nabih

texts.en:
Nabih is a 24-year-old married man, the father of one child, working in the construction field since 2002. He works as a builder, too, specializing in working with a certain kind of stone. 

This is his 1st time to request a loan from Al Majmoua. He wants to buy a Rapid; a useful car that will ease his travel to work. Nabih believes that this car will increase his job assignments and expand his working area.

loans.use: to buy a Rapid (car)

loans.name: Benkola  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Benkola IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et  en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles polygames à Siguila, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités agricoles. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, le pois de terre, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne et les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  KONIBA S. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environ 1, 3 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant e grandes villes.
KONIBA S. compte réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice  de 85.000FCFA.
texts.en:
The six members of the Benkola IV Group are married women who are on average 29 years old with two children. They live in polygamous families in Siguila, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture, part of the Koulikouro region in the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI with the intent of better organising their agricultural activities. The cash crops cultivated are millet, Bambara peas, peanuts and beans. This is their fourth loan request, the preceding ones having been fully reimbursed. With this new loan Koniba S. intends to buy agricultural inputs, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate approximately 1.3 hectares (3.2 acres) of millet and peanuts. After harvesting the crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to mostly retail merchants from large towns. By end of season Koniba S. hopes to attain earnings of 85,000 FCFA.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicides, weeding and small farming equipment

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en:
Byambaa C. is a 45 year old married woman with three children. She lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, with her family in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her two oldest children attend university and her youngest daughter attends a local high school. Her husband is a driver of a horse cart and transports a load to supplement his family income.

Byambaa operates a dairy trading business in her town. She purchases a large amount of dairy products from herders at wholesale price and sells back in a local market at retail price. She has been engaged in this business for 5 years and has built a stable operation. Over the years of operation, she has managed to expand her business and increase her product line, which sells 10 types of dairy products today. For the future, she hopes to grow her business by adding more product types. She is a very modest and hardworking person. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her children's tuition fees. Byambaa is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy supplies from herders in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy supplies.

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of Faith Group

texts.en:
The Women´s Bank of Faith is made up of nine women who live in La Rita, Limón, located near the Carribbean coast of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with these women describes them as a motivated collection of individuals with the desire and ability to work hard towards the success of the group as well as the overall improvement of living conditions for the members and their families. In general, the main obstacle to the success of these women has been a lack of access to working capital. This loan will enable the group members to invest in their businesses and expand operations. 

The women of this group are involved in various productive activities including the rearing and selling of animals (pigs and chickens) as well as commercial and industrial activities. Nuvia, Tania, Yesenia and Lilliana R. have businesses selling clothing in their community. For these women, this loan will be used to finance the purchase of inventory items such as clothing for men, women and children as well as shoes and jewelry. 

Lilliana Morin and Doris are in the business of animal rearing. While Lilliana raises chickens and pigs, Doris only handles chickens. For these two loan recipients, this loan will be used to finance investments in livestock, animal feed and construction materials (for the construction of animal pens).
Rita is the elected president of this group.  During the week, she takes care of her children and carries out domestic tasks at home. During this time, clients come to peruse various items she has for sale such as clothing, jewelry and shoes. On the weekends, she travels from door to door in her community selling items to clients. Sometimes, her husband goes with her and they travel to neighbouring communities in order to find new clients.
 
Rita says her main goal is to increase the income generated from her sales business. She says that with more revenue, she will be able to provide a higher standard of living for her family. She would also like to increase the amount of revenue she receives from sales to stores as opposed to individual clients. Rita explained that, like other group members, her main hindrance has been a lack of access to working capital. She says that this loan represents an opportunity to overcome this obstacle. 

The members of The Women´s Bank of Faith have been neighbours and friends for a number of years. The group acknowledges the advantages of the group lending model: the ability for each group member to act as a loan guarantor as well as recipient. They also acknowledge the potential disadvantage which could manifest itself if any members have trouble making repayments, as each individual is responsible for all repayments.

loans.use: For the purchase of clothing, jewelry, livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. worked as a hair stylist for many years at Ofir’s Beauty Salon in Brownsville. When her boss decided to sell the place in 2007, Maria jumped at the opportunity to buy the business. It has been challenging to manage her own business during this recession but Maria views her ability to sustain the salon as a success. She is grateful for the enthusiastic support she has received in becoming a business owner from her husband, a truck driver, and their four children. Maria is constantly seeking ways  to be innovative with her business and educate herself, and her employees, in new styling techniques. With the economy improving, Maria enjoys the increase in customers and referrals. 

With this loan, Maria plans to move to a larger location and buy new furniture. Before approaching ACCION Texas-Louisiana, Maria tried to access credit through banks. But without an established credit history, she was turned down. Without this loan, Maria would be unable to expand her business. “I am so grateful to ACCION for the work that they do. I am very aware and thankful for the fact that ACCION decided to trust me when other organizations wouldn’t,” she says.

Her advice to small business owners is, “If you give it 100%, you will see that anything is possible.”

loans.use: Relocate to another space and buy new furniture

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es: La señora Dulce Maria, tiene 35 años es una mujer casada y tiene 1 hijo el cual aun es menor de edad. Hace más 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de repostería y comida, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de su familia en general. Por lo que con todo el esfuerzo logro obtener capital propio, y en parte de su familia que la apoyaron para establecer este negocio. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de repostería, ya que actualmente tiene un buen pedido. Su deseo es de establecer un cafetín y que le brinden mayores ingresos a ella y su familia.
texts.en: Dulce Maria is 35  years old.  She is married and has one son who is still a child.  She began her business selling confectionery and other food more than 5 years ago.  The business is located in her house.  She started this business out of necessity because she didn't have enough income to support her family in general.  With a lot of effort she managed to obtain her own capital and also some from her family who supported her in setting up her business.  This loan will be used to buy confectionery since she currently has a good order.  Her wish is to set up a small café and to make a better income for herself and her family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Korng's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members. They live in Preaek Ta Ker village, Kandal province. This group loan selected Mr. Kong M., 39 years old, as the village bank president. The members of this group will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. 

He and his wife, Mrs. Hieng Koem Phieng, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate peanuts for a living. The peanut farming hasn't brought in enough money. So Mr. Kong M. would like to ask for a loan to buy peanut seeds and to pay for hired laborers to plow his farm to cultivate peanuts. 

They have three children. One is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others support their farm.

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds and pay for hired laborers

loans.name: Semuti Development Group A-Mityana

texts.en:
30-year-old Mary N. is affiliated with the Semuti Development Group-Mityana. For 2 years, she has been spending laborious hours developing her salon business in Maanyi. Mary says she got the idea to start this  business from close friends who had gone through the full mill of running businesses. 

Mary is happily married and has 4 children. Her monthly profits total 40,000 shillings. With this loan, she will refurbish her salon and purchase new salon equipment.

loans.use: To refurbish her salon and buy new salon equipment

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia Z. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old, married and has 6 adult children. Letecia owns & operates a transportation business, providing motorela or habal-habal services (motorela/habal-habal is a passenger carrying motorcycle with an extended seat). Her husband is the driver. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will also be used to purchase materials. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to maintain service

loans.name: Jhans

texts.es: Jhans, de 24 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que hace poco se independizo, pues ya alquilo un cuarto propio en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana), donde vive. Esté joven y emprendedor hombre siembra plátanos en una hectárea, mientras que en la otra hectárea siembra un poco de café. Según cuenta cada 15 días cosecha plátanos, ya tiene un año dedicándose a la agricultura, y asegura que gracias a Dios pudo vender a muy buen precio sus cultivos; pues los vendedores de la cooperativa de Sanchirio, reconocen el buen grano de café, que heredó de su papá Luis, de 45 años; pero sigue mejorando sus cultivos con la ayuda de su hermano Edwin, quien es su socio. Por todo lo que aprendió en está temporada, Jhans, desea ampliar sus platanales, replantando mamomes (bolsas de plátanos). Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante en compañía de su banco comunal, que son personas responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, planea comprar 5 sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales utilizará en próxima renovación.
texts.en: 24-year-old Jhans is a single, working man, that recently moved out of his parents’ home and rented his own room in the town of Unión Palomar (central Peruvian jungle), where he lives. This young entrepreneur sows plantains on one hectare of land, and a little coffee on the other hectare. According to Jhans, he harvests plantains every 15 days. He has been working in agriculture for a year already and he assures that, thanks to God, he was able to sell his crops for a very good price, since the sellers of the Sanchirio cooperative recognize the good coffee bean that he inherited from his father Luis (45). However, he continues to improve his crops with the help of his brother Edwin, who is his partner. Because of all that he learned over this period, Jhans wishes to increase his plantain plantations, replanting “mamomes” (plantain bags). This is the first time that he is taking a loan with MFP, and he hopes to get ahead in the company of his communal bank, which is made up of responsible people. With the loan that he is requesting, he plans to buy 5 sacks of organic fertilizer, which he will use in his next renovation.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Octavio Reinaldo

texts.en:
Octavio lives in the peri-urban area of Paraiso in Guayaquil. He is 32 years old and married. He and his wife have three children — a seven-year-old, a six-year-old, and a three-year-old. His two oldest children study in public schools.

When Octavio was 18 years old, he started working for a bakery. Three years ago he started his own bakery. He and his wife start work at 5:30am. They sell bread and sweets. With his loan, Octavio would like to buy a mixer for his bakery. 

The main problem Octavio deals with is the heavy rain in the winter; this makes it more difficult to transport the ingredients from the store to his bakery. In the future he would like to move his bakery to a bigger street where more people pass, so he can serve more customers.

loans.use: To buy a mixer for his bakery

loans.name: Zahava

texts.en:
Zahava is a 46-year-old widow, mother of seven. She is a hairstylist who opened her home-based salon three years ago. The salon is located in a small structure in the back of her house. She has outgrown her current location. Over the last year Zahava has planned the expansion of her salon so she will be able meet client demand. Zahava has another area adjacent to her home which would provide a larger, more client-friendly location.
	
The loan is needed to purchase the raw materials for renovations including pipes, plaster, sinks and flooring. Actual renovations are being taken care of by Zahava and her sons.

Zahava has steadily grown her business. In the future, she sees herself adding more hair design stations and employing two other stylists thus expanding her income and securing her future.

loans.use: purchase the raw materials for renovations including pipes, plaster, sinks and flooring

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a sixty-year-old married man with nine children, owning house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the bar business for nine years starting with one jerrycan of local brew plus one crate of beer. He now buys more than five crates. His hardship is seasonal customers and his vision is business expansion plus educating his children. Isaac wants the loan to buy drinks and repair his fridge.

loans.use: Buying drinks and repairing his fridge

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank L. owns Business Startups, LLC, whose mission statement is "to enhance the skills of entrepreneurs with tools and expertise for success." Business Startups helps entrepreneurs with setting up an accounting system, website design, and business formation (for corporations and LLCs). As an attorney, Frank has 25 years of legal and accounting experience, and has extensive experience working with for-profit and social entrepreneurs. Located in El Paso, Frank opened Business Startups this past January, 2011. His biggest challenge at the moment is marketing. Frank has an assistant who helps with managing the workload. Like Frank, his assistant works with clients by helping them prepare for small business ownership. Aside from Frank and his assistant, Business Startups hires an independent contractor to help clients design their businesses’ web pages. Frank is using this loan to help handle the initial cost of his assistant as well as other smaller operating costs. He says that even though the loan was small, "it took me over a hump and enabled me to launch my business with a more complete website, an employee and a strong infrastructure." Without this loan, Frank says getting Business Startups on its feet would have been more difficult. ACCION Texas-Louisiana was Frank’s first choice for taking out a loan, and is the first loan he has taken out for his business. "I have known about ACCION for many years. I believe in its philosophy and the concept of micro loans. I also know many people at ACCION. It is a great organization with great people." Mr. L.’s advice to other small business owners is, "… dream big, plan carefully, be persistent, work hard and have faith." On his website, he gives free advice and examples of essential things to consider when starting a business. This helps entrepreneurs understand the preparation needed for starting a business, and how Business Startups can help meet those needs with expert advice and planning. Check out the Business Startups, LLC website at www.bsups.com.

loans.use: To hire an employee to increase business capacity

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is employed and provides the family with their basic needs. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past three years, Jane has operated a business selling brooms, both at the market and from door-to-door to her neighbors and to passersby. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 Kshs, Jane plans to purchase brooms for resale. She decided to work with Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase brooms for resale

loans.name: Persevérance Plus Group

texts.en:
Veronique is the chairwoman of a community bank named “Persevérance Plus”, composed of 13 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Veronique is 36 years old and is married. She runs a telephone booth and sells soft drinks to earn income. She has been in her business for years. With hard work and determination, her business prospered.  Veronique’s business is located in the east of the city of Kinshasa. She has previously received seven Hope RD Congo loans and has repaid them correctly.  With the next loan, she intends to purchase more prepaid cards and increase the inventory in order to reinforce her working capital. Currently, she makes US$11 in profit each day. Her ambition is to someday open a shop in her area. Veronique takes care of her two nephews.

loans.use: purchase more prepaid cards for her phone use business

loans.name: Marie C.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the KMDEC Pre-school – Moiwo Street, in Kenema city. This school was established in September 1960 by the Kenema District Educational Committee in order to produce quality education in the District. The school is staffed with 46 employees and has an enrollment for 1,230 pupils. 
 
Forty-six-year-old Marie C. C. is the leader of this group of teachers. Marie was born in Bonthe. She is married to a teacher and the couple has four children: two in primary school, one in secondary school and one in college. Marie has been serving in the teaching profession for 26 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to pay her daughter’s college fees.

loans.use: To pay her daughter’s college fees

loans.name: Dania
