texts.ar: دانيا مطلقة لها 3 اولاد عمرها 34 سنة تعمل في بيع الالبسة الجاهزة الولادية والنسائية من منزلها لها في عملها 13 سنة تعمل من اجل تأمين العيش الكريم لها ولأفراد عائلتها تريد لهم العيش الجيد والمستقبل الجيد تريد تعليم اولادها بشكل يؤمن لهم مستقبل جيد فهي ام اكثر اهتمام لها هو اولادها خاصة انها هي من تعيلهم لها اهتمام مميز بالعائلة خاصة انها امرأة مطلقة تعتمد على ذاتها في تطوير نفسها واولادها فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى دفع الاقساط المدرسية لأولادها حتى يتمكنوا من متابعة مسيرتهم التعليمية خاصة انها هي لم تستطع ان تكمل تعليمها فهي تحلم بتحقيق هذا لأولادها لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها حيث انها تتميز بالاسعار الجيدة والنوعية الجيدة تطمح بفتح محل  لها خاصة انها تبيع الملابس في منزلها يضم عدد كبير من البضاعة
texts.en: Dania is divorced and has three children. She is 34 years old and makes a living by selling women's and children's clothes from her house. She has 13 years of experience in this line of work. She works in order to secure a respectable life for herself and for the members of her family. She wants them to have a good life and a good future. She wants to provide them with an education that will grant them a good future, as she is a mother and her biggest concern in life is her children. Furthermore, she is the one who provides for her children. She also has a particularly strong concern for her family because she is a divorced woman who must rely on herself to improve her and her children's lives. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to pay for her children's school tuition fees so that they can continue their education. She herself was not able to complete her education, and her dream is to enable her children complete their education. She has customers from her community and from among her neighbors as she stands out in her field due to her good prices and the quality of the items in her store. She aspires to open her own store since she is currently running her business out of her home and has many items for sale.

loans.use: pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel de 47 años de edad, tiene casa propia de material rústico, la cual cuenta con agua y luz, ubicada en el Caserío Huaca Blanca a 10 minutos  del distrito de San José y a unos 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Esta zona rural se dedica a la pesca, ganadería y agricultua.

Manuel desde hace 4 años se dedica a la ganadería,actualmente cuenta con 3 vacas que ordeña diariamente  para obtener leche fresca y poder venderla a otros recolectores de leche, los cuales se encargan de vender la al  por menor o mayor .  Las ganacias que obtenga es para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.

Debido ha la falta de agua , el pasto se ha escaseado en la zona para que pueda alimentar a su ganado vacuno (vaca), por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales los invertirá en la compra de forraje (pasto natural) y alfalfa para su ganado y de esa manera tener una mejor producción de leche, para ofertarlo a un buen precio con la finalidad de pagar su préstamo y que su negocio cresca.

Manuel es conicido en la zona por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable y con el fin de que algún día pueda tener su propio establo con mucho ganado.
texts.en:
Manuel is 47 years old he has his own home made of rustic materials and has running water and electricity; it is located in Caserío Huaca Blanca and is some 10 minutes from the district of San José and 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. In this rural area most of the residents work in fishing, cattle breeding and agriculture.

For 4 years, Manuel has raised cattle, currently he has 3 cows that he milks daily to have fresh milk and sells it to other milk collectors who sell theirs retail or wholesale. The earnings that he gets are to cover his daily expenses.

Due to the lack of water, the grass has gotten scarce in the area and it's a problem to feed his cows which is why he needs a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will be used to buy fodder (natural grass) and alfalfa for his cattle, this will allow him to have better milk production and sell it at a good price with the goal of paying back his loan and seeing his business grow.

Manuel is known in his area for being a hardworking, responsible person and hopes to one day have his own stable with a lot of cattle.

loans.use: buy food (fodder and alfalfa) for his cattle.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is from the village of Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 33 years old. Josefa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josefa owns & operates a fishing business harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josefa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Luis Ricardo

texts.pt:
Natural da Provincia da Inhambane. Foi a escola ate 8 classe, casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 7 anos. Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo para procurar emprego e vem a iniciar seu negocio no distrito de Namaacha onde tem sua residencia fixa, e na ponta de ouro vem a procura de melhor mercado para desemvolver o seu negocio estando ospedado em casa do seu primo. 
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na zona turistica da ponta do ouro no distrito de  Matutuine. Do seu negocio consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adesma apartir de conversas com seus primos e amigos e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
Tornou se cliente da Hluvuku-Adesema apartir do dia 04 de Abril de 2011 ate o presente ano de 2011.  O primeiro financiamento no valor de 13.000,00Mts foi para compra de creditos para venda. Com o presente emprestimo de 25.000,00Mts pretende continuar com a sua actividade( compra de recargas para celulares).
Tenciona ver  o seu negocio a crescer  e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
This client is from the Inhambane province.  He attended school until the 8th grade.  He is married and has two children, ages 3 and 7.  He left Inhambane for Maputo to look for work, and he started his own business in the Namaacha district where he established residence.  He came to Ponta D'Ouro in search of a better market for his business and stayed at his cousin's house. He currently lives and works in the tourist area of Ponta D'Ouro in the Matutuine district.  With his business he is able to feed his family and save a bit at the bank.  

He learned about Hluvuku-Adesma through conversations with his cousins and friends and decided to learn more about the process of becoming a client and benefiting from loans to help him with his projects. He became a client of Hluvuku-Adesma on April 4, 2011 and he is a current client.  His first loan was for 13.000.00 for the purchase of cell phone minutes for sale.  With this loan of 25.000.00 he plans to continue with this activity (purchasing cell phone minutes). 

He is anxious to see his business grow and for that purpose he will count on Hluvuku-Adesma for additional loans.

loans.use: to purchase cell phone minutes

loans.name: Marisel

texts.es: Marisel lives with her husband and three children in the Choluteca region of Honduras. For the last 16 years, Marisel has made and sold bread out of her home. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which to buy ingredients for making bread. In her free time Marisel enjoys attending church.
texts.en: Marisel lives with her husband and three children in the Choluteca region of Honduras. For the last 16 years, Marisel has made and sold bread out of her home. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which to buy ingredients for making bread. In her free time Marisel enjoys attending church.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase cornmeal, eggs, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 35 years old has eight children. Four of them are getting their education while the youngest one has not started her education yet. Her eldest son has completed his graduation and started making boots. Her second and third sons also work with their eldest brother in making boots. 

In order to pay the education fees of her children, Allah Rakhi sews clothes for her neighboring clients and also sells clothes. She buys these clothes from the clothes markets and resells them to her local clients. The income she earns also enables her to pay her utility bills and other household expenses. 

Her husband operates a lathe machine. He is an expert at this work and has a good number of clients who trust in his work and give him good money for it. 

Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because she wants to expand her business of selling clothes. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk that will allow her to offer more variety to her clients and also minimize her cost of purchasing and traveling. 

She has eight years of experience in her business and is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to it and improve the financial condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: La Carrera Group

texts.es:
El grupo de la Carrera se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Dotegiare, San Felipe del progreso, es una comunidad totalmente de origen Mazahua,la comunidad es grande y esta en las faldas de un monte, para llegar al lugar hay que caminar mucho, aunque si hay una carretera en buen estado no pasa el servicio de taxi o de camion, la gente platica que es muy normal para ellos caminar mucho para salir o entrar a su comunidad, ya se acostumbraron y tampoco se les hace retirado el camino, la actividad economica de la comunidad es la agricultura ó comercio ya que crian animales como borregos, puercos, pollos y guajolotes para poderlos vender, es manera de poder tener ingresos extras mas que nada de las señoras ya que los hombres salen a trabajar y muchos de ellos se van a la ciudad de México en busca de un trabajo, En el grupo de la carrera se encuentra la representante y ella nos platica sobre su negocio, la señora se llama Victoria y su negocio es vender verduras, vende calabaza, zanahorias, flor de calabaza, nopales, chayotes, cilantro, cebolla etc; la señora tiene poco mas de 4 años que se animo a vender verdura en su comunidad, no tiene un lugar estable en el que pueda estar vendiendo, lo que hace es andar caminando casa por casa para ofrecer su mercancia, y se le dificulta mucho la caminada y andar cargando la verdura, tambien que le calcula en el peso para poder dar los kilos, pero muchas veces la gente siempre le pide mas porque dice que le falta para completar el kilo, son estas las cosas que en ocasiones desaniman a la señora de seguir con el negocio, la señora Victoria piensa invertir el crdito en comprar mas verdura para salir a vender y tener un poco mas de ganancias y tambien utilizar las cosas que no se vendan para que ella pueda hacer su comida en casa, le gustaria mucho a la señora tener un local propio para vender varias cosas y hacer una tienda grande dejar de caminar y estar en su casa con su negocio, doña Victoria tiene 3 hijos que van a la escuela, tiene 37 años y 14 años de casada, vive con su familia en casa propia y su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de México.El resto de los integrantes se llaman;
1.-Maria Angela, ella cria y venta de borregos y pollos
2.-Maria Bonifacia hace bordados y servilletas
3.-Fidelina tiene una tienda de abarrotes
4.-Alejandra hace servilletas, cose y tambien sabe bordar
5.-Julia, cria y vende borregos
6.-Ernestina, cria pollos y guajolotes
7.-Noe, cria borregos para vender
8.-Maria sabe bordar y vende manteles
9.-Abel tiene una tienda en su comunidad de abarrotes
Son 10 integrantes del grupo de la carrera y se nombraron así por una comunidad que esta muy cerca de la de ellos y les gusta mucho ese nombre, es la razón por la que desidieron ponerle este nombre a su grupo
texts.en:
The “La Carrera” group is located in the community of Dotegiare, San Felipe del Progreso, a community that’s totally Mazahua.  The community is large and located on the skirts of a mountain.  To get to it one must travel quite a bit.  Although there is a highway in good condition there is no taxi or bus service.  People relate that it’s quite normal for them to walk quite a bit to get into or to leave their community.  However, they are now used to this and the road doesn’t even seem very long to them anymore.

The community’s economic activity is farming or commerce since they raise such animals as lambs, pigs, chickens and turkeys to sell.  This is a way of earning extra income more for the women than the men because the men to out to work and many of them go to México City to look for work.

The La Carrera group has a representative, Victoria, who tells us about her business.  Her business is selling vegetables.  She sells squash, carrots, squash blossoms, cactus paddles, chayote, cilantro, onions, etc.  It’s been a little more than four years now that she ventured to sell vegetables in her community.  She does not have a fixed location to sell so she does it going house to house to offer her merchandise.  It’s quite difficult for her to walk so much carrying her vegetables.  She also has to calculate the weight to sell by the kilo and often people insist on more because they claim the kilo is short.  These are the things that sometimes discourage her to continue with the business.

Victoria plans to use the loan to buy more vegetables to go out to sell and have a bit more profits and she uses the items she doesn’t sell to prepare her meals at home.  She’d very much like to have a locale of her own to sell several things and to have a large store in order to not have to be wandering about anymore and be able to stay at home with her business.

Victoria has three children going to school.  She’s 37 years old and has been married 14 years.  She lives wither family in her own house and her husband works in México City.

The rest of the group members are: 

1.-María Ángela, she raises sheep and chickens to sell
2.-María Bonifacia, she makes napkins and embroiders
3.-Fidelina, she has a grocery store
4.-Alejandra, makes napkins, sews and also knows how to embroider
5.-Julia, raises and sells sheep
6.-Ernestina, raises chickens and turkeys
7.-Noe, raises sheep to sell
8.-María, knows how to embroider and sells tablecloths
9.-Abel, has a grocery store in his community

There are 10 members in the La Carrera group and they named it that way after a community that’s very near them and they like the name very much; that’s why they decided to name their group that.

loans.use: to sell fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Lluvia Dorada De Ixtlahuaca Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Lluvia Dorada" y se ubica en el estado de México. La comunidad se distingue porque una de las actividades productivas que predominan en el lugar es el de la Agricultura, ganadería y comercio de telas, ropa. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes y es la segunda vez que solicita un prestamo. La señora Irene es integrante de este grupo. Ella es originaria de la comunidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes; sus clietes la prefieren por su buen servicio y amabilidad que tiene con la gente. Quiere este prestamo para comprar enlatados, refrescos y productos de limpieza. Ella comenta que su negocio le permite salir adelante y buscar una mejor estabilidad economica con el esfuerzo de sobresalir hacer mas grande su negocio y meter mas variedad en sus productos. Esto le permite continuar inviertiendo para ir creciendo poco a poco, ya que con su esposo luchan para salir en su economia familiar. Observaciones la señora que salio volteada se llama Norma y la señora Victoria.
texts.en:
This group is called "Lluvia Dorada" (Golden Rain) and it is located in the State of Mexico.  The local community is noted for its main business activities which are farming, livestock raising and selling fabrics and clothes.

This group has 11 members and this is the second time they have requested a loan.  Irene is a member of the group.  She is originally from this community and her business is selling groceries.  Her customers prefer to buy from her because of the good customer service she provides and the kindness that she shows people.  She would like this loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks and cleaning products.  She says that her business allows her to get ahead in life and seek better financial stability.  She makes efforts to do well, increase the size of her business and stock it with a greater variety of products.  This enables her to continue investing so that her business grows gradually.  Irene and her husband work hard to improve their family's financial situation.

n.b. The lady who is turned around in the picture is called Norma.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks and cleaning products

loans.name: Chemanai Group

texts.en: Emily is 49 years old and lives in Gweru. She is widowed with five children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. She is fortunate to benefit from financial support from her older children.  Emily runs a hair salon. The business has been in operation for 7 years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of sufficient working capital. Emily has requested a loan of $400 to buy hair products such as weaves. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to expand her business. In the future, Emily plans to have a fully operational boutique.

loans.use: to buy weaves for the salon

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Lucia   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicios
 
La señora Lucia indica que es el segundo año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos de movilidad, que viene trabajando hace diez y siete años atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de unos repuestos de movilidad) que compra de la distribuidora y posterior lo comercializará en su puesto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene siete hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.

En la fotografía no aparese la sseñora Carmen, ya que se fue a consulta médica
texts.en:
The “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” Communal Bank is starting its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Regional Office. It has eight members and is directed by a board of directors headed by Señora  Lucia. The members' businesses are varied and include: trade, production, and services.

Señora Lucia says that this is her second year in a Pro Mujer communal bank. She joined at the invitation of a promoter. She currently has a business  dealing with spare parts for vehicles. She has had this business for seventeen years.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her merchandise (with the purchase of vehicle spare parts) which she purchases from a distributor and then sells in her stall. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family where possible, as she is in a common-law marriage and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes everything.

Señora Carmen is not in the photo, as she was at a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Bladimir Yvan

texts.es: El Sr. Bladimir  trabaja en el transporte público, como taxi libre, pertenece al sindicato mixto de Transportistas de la línea de taxi trufis en la ciudad de Cochabamba, tiene una experiencia superior a 5 años en el rubro y es conocido en la línea por el buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes. Vive en casa propia, tiene dos hijos pequeños,  el es separado pero visita a sus hijitos cada fin de semana. El crédito es para mantenimiento de su vehículo, el deseo del Sr. Bladimir es el poder pasar mas tiempo con sus hijitos ya que son lo mas importante para el por eso el trabaja para darles bienestar y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Bladimir works in public transport as an independent taxi-driver.  He belongs to the Transportation union for the Trufis taxi route in the city of Cochabamba.  He has more than five years of experience in this field, and is well-known on the route for his good service that he provides his customers.

He lives in his own home, and has two small children.  He is separated, but visits his kids every weekend.

The loan is for maintenance of his vehicle.  Señor Bladimir's desire is to be able to spend more time with his kids, as they are the most important thing in his life, and this is why he works to for their well-being and to improve the quality of life for his whole family.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Isla Negra Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Isla Negra” lo conforman 18 socios quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía y venta de ropa. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de San Antonio.
Ana Luisa integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, sentada en el lugar del medio, su cabello es negro y largo, además viste un sweater color gris y sostiene una cartera de color café en las piernas.
Se dedica a vender artesanía desde hace 12 años, sus productos son pinturas, letras, aros, collares y ropa. Ella misma se dedica a la elaboración de productos de artesanía en vidrio y también compra productos a otros artesanos conocidos. Ella vende en una feria artesanal.
Con el crédito comprará vidrio para trabajar en vitrofusión, que es el arte de modelar el vidrio a grandes temperaturas. Además comprará ceniceros, copas de diferentes estilos, vasos de diferentes tamaños, chicos y grandes.
Las metas en su negocio son generar cierta exclusividad con los productos que pueda realizar y que además sean productos de calidad. 
Ana Luisa vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad.
Sus sueños son ampliar el local que atiende en la feria artesanal. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece se ha unido y están cada vez más comprometidos. 
San Antonio es un puerto de la región de Valparaíso, siendo esta una de sus principales características, ubicado en el litoral central de Chile. Se desarrolla en forma importante la pesca y venta de pescados y mariscos. Pese a la actividad portuaria y comercial del puerto, existe un alto índice de cesantía.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Isla Negra" and is made up of 18 members who are involved in many different lines of work, including selling artesanal crafts and clothes. All of them live in the city of San Antonio.

Ana Luisa is a member of this community bank and can be seen in the photo sitting in the middle of the first row. She has long black hair and she is wearing a grey jumper and holding a brown bag on her lap. She has been selling artesanal crafts including paintings, letters, earrings, necklaces and clothing for twelve years. She makes her own artesanal products out of glass and also purchases products from other well-known artisans, going on to sell these products at the artesanal fair.

With this loan Ana Luisa will purchase glass so she can work in the glass fusion style, which is the art of styling glass at high temperatures. She will also buy ashtrays, cups in various styles and vases in different sizes, both large and small. Her business goals are to sell her artesanal works exclusively, and to create quality products. 

Ana Luisa lives with her husband and her two children who are 17 and 12 years of age. Her dream is to expand the market stall that she operates at the artesanal fair. Ana Luisa is very happy and grateful for the services offered by Fondo Esperanza as it will allow her to invest in her business and generate larger profits. She says that the community bank that she belongs to is very united and the group is becoming more and more committed to each other. 

San Antonio is one of the main traditional port towns in the Valparaíso region and is located on the central coast of Chile. It has become a very important town for fishing and selling fish and seafood. Because of the commercial activity on the dock of the port, there is also a high unemployment rate.

loans.use: to purchase glass, ashtrays, cups in various styles and vases in different sizes, both large and small.

loans.name: Ayidokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOKPO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Julienne Assiba, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Julienne Assiba est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Raphaël. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Julienne Assiba a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a environs cinq ans, Julienne Assiba mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (maïs, biscuits, cartes de recharges téléphoniques) et des friperies de façon secondaire. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Julienne Assiba achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Julienne Assiba sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOKPO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Ayidokpo group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, whose name is Julienne Assiba, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the first time that this group has sought financial aid from Alidé, and their aim is to increase their business volume. Julienne Assiba is 47 years old and married to an entrepreneur named Raphaël. The couple has four children, all at school and in their care. The couple lives with their children and together provide for the family's needs. Julienne Assiba left school at secondary level. For around five years she has been selling a variety of products (corn, biscuits, telephone recharge cards) as well as selling second-hand clothing as a secondary activity. This business allows her to respond to her family's needs without any great difficulty. Julienne Assiba buys her products in Benin. With a view to responding better to customer demand, she is requesting a first loan from Alidé together with the other members of the Ayidokpo group.

loans.use: to buy corn and second-hand clothing

loans.name: Tolgonai's Group

texts.en:
Tolgonai is the leader of this group. She is 25 and married to a private entrepreneur. Together with her husband she brings up a three-year-old daughter who goes to kindergarten. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 35000 soms, Tolgonai started to breed livestock and resell it after fattening. Her monthly profit from reselling livestock is about 8000 soms. This profit made it possible for her to purchase three horses for breeding. With the loan Tolgonai wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and resale.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Johnfryl

texts.en:
Johnfryl is single. He is 20 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Mis Occ., Philippines. 

To earn a living, Johnfryl has a "buy & sell" business. He has had this business for one year. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 6,000. He has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase electronics equipment for his electronics repair shop. 

Johnfryl has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Johnfryl hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase electronics equipment for his electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. Prossy has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for seven years and works six days a week, selling her products at the market.

Prossy has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more used clothes for resale. Her main business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing used clothes and to own a delivery van.

Prossy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married to a farmer and has three children.  She sells soap and maize at Kwahinkrom, which she has been doing for 10 years. Lucy assists her husband in providing for their family. 

Lucy is requesting a loan to purchase boxes of soup and maize. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soup and maize.

loans.name: San Antonio De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “San Antonio D. Jicamarca” es un grupo que lleva 4 meses trabajando con el Programa- Prosperidad, está conformado por 11 socios entusiastas, donD. la Sra. Virginia es una D. las  integrantes. Virginia tiene 62 años D. edad es casada y tiene 08 hijos actualmente sigue apoyando a 06 D. ellos. Virginia empezó trabajando en una hacienda donD. se dedicaban a la crianza D. cerdos y siembra D. gras, pues fue  ahí donD. nació la idea D. independizarse  para  seguir estas actividades, con los conocimientos y  la experiencia que adquirió trabajando inicio su propio negocio, actualmente se dedica a crianza D. cerdos y siembra D. gras, gracias a dichas actividades le han permitido seguir apoyando a sus hijos en su educación, también nos manifiesta  que se dedica a la labranza (producción D. ladrillos) obteniendo así un ingreso mas para su hogar. El deseo D. Virginia es que sus hijos sean profesionales. En esta oportunidad solicito el préstamo para comprar comida balanceada para sus cerdos. La Alcancía Comunal “San Antonio D. Jicamarca” agradecen el crédito brindado. Sonia y Daria no pudieron estar presente  por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en: The communal bank “San Antonio D. Jicamarca” is a group that has been working with Programa-Prosperidad for 4 months.  The group has 11 enthusiastic members, and Virginia is one of them.  Virginia is 62 years old, married, and has 8 children, 6 of whom she continues to support.  Virginia started out working on a farm where she raised animals and cultivated pasture grass.  This is where she got the idea that she could work independently,  using the knowledge and experience that she got from working to start up her own business.  Now she has a business raising pigs and cultivating pasture grass.  Thanks to these activities she has been able to continue to support her children in their education.  In addition, she tells us that she also works as a brickmaker (making bricks), and in this way she can make even more income for her household.  Virginia wants her children to become professionals.  At this time, she requests a loan to buy balanced feed for her pigs.  The communal bank “San Antonio D. Jicamarca” is grateful for the loan that is being provided.  Sonia and Daria could not be present in the photo because they had to work.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her pigs

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta, así como alegre y amable, es conviviente con Santos quien es militar en actividad, fruto de esa unión tiene dos hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, habitando una linda casa de su propiedad que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que tiene Laura consiste en el alquiler de vehículos trimóviles conocidos como mototaxi, se inició con un capital propio fruto de los ahorros con su pareja, comprando 01 mototaxi y buscando una persona responsable para que conduzca, lo encontraron entre sus vecinos, quien diariamente le entrega un pago de S/. 30.00 nuevos soles por el alquiler del vehículo. De esa manera fue ahorrando y logró comprar otro mototaxi que lo alquila a otro vecino a quien considera una persona responsable. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es el ingreso económico adicional que le genera, además de ver aumentar su capital, sin embargo lo que no le gusta es cuando llueve, pues sus vehículos se llegan a malograr. Por otro lado tiene planes de seguir creciendo y ahora quisiera ampliar su casa y hacer habitaciones para alquilarlo a personas solteras. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, está agradecida por el apoyo para avanzar con su negocio, por ello se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo juntará con un capital propio que tiene y comprará un nuevo mototaxi para ampliar su flota, a un costo de 4500 nuevos soles al contado.
texts.en:
Laura, 34, is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman. She is also happy and friendly. She lives with Santos who is in active service for the military. They have two children, ages 14 and 9, and live in a lovely house that they bought through a lot of hard work. 

Laura rents vehicles known as mototaxis. She started with savings from her husband, buying one mototaxi and looking for a responsible driver. She found one of her neighbors who pays her 30 nuevos soles per day to rent the vehicle. This way she was able to save and buy second mototaxi that she rents to another neighbor who she considers to be responsible. What she likes about her business is the additional income that it generates, as well as watching her capital increase. She doesn't like when it rains because her vehicles break down. She has plans to keep growing and now wants to make her house bigger and build rooms to rent to singles. 

This will be her 4th loan with MFP. She's grateful for the support in advancing her business. She promises to make her payments on time, as she has with past loans. With the 1500 nuevos soles that she requested, she will add it to her own money to buy a new mototaxi to increase her fleet, which will cost her 4500 nuevos soles in cash.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: María Matilde

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años, es una persona responsable en su trabaja, felíz, luchadora y con muchas gans de sacar adelante a sus hijos. María vive con sus cuatro hijas en Otavalo, Provincia de Imbabura.

María trabaja sola en la confección de anacos (faldas de vestimenta indígena), este es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos y en este negocio hay mucha competencia, por eso vió la necesidad de realizar su primer crédito en Fodemi ya que quiere invertir en Tela para que incremente su producción y ofrecer un precio competitivo en el mercado, proceso que ayudará a María a cubrir las necesidades de sus hijas en cuanto a alimentación y estudio, también podrán mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de María es poder dar la educación a todas sus hijas.
texts.en:
María, 32, is a responsible person at work.  She is happy and tenacious and very much wants to move her children forward.  María lives with her four daughters in Otavalo, Imbabura Province.

María works alone making ‘anacos’ (traditional, indigenous skirts) and this is her only source of income to support her children.  There is a lot of competition in this business and this is why she needed to take out her first Fodemi loan to buy fabric to increase production and offer a competitive market price, a process that will help María cover her daughters’ needs with respect to food and schooling; they will also be able to improve their quality of life.  María’s dream is to be able to provide schooling for all of her daughters.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: La señora Yanet  se desempeña como Diseñadora de alta costura, profesión que fue  aprendiendo  de su madre y estudios que realizo en escuelas de costura para perfeccionar su trabajo. Yanet cuenta con su propio taller de costura en su propia vivienda en un local especialmente para realizar sus trabajos. En este momento quiere comprar la materia prima como lo es tela, hilos, agujas, botones y más, porque aparte de que los clientes le solicitan alguna costura también hace algunos diseños para vender. Los trabajo que mas realiza son vestidos de novia y quince años, trajes, sacos, bastillas y demás variedad. Yanet y su esposo tienen una hija por la que quieren que tenga un mejor patrimonio y un buen estudio por lo que trabajan mucho para lograr su objetivo
texts.en: Yanet works as a high-fashion designer, a profession which she learned over time from her mother and from courses she took at dressmaking schools in order to perfect her work. Yanet has her own tailoring workshop, located within her home in an area specially set up for her to carry out her work. At this time she would like to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, buttons and other items, because apart from the orders she receives from her customers, she also creates some designs to sell. The work she does most includes making wedding dresses, dresses for 15th birthday parties, suits and suit jackets, hemming garments, and a variety of others. Yanet and her husband have a daughter, for whom they would like to provide a better start in life and a good education. For this reason, they work hard to achieve their goal.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en: Although he has received no formal education, Ekow is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling cassava and charcoal in Asebu (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Ekow is married and has four children. His wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go toward helping him cover the family’s general expenses and paying the children’s school fees. Ekow wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell more cassava and charcoal. In the long term, Ekow plans to reinvest future profits in his business, thus helping him expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels, which will allow him to sell more cassava and charcoal.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet Hawa. She is 34 years old and from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is single with no child for now. In 2003, Hawa established her retails business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase more toothpaste, cream, and shirt to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and grow her business. In the future, Hawa plans to open a food stand table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, cream, and shirt to expand her business

loans.name: Ieng

texts.en:
Ieng is 53 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. One of her child is with her in the photo.

To make a living, she plants watermelon and groundnuts and her husband climbs palm trees. One of her children is employed. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to purchase two cows for plowing. This loan helps her in rice cropping. In the future, she hopes that two of her children can earn higher educations.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for plowing.

loans.name: Mahouklo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUKLO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même localité. Afiavi Balvina, la représentante de ce groupe est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Afiavi Balvina est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Théodore. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Afiavi Balvina vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afiavi Balvina a fréquenté l’école et s'est arrêté au niveau primaire. Depuis dix ans, Afiavi Balvina vend des tissus par la méthode de distribution dans sa région. Afiavi Balvina s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Afiavi Balvina désire obtenir un financement auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUKLO.
texts.en: The Mahouklo Group consists of three people who live in the same area. Afiavi Balvina, the representative of this group, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Afiavi Balvina is 32-years old and married to a driver named Theodore. The couple have two children, all attending school, who are in their care. In addition to their kids, they also have two other children in their care. Afiavi Balvina lives together with her husband and her children. Together, the couple take care of the various household expenses. Afiavi Balvina attended primary school.  For the past 10 years, Afiavi Balvina has been selling fabric in her region.  Afiavi Balvina stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business and to better respond to customer demand, Afiavi Balvina wishes to obtain a loan from Alide, together with the other members of Mahouklo Group.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Dimitar

texts.en:
Dimitar R. is 60 years old. His whole professional life was in the field of catering. After he retired two years ago he decided to start a little business. He rented a hall on Municipal Building of the city and found a coffee and refreshments bar.

Clients of his bar are all the municipal officials, official guests and many casual visitors. Dimitar R. needs a new professional coffee making machine and some kitchen equipment. He applies for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: For a new coffee machine and kitchen equipment

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: I am a widow, a mother of 4. I sell cassava to earn a living. I will use the money to expand my business to other quarters in order to meet the demands of my family.

loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Wilde

texts.en:
Wilde makes cheeses with the help of his wife and sells them in busy markets in El Alto City. He also builds furniture out of metal. Both activities are his main sources of income to support his 2 sons, ages 8 and 3. He lives in Achica Baja community in Ingavi province, located in La Paz (2 hours away from La Paz city). Wilde will use the loan to buy another milk cow, so he can make more cheeses. This is Wilde's second loan; due to his duly and timely payments, he is qualified to request for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Wilde, trabajo con su esposa en la elaboración de quesos de leche de vaca para comercializarlos en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto, también se dedica a la Cerrajería (Muebles de Metal), estas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingresos para la manutención de sus 2 hijos de 8 y 3 año de edad. Vive en la Comunidad Achica Baja de la Provincia Ingavi de La Paz (a 2 horas de la Ciudad d La Paz) El destino del crédito es para la compra de vaca lechera que le ayudara a producir mayor cantidad de queso. Es el segundo crédito, el buen comportamiento de pago del anterior le faculta para solicitar otro préstamo.

loans.use: Capital de inversion

loans.name: Glenda

texts.es:
Descripción del Negocio // Business Description

Glenda inicio su negocio hace 12 años. Vende ropa, bisutería, cuadernos y regalos. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 7am-a -10pm. Su negocio se mantiene gracias a la experiencia obtenida en el manejo y calidad de productos que Glenda ofrece a sus clientes.

Glenda began her business 12 years ago. She sells clothes, notebooks, gifts and imitation jewelry. She attends to her clients everyday from 7:00am to 10:00pm. Her business is in existence, thanks to Glenda’s client service and product quality.

Uso del Préstamo // Loan Use

Glenda necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de nuevos modelos de ropa. Así como también artículos de bisutería. Para poder ofrecer variedad en los productos que ofrece a su clientela.

Glenda needs the loan to buy new styles of clothes and costume jewelry and thus offer a wider variety of products to her clients.

Información Personal // Personal Information

Glenda tiene 23 años 1 hijo su esposo la abandono por lo que ella ve sola por su hijo. Razón por la cual Glenda se decidió iniciar este negocio para colaborar en la manutención de su hogar .Vive ocupando un espacio de la casa de su padre. Aspira mejorar su negocio e ingresos para seguir ayudando en su hogar y un día no muy lejano llegar a tener su propia casa.

Glenda is 23 years old and has one child. Her husband left her and she alone cares for her child. For this reason, Glenda decided to start this business to be able to support her household. She lives with her father. She hopes to improve her income to be able to help her family. She also hopes that in the future she will be able to have her own house.

loans.use: Comprar nuevos modelos de ropa // Purchase new styles of clothes

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Treasurer from the association Flor Naciente of Pro Mujer in Villa Adela, Mrs. Viviana Francisca I. collaborates with her concubine in the business of stone sculpting. This activity requires a lot of time and material. To help her partner, Viviana also works as a housekeeper. She invests all the money she makes in buying more sculpting tool, more stone and others where she makes baseboards, fountains and other handicrafts. She also buys machinery and replacements, but in this activity they have high costs. Because of this reason Viviana asks for a loan so she can buy the necessary tools and materials so she can keep working and meet the end of the year demands.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Tesorera de la asociación Flor Naciente de Pro Mujer en Villa Adela, Viviana Francisca I. colabora a su concubino en el negocio del tallado en piedra, actividad que requiere de tiempo y material adecuado. Para poder ayudar a su pareja Viviana trabaja como empleada doméstica. Todo el dinero que logra reunir invierte en la compra de material de tallado y corte de piedra laja, piedra comanche y otras en las que logra distintos trabajos, como ser zócalos, fuentes y principalmente artesanías. La compra de maquinaria y principalmente la compra de repuestos para esta actividad, tiene un costo elevado. Por tal motivo, Viviana precisa de dinero para poder comprar lo necesario para seguir trabajando y preparar su taller para la demanda de las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Viviana  precisa de dinero para poder comprar lo necesario para seguir trabajando y preparar su taller para la demanda de las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Senora Lidia is a part of the communal bank called Los Rosales. She has a business located in the district of San Martin de Alao, a province of El Dorado. She runs a business from her home selling various household items. This allows to take care of her children at the same time. She has been doing this for approximately 10 years, managing the day to day business while her husband helps by making contact with wholesale providers. Due to an illness, her husband is not able to move around very much.

With the recent loan received by Manuela Ramos for $833, which will be repaid in six payments, she will buy fertilizers in liters and bags, in order to take advantage of the growth in cultivation of coffee, cocoa and corn in the region. Her existing clients have been requesting these products, which is why she wants to make this investment.

Lidia is 37 years old and has 3 children, three girls and a boy. She has had an interest in business from a very early age, and she feels secure in her new investment. She has a lot of confidence in her ability to sell to her customers, especially with her charisma and the constant support of her husband to help grow the business and improve the living standard of their family. She feels her area is growing more every day, and she will be able to meet the needs of her customers.

La señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Rosales, tiene ubicado el negocio en el distrito de San Martín de Alao, provincia de El Dorado, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar (variados), su local se encuentra ubicado en su propia casa, lo que le permite atender a sus hijos y su negocio a la ves, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años aproximadamente. Ella es la que administra el negocio y su esposo es el que apoya con el contacto con los proveedores mayoristas, debido a que su esposo tiene una enfermedad que no le permite movilizarse demasiado. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ($ 833.00) el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará agroquímicos en litros y sacos, para aprovechar las campañas de café, cacao y maíz que se han incrementado en áreas de cultivos por la zona, son los mismos clientes los que le han solicitado la venta de esos producto, es por eso que en esta oportunidad desea invertir en ese rubro. Lidia tiene 37 años y 03 hijos, dos mujeres y 01 varón, a ella le gustaba el negocio desde muy temprana edad, es por eso que se siente con seguridad cuando tiene que decidir la compra de productos porque confía mucho en su capacidad de convencimiento hacia sus clientes, además del carisma que posee y el constante apoyo de su esposo por sacar adelante el negocio y la familia. Siente que su localidad esta creciendo cada vez más y que ella es un aporte para satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FERTILIZERS TO MEET THE REQUESTS OF HER CUSTOMERS AND EXPAND THE SALES OF HER SMALL SHOP.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en: I am Ghazala B.. I am married and a mother of three. My eldest daughter is in kindergarten, but my other two children are not of school age yet. My husband operates a fruits business in a nearby fruit market. I am a seamstress. I create dresses on order from various clients. My husband wants to expand his fruits business and to do this requires a loan of $200.

loans.use: Expand her husband's fruits business

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is a very hard-working, honest woman. Every morning she leaves her home to walk the city streets selling her delicious desserts. She walks to sell her desserts because she does not have enough capital to rent a comfortable, safe business locale. Many times Graciela's work provides the only income for her dear family since her husband does temporary jobs. Through her work, this hard-working woman wants to improve her two small children's way of life, and this is why she is asking for your generous help. The amount she is asking for will be used to buy more containers and ingredients so she can continue making her delicious desserts. Let's make Graciela's request happen so that she can reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela, es una dama muy trabajadora y honrada. Todas las mañanas abandona su pequeña morada para desplazarse por las calles de su ciudad ofertando sus deliciosos postres; realiza esta actividad de esta forma debido a que no cuenta con un capital suficiente que le permita alquilar un espacio cómodo y seguro ya que muchas veces esta actividad es la única fuente de ingresos económicos de su querida familia; debido a que su esposo se desempeña en trabajos eventuales.Esta trabajadora mujer desea incrementar el nivel de vida de sus dos pequeños con su labor y por esta razón acude en búsqueda de la ayuda de tu bondadoso corazón a fin de obtener la cantidad que solicita para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de recipientes e ingredientes para seguir produciendo sus deliciosos postres.Posibilitemos su petición para que Graciela consiga su propósito.

loans.use: More capital will help increase production.

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema S. is the leader of a group of five entrepreneurial women in the small town of Chichawatni, Pakistan. "I completely trust all of my group members and being their group leader gives me a sense of accomplishment," says Haleema, the mother of four young children.

Haleema wishes to divide a $1,125 loan among the women. With her share, she wants to repair the roof of her home, which is in dismal condition, and buy wood for her husband's business. He makes charpai beds, which are traditional day beds made of ropes strung between a wooden frame. Like Haleema, the four other members hope to develop business to improve their families' lives. Sajida will invest in her family's shoe business; Samina will help her husband's restaurant; Sharifan will put the money to her uncle's barber shop; and Zareena will open a restaurant for her sons.

loans.use: To buy wood for a furniture business

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 30 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, aged 11, 7, and 4. Mwanahawa owns a small shop, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

Mwanahwa has previously taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing in timber selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Stumai

texts.en:
Stumai is 28 years old and is a single mother with one child, age 11. Stumai owns a small salon, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her services.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.en:
“Dios es Amor” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations being a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level), the cold, the difficulty of growing crops and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Dios es Amor” is located at approximately 4,000 meters above sea-level, in the community of Pilpichaca, in the district with the same name, province of Huaytará. The main activities of the population are growing potatoes and wheat at lower altitudes, and raising sheep and alpaca in the higher areas. The area is known for alpacas and their wool production. Because of the high altituD., the area is not very suitable for agriculture, but the natural grass (pasture) makes it very favorable for raising alpacas and sheep. In the small town of Pilpichaca, on the main road from Huancavelica to the “Vía Libertadores” highway that connects Ayacucho with the coast and Peru´s capital, L., there are some shops and some produce cheese, but alpaca wool and meat production is the main activity.

Currently the bank is starting its first loan cycle with 19 female borrowers and a total loan of 4,400 soles (about 1,575 US$). Most of the loans are of 200 soles, with three exceptions of loans of 400 soles. As the group is just starting its first cycle, the group was not able to save, except for the initial loan to start. But all agree to save in the future.

One of the members of the community bank is Lourdes C. C.. Lourdes has a small grocery store where she also sells sweets. Her 200 soles loan she will use to fill up her small store again. During the breaks at the local school, she also sells sweets at the entrance of the school. In the future she hopes to be able to buy a house in a bigger city and run a business there. And like most women, she wants her children to be professionals when they leave college. In the shorter run she will be saving for her children’s education and to increase her business. Now that she has entered in FINCA Peru, she wants to learn how to work more enthusiastically and responsibly and how to save.

Victoria S. D. S. has her business of selling clothes at local weekly or biweekly markets. Other business she runs are buying and selling of cheese, trout and sheep. With her 200 soles loan she will buy new merchandise to go to the markets. Her dream for the future is to have a small restaurant and to grow little by little. Victoria will save for the education of her children and for her future restaurant. Now that she will be working with FINCA Peru, she hopes to save more. A neighbor, a member of FINCA in the city of Ayacucho, told her a lot about FINCA, especially about the savings, and maD. Victoria very interested. Besides that , she will work more responsibly and receive trainings like practicing values and how to care for herself.

loans.use: Buy new supplies

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
Bacilia earns a living by sowing vegetables in the fields, which she inherited from her very loving parents. Her children and husband are also very engaged in this, working endless hours every day looking after the vegetables with the objective of getting the expected yields at harvest time. The wish of this selfless mother is to optimize the cultivation time, and to buy natural fertilizer for the final stages of cultivation.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Bacilia, gracias al apoyo de sus padres se dedica a sembrar vegetales en los campos de cultivo que ellos con mucho cariño le heredaron. Sus hijos y esposo también están muy vinculados con esta labor y a diario dedican interminables horas de trabajo y de cuidados a sus vegetales con el objetivo de obtener las ganancias que esperan durante la cosecha.El deseo de esta abnegada madre es optimizar el tiempo de cultivo y comprar abonos y fertilizantes naturales para los últimos días de cuidado.

loans.use: To buy tools and natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Savali

texts.en: 33 year old Savali S. is married, with five children.  She has worked in the BBQ business for many years, selling BBQ food to the general public three days per week. She earns a weekly net cash flow of 420 Tala (~175 USD).  SPBD loans are Savali’s only access to capital because she has not qualified for a loan from traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for her children's fees and the rest will be used to purchase chicken, sausages, banana, tomato sauce, cucumbers, plates, tissues, and a gas bottle for her business. Savali has had one previous loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To improve business

loans.name: Concepción Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. A. M. is asking for a loan in order to purchase zinc and construction materials for finishing the kitchen in her home. She has worked for the past 8 years as a teacher in the school Rafaela Herrera. She has three children, the oldest of whom is 12 and studies in the 5th grade, the middle child 6 and in 1st grade, and the youngest three years old. Her husband works as a storekeeper, and both share household expenses. Despite being a family of humble background and economic means, they are very responsible people. Mrs. A. M. dreams that little by little she will be able to improve her home, have stable work, and that her children will continue their studies so that in the future they will be successful and not lack anything. She is asking for your support and has demonstrated that she is a responsible person with a great desire to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. A. M. está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en compra de zinc y para terminar de construir la cocina de su casa, labora como docente de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera desde hace ocho años, tiene tres hijos, el mayor de 12 años estudia su 5to grado de educación primaria, el otro de 6 años estudia su 1er grado y el menor de 3 añitos, su esposo trabaja como como comerciante, ambos comparten con los gastos familiares, a pesar que son una familia humilde y de escasos recursos económicos son muy responsables con sus deberes, su sueño es poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda, tener estabilidad laboral y que sus tres hijos estudien para que en el futuro sean personas de bien y así no les falte nada, solicitamos su apoyo ya que Concepción ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con gran espíritu de superación

loans.use: To purchase zinc and construction materials in order to finish a kitchen

loans.name: Lourdes Maria

texts.en:
Sra. Lourdes Maria M. B., 36 years old, lives with her parents and 30-year-old sister (who is co-signing for this loan) in Warnes, in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. Sra. M., a domestic employee in the city of Santa Cruz, and her sister, an elementary school teacher, have many years of experience in their respective jobs.

Sra. M. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to invest in opening up a tileworks shop, which she expects will increase her income.

This is Sra. M.'s third loan from AgroCapital. Her two previous loans were both repaid in full more than two years ago. She has no other debts in other financial institutions.

loans.use: To open a tileworks shop

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra. Angélica S. de Ojeda, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada hace más de 26 años con el Sr. Valentín Ojeda tienen 5 hijos tres ya mayores de edad y los otros en edad escolar.

Se habia casado muy joven y en busca de alternativa para salir adelante decidiò realizar la venta ambulante casa por casa de artesania y otros productos, su esposo le ayuda econòmicamente ya que viajo a la Argentina en busca de mejores oportunidades y obtener mejores ganancias para poder solventar los gastos que ocasionan los estudios y manuntenciòn de sus hijos.Gracias al ezfuerzo de los dos tienen casa propia y todas las comodidades

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas)
texts.en:
Angelica S. de Ojeda is 46 years old and she has been married for more than 26 years to Valentin Ojeda. They have 5 children, three of whom are of age, and the others are still in school.

She married when she was very young and while she sought out a way to get ahead she decided to start selling from house to house her crafts and other products. Her husband was supporting her financially and he was in a position to do so because he travelled to Argentina for better opportunities and to have a better income. He needed to be able to cover the schooling expenses and necessities of their children. Thanks to his efforts both of them have their own home equippped with all the facilities.

She requires a loan to purchase merchandise (hammocks, blankets, and bed linens).


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (duvets, blankets, table cloths, and bed linens)

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma Baji, married to A. A., lives in a small village called Kot Radha Kishan near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, in which she has been living for the last 20 years. Salma has three sons, the eldest of whom is in the 9th grade, the middle one - in the 7th grade, - while the youngest is still in kindergarten. Salma Baji’s husband earns money raising livestock: he buys buffalos and then re-sells them. Salma Baji is a housewife, taking care of the household and the family. She is currently applying for a loan to be able to purchase another buffalo for her husband's livestock business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a livestock business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene D. grew up in Butuan City, which is in the Caraga Region of the Philippines.  She now lives in the town of Lopez Jaena in the Misamis Occidental province with her husband Severino and their three children. They met each other when they were working in Manila City. When they decided to marry, they agreed to live in Severino’s hometown. Arlene’s primary income is from her “carinderia,” a mini eatery.  Severino is a carpenter. 

Arlene is one of the pioneer Paglaum Coop members. She joined when the program was introduced in Lopez Jaena in 1997. She has taken out five loans with this group.

Arlene lives near Mindanao State University-Lopez Jaena, which offers classes from the primary grades through high school. Many of her customers are students, teachers, and fisherfolks. Now Arlene is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 ($325 USD) so she can buy supplies for her carinderia and add new menu items that her customers have requested. 

Arlene is hoping that through this loan she can increase her income, enhance her carinderia, and purchase a door lock for the carinderia.  She also wants to buy a refrigerator so she won’t have to rent a freezer from her neighbor anymore.  The income from the carinderia is of great help to her family, especially in times when her husband has no work.  Arlene is very thankful for Paglaum. It has improved the quality of her family’s life.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her eatery

location.town: Plaridel-Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda M. R. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casada esta Señora tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen de ella su hija mayor tiene la edad 19 años y cursa recientemente el 5 año de secundaria, su hijo de 13 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria y su hija de 3 años cursa el 2 grado de primaria, su esposo labora como agricultor, en sus deseos esta obtener mas activo su negocio ya que la situación actual en la que el país se encuentra en una situación  muy difícil de sobrellevar, además en sus propósitos esta seguirle aportando ayuda a sus hijos ya que ellos necesitan tener un futuro lleno de estudios para que día de mañana puedan defenderse por si solos.

Su  actividad económica es una pulpería en la que vende los productos tales como: golosinas, granos básicos, hielo, bolsita, refrescos, pollo y licor, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación con la siguiente dirección colegio pureza de Maria 100 varas arriba, ella inicia este negocio por no tener un trabajo estable que le proporcionara ingresos para ella y su familia y decide implementar la venta de bolsitas y granos básicos al comienzo no vendía mucho estos productos razón por la que decide incrementar mas su negocio y decide colocar otro negocio de videojuegos y  surtir su pulpería con mas producto y así obtiene su propio lugar de trabajo siendo este el que le proporcione ingresos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de controles para los videojuegos y para su pulpería ya que tiene que ofrecer a sus clientes una amplia variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Yolanda M. R. is 49 years old, married, and has 7 children, 3 of whom depend on her. Her oldest daughter is 19 years old and she is in her 5th year of secondary school. Her son of 13 years is in 6th grade of primary school. Her 3 year old daughter is in 2nd grade of primary school. Her husband works as a farmer. Yolanda wishes to make her business more active, because the difficult situation in her country is hard to endure. Furthermore, she wants to continue to contribute help to her children, because they need to have a future that is full of studies, so that in the future they may survive on their own. Yolanda’s economic activity is a local store in which she sells products like candy, basic grains, ice, soft drinks, chicken, and liquor. Her business is located in her house that is located on Colegio Pureza de Maria 100 Varas Arriba. Yolanda started her business because she didn’t have a stable job as a source of income for her and her family, so she decided to begin the sale of shopping bags and basic grains. In the beginning, she didn’t sell a lot of these products, and so she decided to increase the size of her business and decided to invest in another business of video games and to stock up her store with more products. It is this way that she secured her own workplace that functions as her source of income for her family. This loan is to be used to buy controls for the videogames that she sells, and for her store, because she has to offer a large variety of products to her clients

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy video game controllers and to stock her store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 45-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their eight children. He has owned a grocery shop for 22 years. 

Ali requested a loan of 1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and a new table for his house.  This is his second loan and he has always paid on time.

Ali is successful in his work because he provides variety in his shop. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and a new table for his house.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 26 años de edad, hace 4 años vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos, por el momento viven en la casa de su suegros. Tiene un negocio de venta de muebles de segunda mano en un local alquilado. Los recuerdos de su infancia están en los campos de cultivo, hasta ahora realiza dicha actividad pero solo dos días  a la semana cuando es tiempo de cosecha de las frutas. La compra y venta de muebles usados es un negocio muy rentable, al terminar de cada venta llega a ganar hasta 700 soles, pero nos dice que en esta época sus ventas están bajas, entonces está cosechando los plátanos cada fin de semana, hasta que mejore la demanda de muebles. Aunque le gusta mucho estar en su tienda de muebles, Luis no descuida sus cultivos porque, para él, son para de su vida. Luis recién está aprendiendo sobre los bancos comunales, y está muy agradecido por ser parte de uno, este es su 1er préstamo, con el que se compromete a pagar las cuotas en las fechas programadas. El dinero que solicita es para el incremento de muebles usados y materiales como tiner y laca, que usa para dar brillo a cada mueble y pueda venderlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old and has lived with his partner, the mother of their two children, for four years. For now they live in his in-laws' home. He has a business selling secondhand furniture in a rented premises. His memories of childhood are in the fields, and until now he has done that wonderful activity but only two days a week when it is fruit harvest time. The purchase and resale of used furniture is a very profitable business. After each sale he can earn up to 700 soles ($225 USD), put he tells us that at this time his sales are down. Because of this he is harvesting bananas every weekend, until the demand for furniture improves. Although he really likes being in his furniture store, Luis does not fail to care for his crops because, for him, they are part of life. Luis has recently begun to learn about municipal banks, and is very thankful to be a part of one. This is his first loan, and he is committed to paying the installments on the arranged dates. The money that he asks for is to buy more used furniture and materials like paint thinner and lacquer, that he uses to polish every piece of furniture to be able to sell them at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his merchandise

loans.name: Wale

texts.en: Wale sells electronic spare parts. He is 45 years old and married with 3 children. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more electronic spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic spare parts to sell

loans.name: Sda Primary School, Makeni Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SDA (Seven Days Adventist) Primary School, Makeni. SDA Primary school, Makeni was founded in 1978 by SDA Makeni to use education as a vehicle for spreading the Adventist message. They train young boys in the morals and ethics of the Adventist Mission. Presently, the school has a population of fifty-six pupils and a staff of twelve teachers.

Presently, SDA Makeni suffers a number of constrains. First, they lack a water-well. The tap-head of the well they used to have has been stolen, forcing the children to fetch drinking water from the neighborhood. Second, SDA suffers from lack of sufficient benches and classrooms. They used to have sufficient benches, but rebels used all of those benches as firewood. Then Plan Sierra Leone (an NGO) provided them with new ones, only for people around the neighborhood to steal all of them again. Thus the children have to carry their own benches from home every day to school.

However, with the change of administration three months ago, SDA Primary school is revitalizing, thanks to the new headmaster, Mr. Benjamin Kamara (not part of this loan). The new administration is able to buy benches for classes five and six through school fees subsidies and development funds. The school has also been able to hire two security guards to keep thieves at bay. And for the first time in the history of the school, they will be organizing athletics for the pupils. This will give popularity and fame to the school.

With this loan, some of these teachers will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children in their education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.

Abdul K. K. (back row, second from right) is the leader of this group of teachers. Abdul was born in Mamamah, about 110 miles from Makeni. He is age forty-eight, married to a teacher and the two of them have two children. One of their children is in class four and the other is in class two. Abdul will invest his loan in business and he has been in business for over four years now.

loans.use: Invest in Business

loans.name: Noemia Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Noemia Carolina C. D. H. tiene 46 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito D. Trujillo,  provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta II ciclo D. Educación, carrera que abandono debido a que se caso y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar, tiene 02 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Noemia se dedica a la venta D. productos lácteos y productos D. belleza, empezó vendiendo productos D. belleza hace 10 años, con el tiempo se inicio en la venta D. productos lácteos negocio que era D. su madre y que al enfermarse se lo cedió y en el cual lleva 5 años. Asimismo hace 1 año se dedica a la crianza y venta D. pollo negocio que desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en la compra D. productos lácteos.  
Con el crédito D. 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. productos D. belleza para su stock y productos lácteos.
Noemia sueña con tener una ferretería y viajar a conocer el cuzco.
texts.en:
Mrs. Noemia Carolina C. D. H. is 46 and lives in Urb, in the El Cortijo sector in the district of Trujillo, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She completed secondary school, but she left that course because she got married and had to take care of her home. She has 2 children, but they are not economically dependent upon her. Noemia sells dairy products and beauty products. She started selling beauty products 10 years ago. She started selling dairy products 5 years ago when her mother became ill and gave her the business. One year ago she also started raising and selling chickens in her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she got from her community bank “Nuevo Perú” (New Peru), she bought dairy products. With a loan of 800 PEN, which she will repay in 6 months, she will increase her stock of beauty products and buy dairy products. Noemia dreams of having a hardware store and traveling to see “El Cuzco” (the historical capital of the Inca Empire).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 30-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Nader has been working in agriculture for fifteen years.
